4280680341,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/operatore-operatrice-di-sportello-at-e-on-italia-4280680341?position=4&pageNum=5&refId=M50o8nygvc%2BZBqm3b3KqpA%3D%3D&trackingId=l%2Fx%2FOvsUio4ZsRbrAzDm7g%3D%3D,Operatore/Operatrice di Sportello,E.ON Italia,"Carate Brianza, Lombardy, Italy","La nuova E.ON è uno dei maggiori operatori di reti energetiche e infrastrutture energetiche europee, oltre a fornire soluzioni avanzate per oltre 50 milioni di clienti. Siamo presenti in 15 paesi con oltre 75.000 dipendenti. Questo ci pone in una posizione ideale per aiutare a guidare la transizione energetica in Europa. Concentrandosi su due aree di crescita sostenibile, E.ON è pienamente dedicata alla fondamentale trasformazione del mondo dell'energia. Guideremo attivamente la transizione energetica in Europa come uno dei maggiori fornitori di servizi energetici in Europa. La combinazione delle competenze di entrambe le società renderà E.ON pioniera anche nello sviluppo di soluzioni energetiche nuove e innovative e attirerà le menti più brillanti del settore energetico.

Siamo alla ricerca di un/una Operatore/Operatrice di Sportello da inserire nel nostri punti vendita. Cerchiamo candidati e candidate appassionati/e di vendita e pronti/e a fare la differenza, entrando a far parte di una realtà dinamica in continua espansione. La persona selezionata sarà inserita all'interno dello sportello e risponderà al/alla coordinatore/coordinatrice d’area.
Principali responsabilità
Promuovere le campagne commerciali aziendali nel rispetto dei target assegnati
Offrire prodotti e servizi rivolti ai segmenti Residenziale, Piccole Partite IVA, Condomini per la sottoscrizione di nuovi contratti luce e gas
Presentare soluzioni energetiche, evidenziandone le opportunità per il Cliente e inserire a sistema la manifestazione di interesse per sopralluoghi tecnico-commerciali presso il Cliente
Raccogliere e verificare la documentazione obbligatoria per la gestione delle richieste del Cliente (contratti di attivazione, variazioni contrattuali, agevolazioni accise)
Svolgere attività di backoffice a supporto del corretto avanzamento delle pratiche inserite
Curare e supportare la relazione con il Cliente con un approccio “problem solving” e con l’obiettivo di migliorarne la soddisfazione
Fornire assistenza e informazioni al Cliente riguardo alle forniture di gas ed energia elettrica
Gestire le richieste di dilazione secondo le procedure aziendali
Qualifiche
Diploma o titolo di studio equivalente
Esperienze pregresse di vendita
Ottime capacità relazionali e orientamento al Cliente
Conoscenza degli applicativi MS Office (Excel, Word, Outlook)
Preferibile precedente utilizzo di sistemi CRM
Proattività, disponibilità e precisione
Capacità di analisi e problem solving
Attitudine al lavoro in team
Automuniti e disponibili a brevi spostamenti, anche presso altre sedi aziendali
Se sei convinto che questo sia il prossimo passo della tua carriera, registrati e candidati online.
Diamo forma insieme al futuro dell'energia!

Orario di lavoro: full-time di 38,5 ore settimanali dal lunedì al venerdì
Azienda: E.ON Energia S.p.A.
Area delle funzione: Sales

La nuova E.ON è uno dei maggiori operatori di reti energetiche e infrastrutture energetiche europee, oltre a fornire soluzioni avanzate per oltre 50 milioni di clienti. Siamo presenti in 15 paesi con oltre 75.000 dipendenti. Questo ci pone in una posizione ideale per aiutare a guidare la transizione energetica in Europa. Concentrandosi su due aree di crescita sostenibile, E.ON è pienamente dedicata alla fondamentale trasformazione del mondo dell'energia. Guideremo attivamente la transizione energetica in Europa come uno dei maggiori fornitori di servizi energetici in Europa. La combinazione delle competenze di entrambe le società renderà E.ON pioniera anche nello sviluppo di soluzioni energetiche nuove e innovative e attirerà le menti più brillanti del settore energetico.

Siamo alla ricerca di un/una Operatore/Operatrice di Sportello da inserire nel nostri punti vendita. Cerchiamo candidati e candidate appassionati/e di vendita e pronti/e a fare la differenza, entrando a far parte di una realtà dinamica in continua espansione. La persona selezionata sarà inserita all'interno dello sportello e risponderà al/alla coordinatore/coordinatrice d’area.

Principali responsabilità

  • Promuovere le campagne commerciali aziendali nel rispetto dei target assegnati
  • Offrire prodotti e servizi rivolti ai segmenti Residenziale, Piccole Partite IVA, Condomini per la sottoscrizione di nuovi contratti luce e gas
  • Presentare soluzioni energetiche, evidenziandone le opportunità per il Cliente e inserire a sistema la manifestazione di interesse per sopralluoghi tecnico-commerciali presso il Cliente
  • Raccogliere e verificare la documentazione obbligatoria per la gestione delle richieste del Cliente (contratti di attivazione, variazioni contrattuali, agevolazioni accise)
  • Svolgere attività di backoffice a supporto del corretto avanzamento delle pratiche inserite
  • Curare e supportare la relazione con il Cliente con un approccio “problem solving” e con l’obiettivo di migliorarne la soddisfazione
  • Fornire assistenza e informazioni al Cliente riguardo alle forniture di gas ed energia elettrica
  • Gestire le richieste di dilazione secondo le procedure aziendali


Qualifiche

  • Diploma o titolo di studio equivalente
  • Esperienze pregresse di vendita
  • Ottime capacità relazionali e orientamento al Cliente
  • Conoscenza degli applicativi MS Office (Excel, Word, Outlook)
  • Preferibile precedente utilizzo di sistemi CRM

4203316324,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-data-analyst-at-sorgenia-4203316324?position=5&pageNum=5&refId=M50o8nygvc%2BZBqm3b3KqpA%3D%3D&trackingId=0qp%2BtC4sSp1yS3l7wlbKyA%3D%3D,Business & Data Analyst,Sorgenia,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Dove lavorerai
Per la nostra sede di Milano cerchiamo candidati interessati ad un percorso professionale all'interno della Direzione Generation & Energy Management.
Su cosa lavorerai
La persona che stiamo cercando avrà la responsabilità per le seguenti attività:
analizzare i dati
identificare inefficienze di processo
proporre soluzioni e monitorare i progressi
collaborazione con le altre aree di business nei progetti di sviluppo di modelli, strumenti e applicazioni volti al continuo miglioramento dei processi.
Cosa può esserti utile per valutare se candidarti
Laurea in Informatica, Economia, Ingegneria materie STEM
Perfetta conoscenza del pacchetto Office
Gradita la conoscenza di strumenti di programmazione (R, Python, Qlik, ...)
Conoscenza dell’inglese
Spirito di iniziativa
Capacità di lavoro in team
Ottime capacità relazionali.
La tua sede di lavoro

Lavorerai nel nostro HQs di Milano in Via A. Algardi 4 insieme al resto del tuo team di riferimento. Ci impegniamo a favorire il tuo work-life balance e quindi avrai la possibilità, se lo desideri, di lavorare anche in modalità ibrida organizzandoti con il tuo team.
Sorgenia
Nati nel 1999, siamo una Green Tech Energy Company e oggi il principale operatore energetico privato nazionale.
Scopri di più su Sorgenia su www.sorgenia.it.
Cosa significa far parte di Sorgenia
Cerchiamo nuovi colleghi che, con spirito pionieristico e innovativo, siano pronti a gestire con proattività e concretezza progetti sfidanti contribuendo alla continua crescita di Sorgenia.
In Sorgenia offriamo l’opportunità di imparare ogni giorno attraverso percorsi di formazione continua e eventi interni informali
column2: siamo attenti al benessere delle nostre persone e per questo offriamo flessibilità oraria, smart working e una palestra aziendale se vuoi tenerti in forma.

4293746203,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-data-analyst-adkaora-at-mondadori-group-4293746203?position=6&pageNum=5&refId=M50o8nygvc%2BZBqm3b3KqpA%3D%3D&trackingId=w5uZPeBHKmXm2Qz5HMZh6g%3D%3D,Business Data Analyst | AdKaora,Mondadori Group,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","AdKaora

AdKaora è una digital company del Gruppo Mondadori, leader nell’innovazione mobile, che offre strumenti e soluzioni efficaci in ottica multicanale ai brand e ai publisher per raggiungere, coinvolgere e influenzare il proprio target, portando risultati concreti e misurabili.

AdKaora è una digital company leader nell’innovazione. Offriamo strumenti e soluzioni multicanale efficaci per brand e publisher, mirati a raggiungere, coinvolgere e influenzare il target, ottenendo risultati concreti e misurabili.

AdKaora Value Network è la nostra innovativa concessionaria pubblicitaria, che fa dell'innovazione tecnologica il suo cavallo di battaglia. Con oltre 1500 partner globali, realizziamo e proponiamo al mercato formati pubblicitari innovativi, utilizzati dai più grandi publisher italiani e internazionali.
Di cosa ti occuperai

Stiamo cercando una/un Business Data Analyst che voglia essere una figura chiave nell’analisi dei dati di business. In questo ruolo contribuirai in modo attivo alla definizione delle strategie aziendali, interpretando dati complessi provenienti da media, digital marketing e finance. Ti occuperai di:
analisi avanzata dei dati provenienti da campagne media, mobile, web e proximity, con l’obiettivo di monitorare performance e individuare insight strategici
sviluppo di reportistica automatizzata e dashboard interattive per i team interni (Sales, Product, Marketing) e per i clienti, utilizzando strumenti come Power BI, Tableau o Looker
definizione e monitoraggio dei KPI di business legati a campagne advertising e customer behavior, con focus su conversioni, engagement e ROI
integrazione e pulizia dei dati provenienti da fonti eterogenee (DMP, DSP, CRM, piattaforme di advertising, SDK di terze parti)
collaborazione con il team tecnico e di prodotto per strutturare flussi di dati ottimizzati e supportare progetti di data governance e tracking
supporto alla definizione di modelli predittivi o segmentazioni comportamentali con tecniche statistiche avanzate (machine learning opzionale)
produzione di analisi ad hoc su esigenze strategiche interne o richieste cliente, con capacità di sintesi e storytelling data-driven.
Il tuo profilo
Professionalmente hai:
Laurea in Statistica, Economia, Matematica, Ingegneria gestionale o discipline affini.
almeno 5 anni di esperienza come Business Data Analyst
Conoscenza avanzata di strumenti di analisi dati e BI (Excel, SQL, Google Analytics, Google BigQuery, Power BI, Looker, etc. )
competenze avanzate del pacchetto Office (in particolare Excel)
Competenza in ambito di lettura dei principali indicatori economico-finanziari
capacità di lavorare in team cross-funzionali (marketing, sales, finance)
ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese (parlata e scritta)
mentalità data-driven, precisione e curiosità intellettuale.
Plus
Esperienza in agenzie digitali o in contesti adtech/martech
conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione statistica (Python, R)
familiarità con ambienti cloud (GCP, AWS).
Cosa ti offriamo
Inquadramento e retribuzione commisurati in base alla tua esperienza
Possibilità di smartworking, buoni pasto nei giorni di presenza in sede, accesso al welfare e a tutti i servizi aziendali.
Sede di lavoro: Via San Gregorio 1, Milano

Siamo felici di ricevere candidature da profili diversi per genere, età e cultura, perché crediamo nelle pari opportunità, ma ancor più nel valore aggiunto che ogni individuo, con la propria unicità, può apportare al nostro Gruppo.
(Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91 e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03)

4243605673,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/intern-research-data-intelligence-at-colliers-4243605673?position=10&pageNum=5&refId=M50o8nygvc%2BZBqm3b3KqpA%3D%3D&trackingId=cw%2BpHjK69jtKf%2BdE0Nxq3g%3D%3D,Intern Research & Data Intelligence,Colliers,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Company Description

At Colliers, we help leaders succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses, and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas, and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed.
BE creative. BE the expert. BE a team player. Be all that and more at Colliers International.

Colliers is a listed real estate advisor active in 66 countries with more than 18,000 employees. We contribute to a better society by solving real estate issues and accelerating the sustainability transition in the built environment. In 2025 we will be completely climate neutral.

We connect global market developments and data with the needs of property owners, property investors, and property tenants. This enables us to understand the sector of tomorrow and to provide forward-looking advice. These insights help us add value to all phases of the real estate cycle and build long-lasting customer relationships. We offer creative solutions that are not only attractive today, but also remain relevant and sustainable later on.
In Italy, we work with 170 professionals in an organization where entrepreneurship, expertise, and doing the right thing are important. Together we shape the future of real estate.
Job Description
Is Data Intelligence & Research your passion? Do you feel ready to analyse the real estate market and macro-economic trends?

The resource in the Data Intelligence & Research Department will have a cross-team role. This is a resource with enthusiasm, a propensity for team working, strong analytical and communication skills, an aptitude for analysis and technology, and good language skills.
As the Intern Data Researcher you will be in charge of:
Cross-support all activities of the research team
Collecting and analysing property market data through the management of datasets
Develop market outputs through the production of market maps and reports
Supporting the data analytics teasm in the automation of database research
Qualifications
Degree in urban planning, economics, statistics, and similar disciplines.
Researching, collecting, reporting and detailing abilities
Native Italian speaker and proficient in English
Familiar with Office Package especially with Excel and Power Point
Team working orienting
Creativity and curiosity
Availability to travel across the main Italian cities.

4290667269,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-analytics-consultant-milan-at-fifty-five-4290667269?position=2&pageNum=7&refId=6VcgiyFpy2sa68ZcdS86QA%3D%3D&trackingId=MUXmtrPPxI9HDGcQwwLw%2FA%3D%3D,Digital Analytics Consultant - Milan,fifty-five,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","About the Company

Rapid shifts in technology have dramatically changed the way people interact and engage with brands. fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands leverage data to improve marketing, media, and customer experience through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.
As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +320 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.
Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York.
About the Role

We are looking for a Digital Analytics Consultant to join our new Milan-based consulting team. This is a varied role which spans across website architecture, UX analysis, media advisory and digital strategy. As a Consultant at 55, you will be working on marketing analytics and marketing activations as opposed to setting up and optimising campaigns, so we therefore are seeking applicants with some prior experience in marketing or web analytics.

Working as part of a small, collaborative team, you will play a key role in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple, big brand clients across industries such as luxury, automotive, retail and beauty. These projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation and media-mix optimisation and you will be required to promote a customer-centric vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions.

You will report to the Head of office and work alongside other Consultants and technical experts such as Tracking Specialists, Cloud Engineers and Innovation Experts. Led by the Senior Consultant, you will contribute to the timely & professional delivery of our projects. Examples of the sort of project work you will be part of delivering within the first year of your role include but are not limited to
column2: the creation and monitoring of complex dashboards aimed at aggregating findings from numerous data sources
column3: the evaluation of client's existing marketing channel mix and the recommendation of the most suitable attribution model
column4: the implementation of cookie consent management solutions to obtain users consent for data collection, martech audience review and architecture recommendation. This is an exciting, hands-on role within a company that puts collaboration and knowledge sharing at the heart of everything we do.

column1: Responsibilities
Within your first year at fifty-five, you will be taking on the following core tasks and responsibilities, amongst others:
Delivering high quality outcomes for a variety of projects in the Ad Tech and Web Analytics space, working in a client-facing position, supported by a team of technical specialists
Meeting client's requirements within the agreed deadlines, keeping track of the necessary tasks for each project and liaising with the relevant owners internally and externally
column2: foreseeing and escalating issues / risks as appropriate

column1: Developing a sharp, operational expertise regarding web analytics and media-buy topics

Progressing in your journey at fifty-five, you will be given the opportunity to grow in your role through first-hand exposure to multiple disciplines and, if interested, you might be selected to take a specialist path.
Our Ideal Candidate
Educated to degree level
Approximately 1 year of experience in web / marketing analytics (preferably as a business analyst/ data analyst/ marketing analyst, or with experience in paid media buying)
Native or bilingual english is mandatory
Familiarity with the Google stack
Analytical mindset, keen to apply data to challenges
Detail oriented, proactive and self-motivated, good organisation is paramount
A confident presenter
Curious and eager to learn, able to challenge and recommend solutions to problems
Flexible, versatile and works well under pressure
Collaborative, works well in a team, understands that the sum of our parts is better than the individual
Strong interest in new marketing technologies & the digital industry
Interest in working in a small, growing team
If this sounds like you, please get in touch! We look forward to meeting you.
In return, we are pleased to offer you the following benefits:
Being part of a multicultural, dynamic and fast-growing team
Continuous (and certified) training on the digital ecosystem and technologies (initial training for all new employees, followed by recurring training sessions)
Phone allowance
The flexibility to work remotely for part of the week - this will continue post Covid
UnMind App subscription

fifty-five encourages diversity and is committed to guaranteeing equal treatment of all applications, regardless of gender, age, origin, sexual orientation, state of health or political or religious opinion.
Show more ","<div class=""description__text description__text--rich"">
<section data-max-lines=""5"" class=""show-more-less-html"">
<div class=""show-more-less-html__markup show-more-less-html__markup--clamp-after-5
relative overflow-hidden"">

About the Company

Rapid shifts in technology have dramatically changed the way people interact and engage with brands. fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands leverage data to improve marketing, media, and customer experience through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.

As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +320 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.

Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York.

About the Role

We are looking for a Digital Analytics Consultant to join our new Milan-based consulting team. This is a varied role which spans across website architecture, UX analysis, media advisory and digital strategy. As a Consultant at 55, you will be working on marketing analytics and marketing activations as opposed to setting up and optimising campaigns, so we therefore are seeking applicants with some prior experience in marketing or web analytics.

Working as part of a small, collaborative team, you will play a key role in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple, big brand clients across industries such as luxury, automotive, retail and beauty. These projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation and media-mix optimisation and you will be required to promote a customer-centric vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions.

You will report to the Head of office and work alongside other Consultants and technical experts such as Tracking Specialists, Cloud Engineers and Innovation Experts. Led by the Senior Consultant, you will contribute to the timely &
column2: professional delivery of our projects. Examples of the sort of project work you will be part of delivering within the first year of your role include but are not limited to
column3: the creation and monitoring of complex dashboards aimed at aggregating findings from numerous data sources
column4: the evaluation of client's existing marketing channel mix and the recommendation of the most suitable attribution model
column5:
the implementation of cookie consent management solutions to obtain users consent for data collection, martech audience review and architecture recommendation. This is an exciting, hands-on role within a company that puts collaboration and knowledge sharing at the heart of everything we do.

Responsibilities

Within your first year at fifty-five, you will be taking on the following core tasks and responsibilities, amongst others:

  • Delivering high quality outcomes for a variety of projects in the Ad Tech and Web Analytics space, working in a client-facing position, supported by a team of technical specialists
  • Meeting client's requirements within the agreed deadlines, keeping track of the necessary tasks for each project and liaising with the relevant owners internally and externally
column6:
foreseeing and escalating issues / risks as appropriate
  • Developing a sharp, operational expertise regarding web analytics and media-buy topics

    • Progressing in your journey at fifty-five, you will be given the opportunity to grow in your role through first-hand exposure to multiple disciplines and, if interested, you might be selected to take a specialist path.

    Our Ideal Candidate

    • Educated to degree level
    • Approximately 1 year of experience in web / marketing analytics (preferably as a business analyst/ data analyst/ marketing analyst, or with experience in paid media buying)
    • Native or bilingual english is mandatory
    • Familiarity with the Google stack
    • Analytical mindset, keen to apply data to challenges
    • Detail oriented, proactive and self-motivated, good organisation is paramount
    • A confident presenter
    • Curious and eager to learn, able to challenge and recommend solutions to problems
    • Flexible, versatile and works well under pressure
    • Collaborative, works well in a team, understands that the sum of our parts is better than the individual
    • Strong interest in new marketing technologies &
column7:
the digital industry
  • Interest in working in a small, growing team

    • If this sounds like you, please get in touch! We look forward to meeting you.

    In return, we are pleased to offer you the following benefits:

    • Being part of a multicultural, dynamic and fast-growing team
    • Continuous (and certified) training on the digital ecosystem and technologies (initial training for all new employees, followed by recurring training sessions)
    • Phone allowance
    • The flexibility to work remotely for part of the week - this will continue post Covid
    • UnMind App subscription

    fifty-five encourages diversity and is committed to guaranteeing equal treatment of all applications, regardless of gender, age, origin, sexual orientation, state of health or political or religious opinion.

4279970688,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-with-power-bi-at-txt-group-4279970688?position=3&pageNum=7&refId=6VcgiyFpy2sa68ZcdS86QA%3D%3D&trackingId=wAJzSfGIIEPdvDdTYGQ5Tg%3D%3D,Data Analyst with Power BI,TXT GROUP,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","As part of its team expansion, FastCode S.p.A. is looking for a Data Analyst.

We are seeking a professional with at least 1 year of experience in analytics or reporting, even at the beginning of their structured career, who has a good knowledge of Power BI and is eager to grow in the areas of data visualization, reporting, and business analysis.

The selected candidate will join a team dedicated to analyzing company data and building interactive dashboards, with the aim of supporting decision-making processes through reliable analysis and effective visualizations.

The working environment is dynamic, collaborative, and constantly evolving, with continuous training, hands-on support, and opportunities for growth into roles such as data specialist or business analyst.
Key Responsibilities:
Create and update interactive dashboards in Power BI
Analyze data from various sources (databases, Excel files, business systems)
Collaborate with business teams to understand reporting needs and KPI measurement
Turn raw data into clear, decision-oriented visualizations
Ensure quality, consistency, and timely updates of datasets
Document analysis processes and calculation criteria
Required Technical Skills:
Solid command of Power BI, including Power Query, DAX, and cloud publishing
Knowledge of SQL (basic/intermediate level)
Excellent knowledge of Excel (formulas, pivot tables, charts)
Ability to process and transform datasets for analytical purposes
Understanding of key performance indicators (KPIs) and performance metrics
Preferred Technical Skills:
Experience with ETL tools or pipelines (e.g., Azure Data Factory, Talend, SSIS)
Basic knowledge of Python for data analysis (e.g., Pandas, NumPy)
Familiarity with other business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Qlik)
Experience in finance, retail, or industrial sectors
Knowledge of relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL)
Soft Skills Required:
Curiosity, observational skills, and interest in analysis
Ability to communicate effectively and make data understandable
Precision, attention to detail, and quality orientation
Proactivity and motivation for professional growth
Teamwork and cross-functional collaboration skills
What We Offer:
Inclusion in an environment that values skills and professional growth
Mentorship, on-the-job training, and development of analytical capabilities
Opportunities to evolve into specialist or strategic roles
Contract and compensation based on experience
Why Choose FastCode:
The chance to work in a fast-growing, constantly evolving company
A young, international team environment
Training aligned with job-related activities
Corporate benefits (Health Insurance, Meal Vouchers)
Hybrid work model (1 day remote, 4 days onsite)

FastCode S.p.A. actively promotes an inclusive work environment that respects differences. Applications are open to all individuals, regardless of gender, in accordance with Legislative Decree 198/2006. We believe that valuing diversity and ensuring equal opportunities are key drivers of innovation and organizational well-being.

As part of its team expansion, FastCode S.p.A. is looking for a Data Analyst.

We are seeking a professional with at least 1 year of experience in analytics or reporting, even at the beginning of their structured career, who has a good knowledge of Power BI and is eager to grow in the areas of data visualization, reporting, and business analysis.

The selected candidate will join a team dedicated to analyzing company data and building interactive dashboards, with the aim of supporting decision-making processes through reliable analysis and effective visualizations.

The working environment is dynamic, collaborative, and constantly evolving, with continuous training, hands-on support, and opportunities for growth into roles such as data specialist or business analyst.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Create and update interactive dashboards in Power BI
  • Analyze data from various sources (databases, Excel files, business systems)
  • Collaborate with business teams to understand reporting needs and KPI measurement
  • Turn raw data into clear, decision-oriented visualizations
  • Ensure quality, consistency, and timely updates of datasets
  • Document analysis processes and calculation criteria


Required Technical Skills:

  • Solid command of Power BI, including Power Query, DAX, and cloud publishing
  • Knowledge of SQL (basic/intermediate level)
  • Excellent knowledge of Excel (formulas, pivot tables, charts)
  • Ability to process and transform datasets for analytical purposes
  • Understanding of key performance indicators (KPIs) and performance metrics


Preferred Technical Skills:

  • Experience with ETL tools or pipelines (e.g., Azure Data Factory, Talend, SSIS)
  • Basic knowledge of Python for data analysis (e.g., Pandas, NumPy)
  • Familiarity with other business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Qlik)
  • Experience in finance, retail, or industrial sectors
  • Knowledge of relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL)


Soft Skills Required:

  • Curiosity, observational skills, and interest in analysis
  • Ability to communicate effectively and make data understandable
  • Precision, attention to detail, and quality orientation
  • Proactivity and motivation for professional growth
  • Teamwork and cross-functional collaboration skills


What We Offer:

  • Inclusion in an environment that values skills and professional growth
  • Mentorship, on-the-job training, and development of analytical capabilities
  • Opportunities to evolve into specialist or strategic roles
  • Contract and compensation based on experience


Why Choose FastCode:

  • The chance to work in a fast-growing, constantly evolving company
  • A young, international team environment
  • Training aligned with job-related activities
  • Corporate benefits (Health Insurance, Meal Vouchers)
  • Hybrid work model (1 day remote, 4 days onsite)


FastCode S.p.A. actively promotes an inclusive work environment that respects differences. Applications are open to all individuals, regardless of gender, in accordance with Legislative Decree 198/2006. We believe that valuing diversity and ensuring equal opportunities are key drivers of innovation and organizational well-being.

4205237730,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-h-f-at-extia-4205237730?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=F%2B4obtXS6DLWDIPPmvmaew%3D%3D,Data Analyst (H/F),Extia,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !
D'abord qui
Bon(ne) communiquant(e), vous créez facilement du lien avec les nouvelles personnes que vous rencontrez,
Méthodique, les plans d’action sont dans votre ADN,
Ayant le goût du résultat, avec vous il n’y a pas de problème, il n’y a que des solutions.
Attiré(e) par le challenge, vous souhaitez gagner en compétences au sein d’une équipe originale, ambitieuse et très dynamique ?
Ensuite quoi
Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.
Vous serez notamment en charge de :
Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises
PROFIL RECHERCHE
Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :
Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,

Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.
PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT
Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !
PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération
Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.
LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

4286794945,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-f-m-x-at-mantu-4286794945?position=2&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=7%2FWMAFFjBiLtmbH3dkTQ6Q%3D%3D,Data Analyst F/M/X,Mantu,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Are you a talented Data Analyst looking to take the next step in your career?

Amaris Consulting is seeking a motivated and skilled Data Analyst to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Belgium. This is a fantastic opportunity for professionals with a keen analytical mindset, technical expertise, and strong communication skills to grow and make an impact in a dynamic, multicultural environment.
🔥 Your Role:
Analyze data and create reports to help the business make decisions.
Build dashboards and visualizations to share insights.
Work with different teams to understand their data needs.
Make sure data is accurate and clean.
Present your findings to both technical and non-technical people.
🎯Your Profile:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field.
2 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Good knowledge of SQL and data analysis tools (like Python or R).
Experience with data visualization tools (like Power BI or Tableau).
Team player with good communication skills.
Speak English and Dutch (bilingual) or English, French, and Dutch (trilingual).
🚀 Advantages:
An international learning environment.
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.
💡 We are an independent company that values:
Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.

Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Amaris Consulting is seeking a motivated and skilled Data Analyst to join our Data &
column2:
AI Center of Excellence in Belgium. This is a fantastic opportunity for professionals with a keen analytical mindset, technical expertise, and strong communication skills to grow and make an impact in a dynamic, multicultural environment.


🔥 Your Role:

  • Analyze data and create reports to help the business make decisions.
  • Build dashboards and visualizations to share insights.
  • Work with different teams to understand their data needs.
  • Make sure data is accurate and clean.
  • Present your findings to both technical and non-technical people.


🎯Your Profile:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field.
  • 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
  • Good knowledge of SQL and data analysis tools (like Python or R).
  • Experience with data visualization tools (like Power BI or Tableau).
  • Team player with good communication skills.
  • Speak English and Dutch (bilingual) or English, French, and Dutch (trilingual).


🚀 Advantages:

  • An international learning environment.
  • Extensive training and certifications.
  • A R&
column3:
D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
  • The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
  • Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
  • An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.


    • 💡 We are an independent company that values:

    • Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
    • International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
    • Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
    • Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.



    Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

4283142502,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-cream-consulting-4283142502?position=3&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=9Vf3q%2FKctP1M6oEK%2BIoCcg%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Cream Consulting,"Brussels Region, Belgium","Permanent position only
WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.
CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:
1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship
And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)
WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.
YOUR TASKS :
You understand the business request
You dive into a large amount of data :
Collecting and interpreting data
Analyzing results
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data
HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:
You have at least 2-years experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, …
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You pay attention to details
You are fluent in French and English
column2: good knowledge of Dutch is an asset

4278293870,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-data-visualisation-at-norriq-financial-services-4278293870?position=4&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=HtAaMV3qXe8KgbBNIyYAAA%3D%3D,Data Analyst / Data Visualisation,NORRIQ Financial Services,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultant
Who We Are

NORRIQ is a leading international consulting firm headquartered in Denmark and Belgium, with 350+ consultants driving business transformation through technology. Our Financial Services practice includes 100+ specialists supporting banks, insurers, and financial institutions in navigating regulatory challenges, embracing emerging technologies, and meeting evolving client demands. We prioritize growth, innovation, and excellence, offering abundant opportunities for professional development and collaboration.
The Opportunity

NORRIQ is seeking to grow its Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence team with additional Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultants to improve the business performance of financial institutions. You will help our clients to optimize the value they can get from their internal and external data, through improved business performance monitoring and enhanced reporting quality and readability. Join us to work on impactful projects that shape the future of finance.
Responsibilities
Collecting and interpreting internal and external data about customer behaviour via the digital platforms (Web and mobile) and their digital transactions with the bank.
Translate data insight into actionable recommendations in order to coordinate the business needs around data and improve the bank’s digital and marketing strategy and optimize future campaigns.
Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations
Develop and maintain complex data models, databases, data warehouses and data marts .
Create data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Perform data quality checks and ensure data integrity, develop and implement data governance policies and procedures
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and visualization
Your Profile
Master’s degree (or equivalent work experience) in mathematics or statistics, business intelligence, computer engineering, economy.
1-3 years of experience in data projects, preferably within the financial services industry.
Technical Expertise & Tooling: SQL (mandatory), SAS (nice to have), Python & R (to support our AI team), Reporting & Visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, ...),.
ETL Processes: Affinity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, including an understanding of data preparation, cleansing, and integration from multiple sources.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Business Analysis Skills: Experience in requirements gathering, process design and developing action plans.
AI knowledge: AI knowledge & interest to connect easily with our data scientist and machine learning engineers.
Communication & Collaboration: Excellent communication skills
column2: ability to work well in cross-functional teams and engage effectively with stakeholders.

column1: Languages: Fluent in English and native in French or Dutch.
What We Offer
Dynamic Work Environment: High-impact projects with leading financial institutions in a fast-growing consulting firm.
Career Development: Continuous learning and growth opportunities to advance your career.
Collaborative Culture: A supportive, innovative team environment that encourages new ideas and professional development.
Global Exposure: International experience working on cross-border projects that shape the financial services industry.
Why Join Us?

At NORRIQ, we are shaping the future of finance through transformation and innovation. If you're passionate about improving financial processes, driving change, and delivering value to clients, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

4283025188,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-graphic-packaging-international-emea-apac-4283025188?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=ySeoDruTUrFkpNwbTv7M6Q%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Graphic Packaging International - EMEA & APAC,European Union,"At Graphic Packaging International, we produce the paper cup that held your coffee this morning, the basket that transported those bottles of craft beer you enjoyed last weekend, and the microwave tray that heated your gourmet meal last night. We’re one of the largest manufacturers of paperboard and paper-based packaging for some of the world’s most recognised brands of food, beverage, food service, household, personal care and pet products. Headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, we are collaborative, diverse, innovative individuals who create inspired packaging while giving back to our communities.

With over 25,000 employees working in more than 130 locations worldwide, we strive to be environmentally responsible in our industry and in the communities where we operate. We are committed to workplace diversity and offer compensation and benefits programs that are among the industry’s best to reward the talented people who make our company successful.
A World of Difference. Made Possible.
Job Purpose

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in supporting the Radius transformation program by coordinating the extraction, transformation, and migration of master and transactional data from legacy systems into Radius. You’ll work closely with local sites, external vendors, and internal teams to ensure data integrity and seamless integration. Your deep understanding of GPI’s business processes will be essential in translating operational needs into effective data solutions.
Are you passionate about data, systems integration, and making a real impact in business transformation? Join our dynamic team as a Data Analyst and help shape the future of our data landscape!
🔍 What You’ll Do
As part of the Radius Transformation program, you’ll:
Coordinate data extraction and transformation from legacy systems.
Lead ETL processes and final data migration during go-live.
Collaborate with local sites, vendors, and internal teams to ensure accurate data loads into Aurora Radius.
Work hands-on with transactional data: Sales Orders, Purchase Orders, Inventory, WIP.
Travel to sites during rollout phases to support data conversion and cutover.
Ensure all processes are documented and audit-compliant.
📊 Your Impact
Deliver accurate, timely Power BI reports.
Improve data accessibility and quality across departments.
Automate manual reporting processes.
Ensure seamless integration of new data sources.
🧠 What You Bring
Advanced ETL and SQL skills.
Experience with relational databases and large datasets.
Knowledge of manufacturing and business processes.
Familiarity with Power Apps and Xlink tools.
Strong communication and problem-solving abilities.
Willingness to travel and support go-live activities on-site.
🤝 Who You Are
Self-motivated and reliable.
Quality and safety conscious.
Collaborative and eager to learn.
Excellent communicator with a strong work ethic.
What We Offer
Joining our team means becoming part of a forward-thinking organization where your skills and ideas truly matter. As a Data Analyst, you’ll enjoy:
✅ Competitive Compensation – A salary package that reflects your experience and impact.
✅ Growth Opportunities – Access to training, certifications, and career development within a global transformation program.
✅ Collaborative Culture – Work alongside passionate professionals in a supportive and inclusive environment.
✅ Travel & Exposure – Be part of a high-visibility project with opportunities to travel and engage directly with local sites.
✅ Work-Life Balance – Flexible working arrangements where possible, with recognition of your time and commitment during go-live phases.
✅ Cutting-Edge Tools – Work with modern technologies like Power BI, SQL, Power Apps, and Radius.
Ready to make a difference? Apply now and be part of a trans formative journey with the Aurora program!

About the Role

A leading financial client is looking for a Data Analyst to help turn complex financial data into actionable insights. You’ll work within an internal team to build analytics models, improve reporting, and drive data-driven decision-making across the organisation.
This role blends technical expertise with training and knowledge sharing, you’ll deliver high-quality analysis while helping business users get the most from analytics tools.

Strong background in statistics and data analytics
Hands-on experience with R and / or Python for data modelling
Skilled in data visualisation with Tableau or Power BI
Experience reviewing code with a focus on clean coding principles
Experience in the financial sector is a plus

Ability to train, support, and guide business users in analytics
Language: Fluent in French or Dutch, + English
Bonus: SAS, KYC

  • Experience in the financial sector is a plus
  • Knowledge of cloud infrastructure is a plus
  • Ability to train, support, and guide business users in analytics
  • Language: Fluent in French or Dutch, + English


Bonus: SAS, KYC

4291895006,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-digital-intelligence-data-analyst-at-ogilvy-social-lab-belgium-4291895006?position=8&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=yPLWC0RmY6Hr6%2F64AFEj3g%3D%3D,Junior Digital Intelligence & Data Analyst,Ogilvy Social.Lab Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About Ogilvy Social.lab

Ogilvy Social.Lab (OSL) is a full-service advertising agency headquartered in Brussels’ WPP Campus. As part of the international Ogilvy network, our operations span four continents with over 15 nationalities on the 130-strong team working in our offices – our mindset is borderless.
We proudly collaborate with prominent international and regional clients, including Absolut, Mondelez, Ford, IKEA, Nestlé, EU and Belgian institutions, fuelling their success internationally.

Entrepreneurship pulses through our veins, embodying our name with a ""lab” mentality. We constantly innovate and experiment, staying in sync with the ever-evolving digital media landscape we specialize in.
ROLE

As a Digital Intelligence & Data Analyst, you’ll help uncover meaningful insights from social, digital, and search data to support strategic thinking and creative development. You’ll explore what people are saying, sharing, and searching online to better understand audience behaviours, identify cultural trends, and help shape recommendations for leading international brands.
This role is perfect for someone who’s naturally curious about people and culture, excited by the ever-changing digital world, and eager to grow in a collaborative, social-first agency environment.
Responsibilities
Support the analysis of social and digital data using tools like Talkwalker, Tubular, RivalIQ, Semrush, GlobalWebIndex, and proprietary OSL dashboards.
Help build clear, insightful reports that highlight audience behaviors, cultural trends, and campaign opportunities.
Work closely with strategists and planners to contribute data that informs content and communication strategies.
Assist in developing regular social listening and trend-monitoring reports.
Participate in client presentations and internal meetings to share insights in a clear and engaging way.
Collaborate with data teams across Ogilvy and WPP, as well as third-party providers.
Stay curious about the digital world
column2: new platforms, tools, formats, and audience behaviours.

column1: PROFILE
1–3 years of experience in digital, social, or search data analytics, insights, or related roles.
Strong interest in digital culture, social media trends, and emerging technologies.
Familiar with tools such as Talkwalker, Tubular, RivalIQ, GlobalWebIndex, Brandwatch, Meltwater, Semrush, or similar (training can be provided).
Comfortable working with both quantitative and qualitative data and turning findings into simple, useful insights.
A basic understanding of digital performance metrics (organic and paid) across key platforms.
Proficient in English. French or Dutch is a plus.
Curious, detail-oriented, and motivated to learn from more senior analysts and strategists.
Good communicator with strong reporting and visualization skills (Excel, PowerPoint, Google Slides, or data viz tools).
A team player who thrives in a collaborative, fast-moving environment.
OFFER
Full-time opportunity in an ever-growing, trendsetting advertising agency based in the greenest building in Brussels - the new WPP Campus.
Work alongside a team of diverse and people-focused individuals, on impactful projects and with an array of local, regional, and global clients.
We are committed to keeping our environmental footprint low and ensuring that our work is ethical.
We thrive on transparency - Our words and promises produce actions.
Attractive package and benefits
Strong flexibility plan
Continuous training opportunities
As an Ogilvy Social.Lab employee, you will be provided with continuous opportunities to grow through training and career conversations while doing strong work that works.

4277627700,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-nexeo-4277627700?position=9&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=Br2nTwKohI3CXCaErJUFrg%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Nexeo,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"Nexeo is currently looking for a Data Analyst (Freelance or permanent) for a market leader in the banking industry in Belgium.

Nexeo Belgium is a consultancy company that supports its clients in the banking, finance and insurance sectors in all phases of their transformation projects: from business consulting to the implementation of IT solutions.
As a consultant you will have the opportunity to be part of Nexeo:
International environment ( Offices in France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland & Canada)
+ 450 employees
over 20% growth each year

The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users.
Responsibilities
Understand the day-to-day issues that the bank faces
Performs cleansing of data quality issues through the analysi
Monitors the data quality based on data quality dashboards, supports redesign & upgrade
Contributes to designing, monitoring and reporting on common reference tools
Contributes to raising awareness of the importance of data quality
Will be involved in all the topics related to Customer Data
Business Analysis
Work in collaboration with other technical teams to share data
Data extraction with SAS
Industrialize the process to run define periodicity
Document the project (functional and technical part)
Contribute to the achievement of the team objectives
Qualifications
Bachelor's or Master's degree
At least 3 years of experience in Data Analysis (focus data quality & data governance)
Understand data lifecycle and data usage
Working in Agile environnement (Jira & Scrum)
Good experience working with SQL Queries & SAS
English Fluent & French or Dutch native

4289291013,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-data-analyst-at-fincons-group-4289291013?position=12&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=z8GLNUaGjQWY6qYDEewlLg%3D%3D,Business Data Analyst,Fincons Group,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Fincons Group is an IT business consulting company that has been designing the digital future of leading companies on international markets for 40 years. Fincons Group built its reputation on foreseeing and interpreting new business models and the rapid evolution of IT systems by building a complete range of services: from research and consulting to design and development, from system integration of leading vendor software solutions right up to application management, supporting clients step by step along their digital transformation journey. Fincons is a multinational with over 2,600 people and several offices worldwide (in Italy, Switzerland, Germany, France, the United Kingdom, Belgium and the USA), but above all a Family Company where the founders play a strategic role with commitment and passion, grounding the company in the same principles of a united and caring family.

We firmly believe in the value of cooperation and in the contribution that every idea and intuition can bring. We believe that everyone’s effort can make a difference. Transforming knowledge into a strategic resource is our company mission, and we pursue it with the help of our most strategic asset: our people.
Fincons is looking for a BUSINESS, PROCESS and DATA ANALYST

We are seeking a professional with a hybrid background in business analysis, data analytics, and service operations, capable of translating operational performance data into actionable business insights. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in supporting business operations through analytical frameworks, continuous service improvement, and structured governance.
Familiarity with ITSM practices remains essential, but the emphasis is on their application in business support environments, such as finance, HR, logistics, or customer service.
TASKS
Following tasks will be performed by external service provider:
• Understand the overall customs processes in order to be able to determine the required IT
requirements. More explicitly, the relationships between the customs business layer and the
IT service layer are of major importance
• Prepare project plan, execute & follow-up, discuss and negotiate with all stakeholders
SoftDev, ITSM, internal teams etc.
• Participate and contribute in brainstorming, meetings, trainings and workshops with contractors and/or other partners
• Organise and lead project-related meetings, including webinars, trainings, workshops
• Support projects by designing services and components (or supervising contractors' design),
encouraging re-use as well as committing that the design of the system will fulfil the
requirements
• Define in close collaboration with the contractors and the systems’ stakeholders the
requirements, in particular non-functional requirements (volume, scalability,
confidentiality, integrity, availability, business continuity and disaster recovery planning)
• Analyse the integration of different information systems and ensure their interoperability
• Produce and/or review project related documents (including Function Point reports).
• Discuss and coordinate business aspects of the assigned IT projects with various
stakeholders (DG TAXUD business and IT teams, contractors' teams, COTS providers,
Member States' representatives, etc.). Understanding of the applicable legislation, the
business and the functional requirements
• Determine the IT requirements and translate them into an action and project plan
• Enforce the delivery of the project(s) according to the agreed schedule, with the expected
quality and with the resources provided
• Ensuring maximum uptime, accurate and early incident response, appropriate configuration
management, proactive maintenance and tuning
• The monitoring and reporting on operations and on capacity consumption, and liaison with
all (internal and external) stakeholders
• The definition of KPIs, as well as the monitoring and reporting on all quality indicators.
• Report on the service status (SLA, actions, risks, issues, decisions, changes, etc.)
• Follow-up of the activities of the DG TAXUD contractors:
o Support the preparation of technical annexes to setup the contractual activities
o Coordinate project related matters with the contractors and other stakeholders
o Supervise the production of the deliverables and the required level of quality
o Review the periodically produced reports related to the assigned projects.
• Report on the project status (tasks progress, plan, actions, risks, issues, decisions, changes,
etc.).
REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE
• Minimum experience of 10 years in IT systems out of which 5 years within customs environment
performing systems analysis or project management activities
• Deep IT technical knowledge in areas of networking (TCP/IP), Linux, databases, IT security,
programming languages and web based applications
• Excellent knowledge of service interfaces and service data
• Experience of large scale IT systems integration projects
• Knowledge and experience in platforms like CCN1, CCN2 etc. is an asset
• Experience with distributed IT systems is an asset
• Prior experience with conformance testing is an asset
• Ability to work autonomously is mandatory
• Experience in international/multicultural environment and public administration are assets
• Ability to give business and technical presentations
• Very good communication skills with technical and non-technical audiences
• Analysis and problem-solving skills
• Capability to write clear and structured technical documents
• Ability to participate in technical meetings and good communication skills.
SPECIFIC EXPERTISE
• Oracle SQL developer
• Soap UI and Ready API
• ALM tools: Jira, Nexus, Confluence.
English (C1) required
Office: Brussels
modality of work: near-site
If interested, please apply!
Our personnel search is addressed to candidates of all genders.

The data will be processed and stored exclusively for the purposes of this or future selections, in compliance with the Federal Data Protection Law (LPD) and guaranteeing the rights referred to in art. 13 Legislative Decree 196/03 and EU regulation 679/2016 (GDPR)

4289853137,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analist-at-darwind-4289853137?position=13&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=ZA4AFAvNNX9pO5AVR4Xkbg%3D%3D,Data Analist,darwind,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Klaar om je vast te bijten in data en écht impact te maken als Data Analist?
Heb je 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou!
Bij darwind verwelkomen we gemotiveerde professionals die willen groeien en hun vaardigheden verder willen ontwikkelen. Je komt terecht in een omgeving waar mensen, leren en impact centraal staan.
Wat ga je doen?
Je verzamelt, zuivert en analyseert grote datasets om trends, patronen en inzichten bloot te leggen
Je bouwt dashboards en rapporten die stakeholders helpen betere beslissingen te nemen
Je werkt nauw samen met data engineers, business teams en andere analisten om vragen te vertalen naar bruikbare analyses
Je past statistische methodes of machine learning toe om voorspellingen en planning te ondersteunen
Je zorgt voor datakwaliteit en betrouwbaarheid door middel van validatie en documentatie
Je blijft jezelf ontwikkelen en ontdekt nieuwe tools, technologieën en methodes binnen de datawereld
Wie zoeken we?
Je hebt 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of in een vergelijkbare rol
Je bent vlot met Python, SQL en Excel, ervaring met R of Azure is een plus
Je hebt gewerkt met datavisualisatietools zoals Power BI of Tableau
Je combineert analytisch denkvermogen met sterke communicatieskills
Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en hebt een goede kennis van Frans en Engels
Je bent nieuwsgierig, leergierig en neemt graag verantwoordelijkheid
Wat mag je verwachten?
Projecten die aansluiten bij jouw talenten en groeipad
Coaching en begeleiding van ervaren data-experts
Opleidingen en certificeringen op maat van jouw ambities
Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket met hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, maaltijdvergoeding en de keuze tussen een bedrijfswagen met tankkaart of het federaal mobiliteitsbudget
Flexibiliteit: werk bij de klant, op het darwind-kantoor of van thuis uit
En vooral: werkplezier, autonomie en een team waarop je kan rekenen
Klinkt dit als iets voor jou?
Laat van je horen, we kijken ernaar uit je te ontmoeten!

relative overflow-hidden"">

Klaar om je vast te bijten in data en écht impact te maken als Data Analist?

Heb je 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou!

Bij darwind verwelkomen we gemotiveerde professionals die willen groeien en hun vaardigheden verder willen ontwikkelen. Je komt terecht in een omgeving waar mensen, leren en impact centraal staan.


Wat ga je doen?

  • Je verzamelt, zuivert en analyseert grote datasets om trends, patronen en inzichten bloot te leggen
  • Je bouwt dashboards en rapporten die stakeholders helpen betere beslissingen te nemen
  • Je werkt nauw samen met data engineers, business teams en andere analisten om vragen te vertalen naar bruikbare analyses
  • Je past statistische methodes of machine learning toe om voorspellingen en planning te ondersteunen
  • Je zorgt voor datakwaliteit en betrouwbaarheid door middel van validatie en documentatie
  • Je blijft jezelf ontwikkelen en ontdekt nieuwe tools, technologieën en methodes binnen de datawereld


Wie zoeken we?

  • Je hebt 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of in een vergelijkbare rol
  • Je bent vlot met Python, SQL en Excel, ervaring met R of Azure is een plus
  • Je hebt gewerkt met datavisualisatietools zoals Power BI of Tableau
  • Je combineert analytisch denkvermogen met sterke communicatieskills
  • Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en hebt een goede kennis van Frans en Engels
  • Je bent nieuwsgierig, leergierig en neemt graag verantwoordelijkheid


Wat mag je verwachten?

  • Projecten die aansluiten bij jouw talenten en groeipad
  • Coaching en begeleiding van ervaren data-experts
  • Opleidingen en certificeringen op maat van jouw ambities
  • Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket met hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, maaltijdvergoeding en de keuze tussen een bedrijfswagen met tankkaart of het federaal mobiliteitsbudget
  • Flexibiliteit: werk bij de klant, op het darwind-kantoor of van thuis uit
  • En vooral: werkplezier, autonomie en een team waarop je kan rekenen


Klinkt dit als iets voor jou?

Laat van je horen, we kijken ernaar uit je te ontmoeten!

4285865681,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-business-analyst-at-phinest-4285865681?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=ZyAPxfaTO9E1nG4uVtzz6Q%3D%3D,Data & Business Analyst,Phinest,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"Who we are
Phinest is a Belgian Management Consulting firm providing tailor-made services for Bel20 and Bel20-like companies.
We are a human-sized organisation working with a broad portfolio of clients in various sectors (Utilities, Pharmaceutical, Banking & Insurance, Retail, Transport, Public, Telecom).
Based on a holistic approach, our objective is to implement our client's strategic Projects and Programs and to ensure their business efficiency.
We strive for excellence through 6 essential Values: Quality, Cohesion, Honesty, Balance, Respect, and Openness.
Our mission is to create a unique experience where the most talented people and strategic projects magnify together. We are a human-centered organisation that believes in our people.
Position: Energy Business & Data Analyst
Your Mission:

Join a team at the forefront of the energy transition! As an Energy Business & Data Analyst, you will be the key link between business and IT teams, driving the design, development, and optimization of an innovative Energy Management System (EMS).
Your Responsibilities:
Analyze business needs related to energy management and optimization.
Translate these needs into clear functional specifications for technical teams.
Collect, structure, and analyze energy data to identify performance drivers.
Collaborate with stakeholders (business, IT, engineering, data) to ensure project success.
Monitor performance indicators and propose continuous improvements.
Your Profile:
A unique mix of business insight and data/IT mindset.
Knowledge in the energy sector
Comfortable with data analysis, modeling, and reporting tools.
Strong ability to bridge technical and non-technical discussions.
Curious, collaborative, and eager to contribute to the energy transition.
What we offer:
Our focus is to develop a long-term collaboration with our talented consultants. Therefore we invest in our people as of day one to support them into a blossoming career within Phinest.
Our Talent Management Services department (a.k.a TMS) is designed and fully dedicated to the development and well-being of our employees.
We also offer:
A company culture focused on well-being
A wide range of trainings and career development opportunities (certification, practical training)
A collaborative, dynamic and fulfilling working atmosphere with a supportive and collaborative team
The opportunity to work with a fast-growing firm and talented people
A competitive remuneration package with fringe benefits
Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site
Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

4290929116,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-f-m-x-at-amaris-consulting-4290929116?position=15&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=yZ6lNxaPPazn8rD%2Bi6LAAA%3D%3D,Data Analyst F/M/X,Amaris Consulting,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!
Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.
We look forward to meeting you!
Job Description
Amaris Consulting is looking for a motivated Data Analyst to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Brussels
📝 Your Responsibilities:
Analyze and interpret large datasets to support business decisions.
Create dashboards and reports to communicate insights.
Collaborate with technical and business teams.
Ensure data quality and reliability.
👤 Your Profile:
Bachelor’s or Master’s in a relevant field.
Experience as a Data Analyst.
Skilled in SQL, Python or R, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Strong analytical and communication skills.
Fluent in Dutch and English (French is a plus).
Dutch proficiency is mandatory. You must be bilingual (Dutch/English) or trilingual (Dutch, English, French).
🚀 Advantages:
An international learning environment.
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.
💡 We are an independent company that values:
Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.

Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.
