4292414810,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-data-analyst-at-degroof-petercam-4292414810?position=18&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=G%2BzOxUHvr%2BfaSWbnSheKVg%3D%3D,Business & Data Analyst,Degroof Petercam,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Context
The GM Tech Division is part of Bank Degroof Petercam’s Investment Banking / Global Markets department.
Its Activities Consist Mainly In
Project management and business analysis for strategic, regulatory or Life Cycle Management projects.
Deliver strategic and tactical improvements (systems and processes).
Data Science serving Global Markets and BDP:
Provide insights, predictions and analysis for better business decisions
Increase automation and simplify processes
Build a strong bridge with Chief Data Officer
Reporting solutions to monitor performance.
Strengthen the cooperation with IT: clarify the “What” and challenge the “How”
Active participation in system architecture discussions
Deliver scalable and innovative solutions to remove dependency on End User Computing
Your position
As a member of the GM Tech team, you will:
Develop creative solutions to support the monitoring and reporting of GM activities.
Coordinate change requests on behalf of Global Markets
Gather, analyze and clarify business requirements.
Support GM in its regulatory and compliance obligations (ex. BCP, BIA, Critical Outsourcing assessments, user access review, etc.)
Identify improvement areas (technology and processes).
Actively participate to projects
Your profile
You have a bachelor’s degree in business administration, information technology, Finance or equivalent, with 3/5 years working experience.
You are passionate about technology and data with extended knowledge of Python (Django, AirFlow, DBT, ..) and SQL.
You are familiar or are attracted by the Financial Markets world.
You are curious and you learn fast.
You have strong analytical skills with an eye for details.
You are a creative problem solver, you take ownership.
Very good verbal and written skills in English and in the 2nd national language.
You have excellent communication and relationship management skills.
You are a real team player who can work in an autonomous way.
Our offer

For more than 150 years, Degroof Petercam has been a reference investment house. Entrepreneurship is our DNA, expertise is our fuel. You will become part of a company with highly skilled, talented and passionate experts that aim for nothing less than excellence. The impact of our work goes beyond profit by looking at business from a broader perspective, challenging those who want to intellectually. As a part of Indosuez Wealth Management and Crédit Agricole, we offer our people ongoing learning and development and mobility on an international scale.
In addition to our fascinating work environment, we also offer:
A broad offer of learning & development programs including a Degroof Petercam Academy for both professional and personal goals.
An attractive and market conform compensation package
Flexible working hours & teleworking
An Employee Social Engagement Program
Access to the same Private Banking Expertise as our clients

4290743725,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analytics-consultant-at-pwc-belgium-4290743725?position=19&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=hebTRBCERsPntxJof090vA%3D%3D,Junior Data Analytics Consultant,PwC Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Contribute to creating a better tomorrow

The only way we can tackle the challenges of this fast-changing world is with passionate people. Led by our purpose of building trust and solving important problems, we come together at PwC to address the biggest issues facing the world in a way that drives positive impact. Are you eager to join a team fuelled by open and curious minds? People who are passionate about their work and create new solutions for a new day? Then you’re at the right place.
Bring your talent. Learn new skills. Make a positive impact.

PwC Advisory is a network of multiple possibilities - where you want to make an impact is always up to you. Under the expert stewardship of our Advisory experts, you’ll delve into the inner workings of companies to find the best solutions for any challenge they might have. From the excitement of deals to the complexities of consulting and the fascinating realm of risks and threats in forensics, you’ll help clients nurture trust and maintain their evolutionary edge, today and into the future. Now that’s making a difference.

A career within Managed Services, will provide you with the opportunity to help our clients face their big complex and operational problems. We focus on understanding the forces shaping their business and developing industry tailored solutions that support our clients through the entire lifecycle. As a (senior) associate within the IT Support Team, you'll get the opportunity to help our clients solve their complex business issues from strategy to execution and beyond.
Are you looking for a challenging job in a dynamic and innovative environment? You are about to find the perfect match!

Are you a data and IT enthusiast who also talks the language of business? Do you have a passion for solving complex data-based problems, creating, and developing reports, dashboards and troubleshooting data errors and issues?
What you will do and learn:
Your impact
Act as point of contact to collect, clean, transform and analyze data for efficient decision making to meet business expectation
Participate in the data analytics tool selection process (RfX, etc.)
Report and modelize key insights from performed analysis to be shared with key stakeholders (e.g: via PowerBI, Tableau, Slides, etc.)
Working closely with different teams to ensure issues and requests are addressed timely
Identify and make suggestions for improvements when problems and/or opportunities arise
Follow risk management and compliance procedures
Share and collaborate effectively with others
Communicate confidently in a clear, concise and articulate manner – verbally and in the materials I produce
Build and maintain an internal and external network
Use creative problem-solving methods and work in an international, multidisciplinary team
Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct
Seek opportunities to learn about how PwC works as a global network of firms
About You

A relevant university degree in IT (management) or IT technology-related programmes or Business Administration/Management, Economics, Computer and Information Science, or any other relevant university degree that showcases your capabilities
You have a strong interest in data analytics, IT tools and the opportunities they offer as well as a good understanding of how to leverage them
You have a strong ability to leverage and turn your key findings into clear and outstanding presentations
0 to 2 years of experience in data analytics
Extensive experience developing and deploying reports, dashboards, and metrics
You are bilingual in Dutch & French, with professional working proficiency in English.
Strong Analytical skills
Strong verbal communication skills
Strong interpersonal skills
Excellent time management skills under tight deadlines
The ability to work independently and as part of a team
Keep upskilling yourself via training and on the job learning
Moreover, you have an interest, experience and/or technical expertise in several of the following:
Alteryx, PowerBI, Tableau knowledge
Knowledge of PowerApps and Power Automate is a plus
SQL / Python knowledge is a plus
Project management & Microsoft certification is a plus (e.g. Prince II, PMI, Agile/Scrum, Azure AI, Power BI Data Analyst Associate, etc.)
Interest in new technologies like generative AI
Life at PwC Belgium
Our culture and workplace are something we’re proud of. Here’s a sneak peek at what life at PwC looks like:
Flexible work patterns: Achieve the perfect balance between office and home life with our flexible hybrid work arrangements and family-friendly schemes.
Lifelong learning: Grow with us! Take advantage of our diverse training opportunities and exciting career pathways to explore new disciplines and expertise.
Flexible rewards: Tailor your benefits to suit your lifestyle with our customizable rewards plan.
Sustainable mobility: Choose eco-friendly mobility options, from our soon-to-be fully electrified fleet to public transport, shared cars, ebikes, and more.
Inclusive culture: Thrive in a diverse, inclusive workplace that values and celebrates every individual's contributions.
Wellbeing focus: Enjoy a positive environment with our comprehensive wellbeing programs, engaging sports communities, and confidential support for all your professional and personal challenges.
Global network: Expand your horizons with opportunities to work abroad and tap into extensive industry expertise within the PwC network.
Let’s build something great together. What are you waiting for?
Equal Opportunity Employer statement

At PwC, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic environment. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all candidates and employees, regardless of race, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace drives innovation and strengthens our ability to serve our people, clients and communities. Join us in fostering a culture where everyone feels valued, respected and empowered to achieve their full potential.
Additionally, we provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, in accordance with applicable laws.

4277353684,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analytics-lead-at-semetis-4277353684?position=20&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=V1IFnzJy05Nbtsod9OyRQA%3D%3D,Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead,Semetis,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"📄 Type: Full-time | 📊 Experience: Mid-Senior (4-7 years experience)

At Semetis, we turn data into business growth. We are looking for a Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead to bridge the gap between raw data, marketing intelligence, and strategic decision-making. You will be at the heart of our strategic department, ensuring insights drive real marketing and business impact.
Your Mission:
Translate complex data into actionable insights for marketing and business decisions.
Scope and optimize analytics, measurement, and dashboarding projects for top clients.
Work closely with consultants and leadership to define and refine key business KPIs.
Ensure data quality, build meaningful reports, and provide strategic recommendations.
Coach and train teams, fostering a strong data-driven culture at Semetis.
What You Bring:
4-7 years experience in analytics, data insights, measurement, or BI.
Expertise in web analytics (GA4, Adobe Analytics, Piwik Pro) and dashboarding (Looker, Power BI, Tableau).
Understanding of business KPIs, ensuring analytics drive marketing and revenue growth.
Strong autonomy and ownership, able to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Some SQL knowledge (or willingness to learn) and familiarity with cloud solutions (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
Critical thinker, able to assess what analytics services should and shouldn’t be offered.
Why Join Semetis?

At Semetis, we do more than analyse data—we turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgium’s leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.

This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isn’t just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. We operate in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where bold ideas, innovation, and experimentation are encouraged. Unlike traditional agencies, Semetis fosters a culture of autonomy, giving you the space to take ownership and make a tangible difference.
If you are passionate about turning analytics into actionable business impact, we would love to hear from you.
Full job description & application details here.
Ready to make an impact? Let’s talk.

4283146671,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-cream-consulting-4283146671?position=21&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=DrGB1m4WhNYx5T0s%2FIcYrQ%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Analyst,Cream Consulting,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Permanent position only
WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.
CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:
1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship
Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀
WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Teddy, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).
YOUR TASKS :
Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs

Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
Collaborate with the development team
HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?
You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English
column2: a good knowledge of Dutch is also required

column1: You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client’s request
Bonus
An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting… could be a real asset
WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?
A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!
THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,
CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY""

4245638770,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-senior-h-f-at-extia-4245638770?position=24&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=JPUymPVRIr%2FoeZEIdllGSQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst Senior (H/F),Extia,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !
D'abord qui
Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous
Ensuite quoi
Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.
Vous serez notamment en charge de :
Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises
PROFIL RECHERCHE
Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 5 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :
Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,

Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.
PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT
Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !
PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération
Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.
LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

relative overflow-hidden"">

Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui

  • Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
  • Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
  • Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous

Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :

  • Comprendre les problématiques métier,
  • Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
  • Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
  • Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
  • Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises

PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 5 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :

  • Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
  • Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
  • Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.

PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT

  • Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
  • Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
  • Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas &

4288682619,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/reward-data-analyst-at-deloitte-4288682619?position=25&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=IJHHhPjqfKtzo%2F0VFynVKQ%3D%3D,Reward Data Analyst,Deloitte,"Zaventem, Flemish Region, Belgium","Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond.
Your journey with us
Our Reward Team helps clients navigate the
total reward landscape in a tailor-made and result-oriented way. From
developing rewards strategy to implementing innovative solutions such as the EU
Pay Transparency Directive. They bring together the right mix of expertise—covering
everything from reward, tax & legal, employee communication, to tech and
process.
Role Summary:
As a Rewards Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in
supporting our clients' rewards and compensation & benefits strategies. You
will leverage your analytical skills and statistical expertise to
provide insights and solutions that drive pay transparency and equity. This
position offers an exciting opportunity to work with a multidisciplinary team
and contribute to impactful projects that shape the future of reward systems.
Key Responsibilities:
Conduct comprehensive reward & compensation
analyses using statistical methods and regression models.
Pivotal member of our pay equity & transparency
team (see more information: Pay
Transparency and Pay Equity)
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to
implement pay equity & transparency initiatives.
Utilise R and Python for data analysis and
visualisation to support reward strategies.
Assist in the development of tailored reward
programs that align with organisational goals.
Prepare detailed reports and presentations to
communicate findings and recommendations.
Support the implementation of innovative
solutions such as the EU Pay Transparency Directive.
Let’s Talk About You!
At least 1 – 3 years (junior profile) or 4 - 6 years (senior profile) of experience in data analytics.
Experience in applying statistical techniques
Experience working with R, Python and Power BI.
Fluency in written and spoken English and preferably one additional language (Dutch or French).
Strong analytical skills with proficiency in compensation analysis, market benchmarking tools, benefits management systems, Excel, PowerPoint, HRIS, and data visualisation tools.
Demonstrated ability to think strategically, innovate, provide high-impact solutions, and effectively manage projects to successful completion.

Global Employer Services (GES) team is fully aware today’s digital revolution is rapidly rewriting the environment for employers and their global workforces. The need for mobility is greater than ever. We help our clients achieve control, gain perspective, and lead with confidence through this period of uncertainty and technological change. Our professionals focus on providing personal tax, compensation & benefits and international assignment/HR services to our clients. We assist our clients to streamline their HR, Mobility and Rewards programs, while managing tax effectiveness, compliance and employment costs, both in a global and domestic context.

Reward, employment tax, global share plans, HR & payroll advisory designed just for you! Our professionals help you design cost-effective, tax-efficient, and compliant reward and payroll programs that align with talent strategies and diverse workforce needs.
Our story - Global Employer Services (GES)

In today's digital revolution, the environment for employers and their (global) workforces is rapidly evolving, with an increased need for adaptability. The GES team is dedicated to helping clients navigate these challenges with confidence, providing expertise in rewards, compensation & benefits, personal tax and international assignment/HR services.

Our focus is on streamlining HR, Rewards and Mobility programs to ensure effectiveness, compliance, and cost management in both global and domestic contexts. We offer specialised advisory services in reward, employment tax, global share plans, HR & payroll, tailored to meet the unique needs of each client.

Our professionals are committed to designing cost-effective, efficient, and compliant reward and payroll programs that align with talent strategies and diverse workforce needs. We are here to support your journey towards pay transparency and equity, ensuring your compensation strategies are both attractive to employees and beneficial for your business.
Why work in GES?
Passion: Driven by a love for mobility, payroll, and rewards services, crafting both local and global solutions in a sustainable way.
People-focused: Working with and for people. Investing in coaching, learning, and developing the team, making sure everyone grows.
Professionalism: Delivering excellence as a united team, ensuring success for their clients and for each other.
Who is Deloitte?

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities
Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality
Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.
Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

4291251404,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-robert-half-4291251404?position=26&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=xvRjliM%2FF38BgjRQcGNLng%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Robert Half,"Mechelen, Flemish Region, Belgium","Robert Half is momenteel op zoek naar een Data Analyst (m/v/x) voor een bedrijf actief in de pharma sector. Onze klant is gelegen in Mechelen.
De verantwoordelijkheden voor deze functie zijn:
Je verzamelt en analyseert relevante markt- en cijferinformatie om strategische beslissingen en business cases te ondersteunen
Je werkt grondige business cases uit, inclusief scenarioanalyses en levensvatbaarheidscriteria
Je ondersteunt het beheer en de optimalisatie van het CRM-systeem en online bestelsystemen in samenwerking met interne en externe stakeholders
Je beheert product- en klantendatabanken, inclusief prijzen en kortingen, vanuit het CRM-systeem en andere bestelsystemen
Je ontwikkelt standaard- en ad-hoc rapporten om interne behoeften te vervullen en stakeholders te ondersteunen
Je verhoogt de efficiëntie door rapporten en dashboards te standaardiseren en te optimaliseren
Je presenteert analytische bevindingen en aanbevelingen aan het leiderschapsteam voor strategische besluitvorming
Je rapporteert rechtstreeks aan de BI/BD Director.
Wat breng je mee?
Je hebt een achtergrond in bedrijfseconomie, ondersteund door een diploma
Je beschikt over 2 tot 3 jaar relevante werkervaring
Je hebt bewezen ervaring in het opstellen van business cases
Je beheerst het Nederlands, Frans en Engels vlot
Je bent zeer vaardig met MS Office, met name Excel (Pivot, DAX) en Power BI
Je bent analytisch, probleemoplossend, en beschikt over commercieel inzicht
Je denkt autonoom, werkt nauwkeurig en kan goed samenwerken met verschillende teams
Je bent enthousiast en gedreven, en weet bruggen te bouwen tussen collega's.
Aanbod:
Een boeiende functie bij een bedrijf dat kiest voor een mensgerichte aanpak binnen de gezondheidszorg
De kans om bij te dragen aan innovatieve oplossingen die welzijn en comfort verbeteren
Een omgeving waar je collega's en klanten centraal staan, en iedere medewerker gewaardeerd wordt
Een stimulerende bedrijfscultuur met een sterke focus op groei, samenwerking en het doorbreken van traditionele processen
Competitieve arbeidsvoorwaarden en volop ruimte voor professionele ontwikkeling.

4276787892,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-dataroots-a-talan-company-4276787892?position=27&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=d5fbKBJ0xKDw37jX555KUQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,"dataroots, a Talan company","Flemish Region, Belgium","🤖 The Job

As a Data Analyst within Dataroots, you'll be a key player in a team bridging the gap between business and data teams. Under the guidance of experienced data consultants, you'll display your passion for translating business needs into tangible data and AI-driven solutions. You'll gather business requirements from clients, identify and assess the necessary data, and build or collaborate to build and deploy effective data solutions.

Your role will extend beyond technical expertise as you translate complex outcomes into business impact, presenting results to stakeholders in clear and understandable terms. Along the way, you'll contribute to developing the right capabilities and governance structures within organisations, ensuring that data solutions deliver sustainable long-term value.
✅ Key Responsibilities:
Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports for data visualization.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies to support strategic decision-making.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity across various sources.
Optimize data processes and workflows for efficiency and scalability.
Support data-driven decision-making by providing actionable recommendations.
Work with cross-functional teams to integrate data insights into business processes.
Stay updated on industry trends, tools, and best practices in data analytics.
🎉 What you can expect at Dataroots?

Dataroots, a vibrant and dynamic data consulting company founded in 2016, stands out with its unique expertise in the data realm. We are committed to nurturing a culture that prioritises team well-being, diversity, knowledge sharing, and outstanding customer experiences, which has fueled our sustained and robust growth. As a Data Analyst at Dataroots, you'll be an essential part of our mission, playing a key role in developing and implementing data-driven solutions for our clients.
Job requirements
🔎 The profile
You have at least 2 years experience.
You have worked on a data visualisation project in a professional setting.
You are excited about the potential of data, AI, and digital to solve real-world problems.
You have either a business degree and a technical affinity or a technical degree and a business affinity.
You are curious and possess a healthy dose of drive and ambition.
💪 The Skills
You have a good overview of the (big-)data ecosystem and know how different components fit in a data engineering or machine learning solution.
You have experience in working with Power BI in a professional setting.
You have experience with programming languages such as SQL, Python, R and cloud platforms AWS, GCP and Azure.
You understand how to collect and identify business requirements and translate these into functional requirements and acceptance criteria.
You possess both strong technical abilities and soft skills to align technical- and business stakeholders and drive change.
You have a can-do attitude, you take ownership of the project to ensure timely delivery & scalable solution through strong project management capabilities.
You know how to build storylines and translate complex solutions into clear & understandable content and context and you are constantly developing your skills in this area.
You speak fluent English and either Dutch or French.
💰 The Offer
An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:
Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card
Hospitalization and group insurance
High-end laptop
Smartphone with subscription
Substantial amount of holidays
Meal vouchers

Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you’ll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
A training budget for individual and team learning opportunities.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.
📍 Where you’ll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.
🎯 Ready to join Dataroots?
Ready for a new chapter as a Data Analyst at Dataroots? Super! Apply now! 🎉

4293734527,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-quality-analyst-at-laco-4293734527?position=30&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=JXG84lcga%2F1vQmcEK9ebjQ%3D%3D,Data Quality Analyst,LACO,"Flemish Region, Belgium","Unleash your data quality enthusiasm!

Do you have the supernatural ability to turn raw data into gold? Are you passionate about data and convinced that data quality is the key enabler for organizations to create value from their data? If so, brace yourself, because LACO has a data-driven adventure tailor-made for you! As our Data Quality Analyst, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. You'll be the architect of insights, sculpting data into strategies that steer the ship.
YOUR JOB
As a Data Quality Analyst, you’ll support our clients with their data quality needs:
Gather and analyse data from different sources to identify inconsistency and trends.
Identifying data quality issues and clearly communicate their business impact
Clean the data and identify the route causes of data quality issues
Design and build data quality controls to support data stewards and other business stakeholders
Build data quality dashboards to monitor the overall data quality
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI, data quality frameworks and data platforms
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.
YOUR SKILLS
You have a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in computer science or equivalent experience.
You have good communication skills, used to work with business stakeholders.
You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
You have proven experience with data quality projects.
You are familiar with data quality tool like Azure Purview (Collibra, Informatica, Soda)
You know all about the SQL.
You have experience in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling techniques, minimum Star Schemas (Kimball) and others are nice to have.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.
OUR OFFER
Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Get involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
Guided by our expert LACO coaches, you'll have the support and motivation to grow and build a sustainable career.
We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
Have a say in which project placement you’ll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …
ABOUT US

So step into the world of LACO, because we're not just your average Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company. We're the superheroes of many realms including Microsoft, SAS and Data Advisory, which earned us the rank of Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner. With a squad of over 120 consultants, we're on a mission to unravel the secrets of data and lead businesses from all walks of life through the digital wilderness. Join LACO, and you're not just an employee: you're family. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do, making every day at LACO a thrilling adventure.

Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our recruiters and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

Unleash your data quality enthusiasm!


Do you have the supernatural ability to turn raw data into gold? Are you passionate about data and convinced that data quality is the key enabler for organizations to create value from their data? If so, brace yourself, because LACO has a data-driven adventure tailor-made for you! As our Data Quality Analyst, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. You'll be the architect of insights, sculpting data into strategies that steer the ship.


YOUR JOB

As a Data Quality Analyst, you’ll support our clients with their data quality needs:


  • Gather and analyse data from different sources to identify inconsistency and trends.
  • Identifying data quality issues and clearly communicate their business impact
  • Clean the data and identify the route causes of data quality issues
  • Design and build data quality controls to support data stewards and other business stakeholders
  • Build data quality dashboards to monitor the overall data quality
  • Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
  • Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI, data quality frameworks and data platforms
  • Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
  • Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
  • Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.


YOUR SKILLS


  • You have a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in computer science or equivalent experience.
  • You have good communication skills, used to work with business stakeholders.
  • You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
  • You have proven experience with data quality projects.
  • You are familiar with data quality tool like Azure Purview (Collibra, Informatica, Soda)
  • You know all about the SQL.
  • You have experience in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling techniques, minimum Star Schemas (Kimball) and others are nice to have.
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.


OUR OFFER


  • Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.
  • Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
  • Get involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
  • Guided by our expert LACO coaches, you'll have the support and motivation to grow and build a sustainable career.
  • We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
  • Have a say in which project placement you’ll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
  • A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …


ABOUT US


So step into the world of LACO, because we're not just your average Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company. We're the superheroes of many realms including Microsoft, SAS and Data Advisory, which earned us the rank of Microsoft Data &

4290588810,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ai-data-business-analyst-at-data-wizards-4290588810?position=31&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=cd7HWd%2Fqd9J4vp4JRB2L2A%3D%3D,AI/DATA Business Analyst,Data Wizards,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"Don’t settle for just any consulting company, choose the one that’s right for you!
We’re on the lookout for a AI/DATA Business Analyst to join our expanding AI & Data start-up.

As Data Wizards, we are a team of experts in AI & Data who advocate for human-centered AI development and usage. We partner with innovative companies from strategy to implementation to help them achieve their goals by unlocking the full potential of their data assets respecting cultural and ethical norms.
You're making the right choice to apply if you're eager to be part of an ambitious, high-energy team filled with curious, proactive minds who are passionate about AI and driven by integrity.

However, this isn’t the job for you if you’re looking for a routine, copy-paste kind of role. Here, every day is different, and we love people who take initiative, embrace challenges, and think outside the box. 🚀
As a AI/DATA Business Analyst, you’ll be at the crossroads between business and technology. Your mission will be to:
Dive deep into business needs and turn them into clear, actionable requirements.
Take full ownership of projects, making sure stakeholders stay aligned and delivery stays on track.
Work hand-in-hand with our technical teams to shape solution architectures and create documentation that helps development move smoothly.
You’re a step closer to joining our team if you bring:
Background:
A bachelor’s or master’s degree in a relevant field (business, engineering, or similar).
2–4 years of experience in a business analyst or project manager role.
Hands-on experience in a data or AI project (a big plus for us).
Technical Skills:
A solid understanding of project management approaches, especially Agile and Scrum.
Soft Skills:
Strong communication skills, comfortable talking with both business and tech stakeholders.
The ability to translate business needs into technical requirements, and vice versa.
A structured approach to project management and delivery.
Practical Info:
Languages: Fluent English, plus native proficiency in either French or Dutch.
We know that finding the right job isn’t just about the role, it’s about what’s in it for you, too. While we’re a start-up, we’re big on taking care of our people right from day one.
Here’s a sneak peek at what we offer:
💰 A compensation package that keeps you motivated:
Competitive salary
Mobility budget or company car with a fuel card
30 days of paid time off
A top-tier laptop & smartphone with a subscription
Representation allowances
Hospitalization & dental insurance
Meal vouchers
Opportunity to earn company stock over time
🎯 A place to be your best self, grow, and thrive:
Work with the most innovative technologies in Data & AI
Work in an agile, collaborative environment
Hybrid work model
Monthly team-building events (plus one epic annual celebration)
Tailored training programs to fuel your career growth
A cool, ergonomic office with creative meeting spaces
A Nintendo Switch for spontaneous Mario Kart battles 🎮
A massage chair for those deep-thinking moments 🧘
Fresh coffee & drinks to keep you energized ☕
✨ And most importantly, a fast-growing company where opportunities are limitless!
Our Recruitment Process:
Quick intro call with our HR team (5min)
HR Interview (30min)
Partner Interview (1h)
Interview with client (1h)
How to apply?
You can apply right here on LinkedIn.

If you’re passionate about what we do but aren’t sure you meet every single requirement—don’t hesitate to apply. We value potential, mindset, and growth as much as experience. At Data Wizards, we believe diversity is our strength. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds and experiences because different viewpoints help us grow and evolve.
Let’s build the future of AI & Data, together 🤝

Please note: As a consulting company, our recruitment process can be either project-driven or based on strong profiles we believe in. The consultancy world moves fast, and while we always aim to match great talent with the right opportunity, there might not always be an immediate fit. With your permission, we’ll gladly keep your profile in mind for future missions, and hope to collaborate with you soon on an exciting project at Data Wizards!

4293846890,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-spektrum-4293846890?position=32&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=amNCbvS198eoSgtLS3lyOg%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Analyst,Spektrum,"Braine-l’Alleud, Walloon Region, Belgium","Spektrum have a wide range of exciting opportunities in several global locations.
We are always looking to add great new talent to our team and look forward to hearing from you.

Spektrum supports apex purchasers (NATO, UN, EU, and National Government and Defence) and their Tier 1 supplier ecosystem with a wide range of specialist services. We provide our clients with professional services, specialised aerospace and defence sales, delivery, and operational subject matter expertise. We are looking for personnel to join our team and support key client projects.
Who We Are Supporting

The NATO Communication and Information Agency (NCIA) is responsible for providing secure and effective communications and information technology (IT) services to NATO's member countries and its partners. The agency was established in 2012 and is headquartered in Brussels, Belgium.
The NCIA provides a wide range of services, including:
Cyber Security: The NCIA provides advanced cybersecurity solutions to protect NATO's communication networks and information systems against cyber threats.
Command and Control Systems: The NCIA develops and maintains the systems used by NATO's military commanders to plan and execute operations.
Satellite Communications: The NCIA provides satellite communications services to enable secure and reliable communications between NATO forces.
Electronic Warfare: The NCIA provides electronic warfare services to support NATO's mission to detect, deny, and defeat threats to its communication networks.
Information Management: The NCIA manages NATO's information technology infrastructure, including its databases, applications, and servers.
Overall, the NCIA plays a critical role in ensuring the security and effectiveness of NATO's communication and information technology capabilities.
The program
Assistance and Advisory Service (AAS)

The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency) is NATO’s principal C3 capability deliverer and CIS service provider. It provides, maintains and defends the NATO enterprise-wide information technology infrastructure to enable Allies to consult together under Article IV, and, when required, stand together in the face of attack under Article V.

To provide these critical services, in the modern evolving dynamic environment the NCI Agency needs to build and maintain high performance-engaged workforce. The NCI Agency workforce strategically consists of three major categorise's: NATO International Civilians (NIC)'s, Military (Mil), and Interim Workforce Consultants (IWC)'s. The IWCs are a critical part of the overall NCI Agency workforce and make up approximately 15 percent of the total workforce.
Role Duties And Responsibilities
Develop Power BI Dashboards and Reports

design and build a set of interactive dashboards in Power BI Desktop, following specifications provided by the Purchaser. Dashboards are expected to provide clear insights, intuitive navigation, and alignment with stakeholder reporting needs
deliverables should directly support decision-making in Finance, Procurement, Project, and Asset Management domains

where appropriate, create mock-ups or wireframes of dashboards and reports to validate design choices with stakeholders before full development. This ensures clarity of expectations and reduces rework.
Implementation of Data Models and Measures
support the design, creation and optimization of Power BI data sets, including relationships and measures, to ensure accurate KPI calculations
apply best practices to optimize refresh times, maintain integrity, and ensure scalability of solutions.
Application of Visualization and Performance Standards
apply recognized best practices in layout, usability, and performance tuning. Dashboards should be consistent in look-and-feel, easy to interpret, and responsive under normal usage conditions.
Delivery of Documentation and User Guidance
prepare lightweight but clear documentation describing the data model, key measures, and visual design logic
where appropriate, short user navigation guides will also be produced to support adoption and knowledge transfer.
Production of Functional Specifications and User Stories

translate clarified business needs into structured functional specifications, user stories and acceptance criteria that can be directly used by developers. These outputs will serve as the basis for development, ensuring requirements are testable, traceable, and prioritized.
Support Testing and Validation Activities
support the preparation of test cases for BI deliverables, including validation of critical data sets and KPIs
assist the project team and stakeholders in validating deliverables against requirements

conduct basic SQL-based data checks and participate in dashboard walkthroughs to confirm the accuracy and completeness of outputs ensuring that business expectations are reflected in both the data and the dashboard outputs.
Facilitation of Stakeholder Alignment and Approvals
collaborate closely with business users and project sponsors to collect inputs, clarify objectives, and refine incomplete or evolving requirements
manage alignment sessions to review clarified requirements and specifications with stakeholders
ensure that stakeholder perspectives are captured and transformed into actionable BI deliverables
formal agreement and sign-off will be sought to confirm readiness for development.
Coordinate Delivery Tracking and JIRA Updates

support tracking of deliverables through JIRA by updating and maintaining JIRA tickets with structured requirements, ensuring the backlog is clear, organized, and current. This also includes coordinating with the development team to track progress, changes and testing results
ensure visibility of progress and timely identification of risks
ensure transparency of work throughout execution.
Essential Skills, Experience And Certifications
5 years+ as a Power BI Developer in a reporting environment.
2 years+ Proven experience as a Business Analyst, BI Analyst, or Project Coordinator in a data or reporting environment.
2 years+ Extensive knowledge of the business processes in the area of Finance, Procurement, Project and Asset Management.
2 years+ working experience using SQL to create queries, understand and validate data logic together with basic use of SQL tools (e.g. MS SQL Management Studio, SQL Developer).
2 years+ expertise in Power BI tools, Power BI Desktop specifically (data modelling, dashboard development, KPI development).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Working knowledge of JIRA (basic).
Excellent communication and facilitation skills, particularly in requirements gathering and documentation.
Strong organizational skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Desirable Skills, Experience And Certifications
Experience working in institutional or public sector environments with formal governance structures.
Understanding of BI project lifecycles: from requirements to delivery to UAT.
Prior experience of working in an international environment comprising both military and civilian elements.
Familiarity with Agile/Scrum practices in a BI or analytics context.
Prior experience of working in Agile development methodologies.
Prior experience of working in an international environment comprising both military and civilian elements.
Knowledge of NATO responsibilities and organization, including ACO and ACT.
A thorough knowledge of one of the two NATO languages, both written and spoken, is essential and some knowledge of the other is desirable.
Language Proficiency
Full proficiency in the English language.
Working Location
Braine L’Alleud, Belgium
Working Policy
30% On-site and 70% Off-site
Travel
Some travel to other NATO sites may be required
Security Clearance
Valid National or NATO Secret personal security clearance

We never know what new opportunities might be just over the horizon. If this opportunity isn't for you please feel free to send us your resume anyway and be the first to know if something suitable for your skills and experience comes up.

4245634988,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-confirm%C3%A9-h-f-at-extia-4245634988?position=33&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=tyftEIurFY5vgS20ODBgPg%3D%3D,Data Analyst Confirmé (H/F),Extia,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !
D'abord qui
Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous
Ensuite quoi
Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.
Vous serez notamment en charge de :
Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises
PROFIL RECHERCHE
Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :
Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,

Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.
PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT
Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !
PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération
Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.
LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

4277210340,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-consultant-energy-department-at-capco-4277210340?position=36&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=30nbBlUxduKPkrBBOmU7VQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst / Consultant (Energy Department),Capco,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Data Analyst / Data consultant
Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?
Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?
Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.
We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.
In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.
You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.
Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.
We Are Looking For Talent With The Following
Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis
Skills & Expertise
Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the energy industry (or financial / banking) or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English
What We Offer You
The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals

An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers

Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture

4282450023,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-equans-belux-4282450023?position=37&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=EmGZrn6aMf2aipuKpGbtrA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Equans BeLux,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","What if you could shape the future of HR decision-making?
With us, your expertise won’t just sit in dashboards – it will actively support HR innovation across the entire organization.
To strengthen our HR IS team, we’re looking for a Data Analyst who thrives in a dynamic, agile environment and is eager to turn complex HR data into powerful insights.

You’ll get to work on varied, business-critical HR projects with real impact – all while collaborating with a supportive and passionate team. If you love working at the intersection of data, people, and technology, this job was made for you.
Your work location: our Equans-site in Brussels
As our HR Data Analyst, you will:
translate business needs into clear analysis and reporting actions
collaborate closely with analysts with different expertise within HR
work in an agile team
act as the bridge between business and the developers
collect, clean and prepare data from multiple sources (databases, systems…)
prototype Power BI reports
evaluate results and help steer improvements
document processes, solutions and user guides
support the business during testing phases and guide them through test scenarios
What You Bring To The Table
5+ years of experience in data analysis,
2+ years of experience working in agile teams
hands-on knowledge of Power BI and MS Office
experience with Azure DevOps, MS Visio, DAX or SAP BI is a plus
strong communication & social skills and a proactive mindset
analytical, independent and focused on solutions
customer-oriented and eager to keep learning
fluent in Dutch, French and English
Ready to shape the way data drives HR?
Want to tackle tomorrow’s multi-technical challenges with us?

At Equans, you find an exciting career within a stable and financially sound company. You work on challenging, diverse projects and assist our clients with today’s three major transitions: the energy transition, the industrial transition, and the digital transition.
You have the opportunity to discover cutting-edge technologies and further develop your skills.
Joining Equans is more than that! You also get:
a competitive salary in line with your education and experience
interesting training and career opportunities
group-, hospitalization-, disability insurance
eco & meal vouchers, 13th month, holiday pay
concessionary travel, lease car (with fuel/charging card), parking, bicycle lease plan
smartphone with subscription, internet fee
additional paid leave, seniority leave, homeworking
discounts through Benefits@Work (culture, sports, travel, and more)
Add to that the contagious warm atmosphere at Equans, and what are you waiting for?
We look forward to welcoming you!

Does this description fit you and would you like more information? Contact our HR colleague Erwin Verniers – 02 370 30 62 – erwin.verniers@external.equans.com – https://www.linkedin.com/in/erwin-verniers

4294599450,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-intern-at-lhoist-4294599450?position=38&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=etZp7tWWWo9Dkd6I61PIPw%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Intern,Lhoist,"Louvain-la-Neuve, Walloon Region, Belgium","Lhoist Western Europe is hiring a Business Intelligence Intern! If you are interested in working with a team of experts for 3 to 6 months there is your chance!

Our internship program at Lhoist provides a hands-on work experience and an opportunity to work on projects that directly impact the organization. Send your application and get the opportunity to join our team!
ABOUT THE INTERNSHIP

The objective of the Internship is to start from the existing marketing and sales database and GIS tools, to improve and redesign where necessary and to make it operational and effective in a globally organized company.
Your main responsibilities:
Managing content and validating data integrity.
Setting up automatic tools for recurrent reporting and statistics.
Supporting the evolution of IT platform, with possible integration and automatization with existing reporting tools like BW analyser (SAP) and PowerBI.
Developing reporting in our CRM system C4C.
Developing Dashboards and GIS systems, used as Management Information System in the company network.
Skills/Attitudes:
Good knowledge of basic IT tools (PowerBI or Tableau).
Knowledge of Database management and GIS (ArcGIS) is a plus.
Very good presentation skills.
Ability to interact across business units.
Education: Students in Data Science, Economics or Engineering.
Languages: Fluency in English is a must. French and/or Dutch are a plus.
Duration: 3-6 months. Preferably starting anytime in September, October 2025.
Location: Lhoist Western Europe Head Office, Corbais, Belgium.
LHOIST GROUP AND OUR SUSTAINABILITY COMMITMENT

Lhoist Group is a family-owned company. Since 1889, we have been producing and supplying lime, limestone, and mineral solutions for an ever-growing range of applications and sectors. Our company, with roots and headquarters in Belgium, is now present in more than 25 countries, with facilities in Europe, North America, Latin America, and Asia-Pacific. By working with our partners, we drive meaningful change to create a more sustainable future for all.

As an industry leader, our activity is essential for many sectors, like water treatment, agriculture, steel and construction. Our actions, based on our sustainability goals at their core, can play a critical role in improving the world by bringing purity and efficiency to a variety of applications. We are committed to sustainability as individuals and as a company. We cannot do it alone and we are hugely grateful for the forward thinking of our stakeholders and partners. Sustainability is a continuous challenge and we want to thank everyone who is working hard to make it such an integral part of our business, our daily operations, and our profitable future.

So, if you're eager to make a difference together with us, learn from the best, and grow both personally and professionally, come join us on this transformative journey towards a sustainable and impactful future! 🌿💼🌎

<section data-max-lines=""5"" class=""show-more-less-html"">
<div class=""show-more-less-html__markup show-more-less-html__markup--clamp-after-5
relative overflow-hidden"">

Lhoist Western Europe is hiring a Business Intelligence Intern! If you are interested in working with a team of experts for 3 to 6 months there is your chance!

Our internship program at Lhoist provides a hands-on work experience and an opportunity to work on projects that directly impact the organization. Send your application and get the opportunity to join our team!

ABOUT THE INTERNSHIP


The objective of the Internship is to start from the existing marketing and sales database and GIS tools, to improve and redesign where necessary and to make it operational and effective in a globally organized company.


Your main responsibilities:

  • Managing content and validating data integrity.
  • Setting up automatic tools for recurrent reporting and statistics.
  • Supporting the evolution of IT platform, with possible integration and automatization with existing reporting tools like BW analyser (SAP) and PowerBI.
  • Developing reporting in our CRM system C4C.
  • Developing Dashboards and GIS systems, used as Management Information System in the company network.


Skills/Attitudes:

  • Good knowledge of basic IT tools (PowerBI or Tableau).
  • Knowledge of Database management and GIS (ArcGIS) is a plus.
  • Very good presentation skills.
  • Ability to interact across business units.


Education: Students in Data Science, Economics or Engineering.

Languages: Fluency in English is a must. French and/or Dutch are a plus.

Duration: 3-6 months. Preferably starting anytime in September, October 2025.

Location: Lhoist Western Europe Head Office, Corbais, Belgium.


LHOIST GROUP AND OUR SUSTAINABILITY COMMITMENT

Lhoist Group is a family-owned company. Since 1889, we have been producing and supplying lime, limestone, and mineral solutions for an ever-growing range of applications and sectors. Our company, with roots and headquarters in Belgium, is now present in more than 25 countries, with facilities in Europe, North America, Latin America, and Asia-Pacific. By working with our partners, we drive meaningful change to create a more sustainable future for all.

As an industry leader, our activity is essential for many sectors, like water treatment, agriculture, steel and construction. Our actions, based on our sustainability goals at their core, can play a critical role in improving the world by bringing purity and efficiency to a variety of applications. We are committed to sustainability as individuals and as a company. We cannot do it alone and we are hugely grateful for the forward thinking of our stakeholders and partners. Sustainability is a continuous challenge and we want to thank everyone who is working hard to make it such an integral part of our business, our daily operations, and our profitable future.

So, if you're eager to make a difference together with us, learn from the best, and grow both personally and professionally, come join us on this transformative journey towards a sustainable and impactful future! 🌿💼🌎
