4263073008,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/hr-data-analyst-fr-at-nmbs-sncb-4263073008?position=39&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=NP9uW7wltvhKIwFQkwb5Dg%3D%3D,HR Data Analyst _FR,NMBS-SNCB,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Comment pouvez-vous faire la différence ?

L’analyse de données vous passionne ? Vous aimez la structure et avez aussi un solide intérêt pour les ressources humaines ? Alors venez jouer un rôle clé à la SNCB comme HR Data Analyst! Vous aiderez à améliorer les processus RH et de ce fait la prise de décisions stratégiques rapide et efficace pour la SNCB. Ainsi, la SNCB pourra continuer à évoluer et les voyageurs en profiteront également.
Quel est votre rôle à la SNCB ?
En tant que HR Data Analyst, vous avez les responsabilités suivantes :
Vous développez, gérez et optimisez notre modèle d’autorisation RH et de données RH afin qu’il soit toujours à jour et organisé de manière logique.

Vous surveillez et améliorez la qualité des données à l’aide de rapports, tableaux de bord et analyses. Vous identifiez les problèmes ou risques et prenez des mesures ciblées. Vous allez même plus loin : vous tirez des enseignements des données disponibles, détectez des tendances, étudiez les corrélations et soutenez ainsi les décisions basées sur les données au sein des RH.

Vous mettez en œuvre les principes et procédures de gouvernance des données et veillez à leur respect. Vous sensibilisez les parties prenantes par le biais de communications ou de formations, fournissez la documentation nécessaire et participez à divers projets.
Vous gérez les tickets liés aux données, les résolvez et identifiez des améliorations structurelles afin d’éviter toute répétition dès problèmes.
Vous identifiez des opportunités d’optimisation et d’automatisation des processus, et collaborez avec les data stewards et data owners pour leur mise en œuvre concrète.

Vous représentez les RH au sein des différents organes de gouvernance des données de la SNCB, où sont prises des décisions clés concernant la stratégie des données à l’échelle de l’entreprise. Pour chaque décision, vous établissez le lien avec les processus, les concepts d’information et les systèmes liés aux données RH.
Nous recherchons deux nouveaux collaborateurs. Selon votre profil, l’accent de cette fonction sera différent.

Avez-vous de l’expérience en gouvernance des données? Vous vous concentrerez principalement sur la structuration et la sécurisation des données, la surveillance de la qualité des données et la mise en œuvre des principes de gouvernance.

Avez-vous plutôt un profil en analyse de données et analytics? Vous vous focaliserez sur la compréhension des données RH, la réalisation d’analyses approfondies, la détection de tendances et corrélations, et le soutien des décisions grâce à des insights concrets.
Un job fait pour vous ?
Vous êtes titulaire d’un master (ou équivalent par expérience) et vous avez au moins 2 ans d’expérience en gestion ou gouvernance des données, ou dans une fonction similaire.
Et vous possédez les compétences suivantes :
Vous avez un esprit analytique et critique et vous savez passer à l’action.
Vous êtes un vrai team player, avide d’apprendre.
Vous pouvez travailler de manière autonome tout en respectant les délais fixés.

Vous disposez de bonnes compétences en communication et êtes capable d’expliquer des processus complexes dans un langage compréhensible. Vous vous exprimez également bien en néerlandais et en anglais.
C’est un atout si vous avez des connaissances en SAP RH et/ou SuccessFactors.

Chaque personne est unique. Il est important pour nous que vous puissiez être vous-même. C’est ce qui rend la SNCB plus forte. C’est pourquoi nous accordons beaucoup d’importance à la diversité et à l’inclusion .
Qu'avons-nous à vous offrir ?

Choisir la SNCB, c'est choisir un environnement où vous pouvez apprendre et vous épanouir. Vous serez entouré de chouettes collègues qui vous soutiendront. Nous vous offrons un package salarial qui se compose de :
Un salaire attractif complété d'un 13e mois, d'une indeminté de frais, des chèques-repas et d'un bonus collectif et individuel.
Une partie du salaire est offerte sous forme de budget flexible. Vous pouvez opter pour la location d'un vélo, une voiture en leasing, pour le remboursement de l'épargne-pension, etc.
Une assurance hospitalisation et collective.
Un horaire flexible, un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à 33 jours de congés par an.
Un abonnement de train en Belgique, des avantages sur les lignes internationales et une indemnité vélo.
Des avantages pour votre famille comme des réductions sur les sorties en famille et dans les magasins.
Où allez-vous travailler ?
Vous travaillerez à proximité de la gare du Midi, dans le bâtiment Atrium.
What’s next ?
Vous postulez en ligne.
Nous lisons votre CV et votre lettre de motivation avec grande attention. Nous vous appelons éventuellement pour faire plus ample connaissance.

Vous passez un premier entretien d’embauche (en ligne) dans lequel vous pourrez montrer votre motivation et vos compétences. Pour préparer cet entretien, vous complétez un questionnaire de personnalité. Lors de l’entretien, un cas pratique vous sera également présenté afin que nous puissions mieux comprendre votre approche et votre processus de réflexion.
Un second entretien pourra éventuellement être organisé.
Nous vous faisons une proposition de contrat.
Vous commencez votre premier jour de travail !

Nous nous réservons le droit d'ajuster ou de suspendre cette procédure en cas de nécessité. Notre équipe de recrutement sélectionnera les profils les plus en adéquation avec les exigences du poste afin de garantir une correspondance optimale.
Avez-vous encore des questions?
Jobreq: 50949
Sur le contenu du job :
Leentje Brion
M. leentje.brion@sncb.be
Sur la procédure de sélection :
Zoë Mbeka
M. zoe.mbeka@sncb.be

Quel est votre rôle à la SNCB ?

En tant que HR Data Analyst, vous avez les responsabilités suivantes :

  • Vous développez, gérez et optimisez notre modèle d’autorisation RH et de données RH afin qu’il soit toujours à jour et organisé de manière logique.
  • Vous surveillez et améliorez la qualité des données à l’aide de rapports, tableaux de bord et analyses. Vous identifiez les problèmes ou risques et prenez des mesures ciblées. Vous allez même plus loin : vous tirez des enseignements des données disponibles, détectez des tendances, étudiez les corrélations et soutenez ainsi les décisions basées sur les données au sein des RH.
  • Vous mettez en œuvre les principes et procédures de gouvernance des données et veillez à leur respect. Vous sensibilisez les parties prenantes par le biais de communications ou de formations, fournissez la documentation nécessaire et participez à divers projets.
  • Vous gérez les tickets liés aux données, les résolvez et identifiez des améliorations structurelles afin d’éviter toute répétition dès problèmes.
  • Vous identifiez des opportunités d’optimisation et d’automatisation des processus, et collaborez avec les data stewards et data owners pour leur mise en œuvre concrète.
  • Vous représentez les RH au sein des différents organes de gouvernance des données de la SNCB, où sont prises des décisions clés concernant la stratégie des données à l’échelle de l’entreprise. Pour chaque décision, vous établissez le lien avec les processus, les concepts d’information et les systèmes liés aux données RH.

Nous recherchons deux nouveaux collaborateurs. Selon votre profil, l’accent de cette fonction sera différent.

  • Avez-vous de l’expérience en gouvernance des données? Vous vous concentrerez principalement sur la structuration et la sécurisation des données, la surveillance de la qualité des données et la mise en œuvre des principes de gouvernance.
  • Avez-vous plutôt un profil en analyse de données et analytics? Vous vous focaliserez sur la compréhension des données RH, la réalisation d’analyses approfondies, la détection de tendances et corrélations, et le soutien des décisions grâce à des insights concrets.

Un job fait pour vous ?

Vous êtes titulaire d’un master (ou équivalent par expérience) et vous avez au moins 2 ans d’expérience en gestion ou gouvernance des données, ou dans une fonction similaire.

Et vous possédez les compétences suivantes :

  • Vous avez un esprit analytique et critique et vous savez passer à l’action.
  • Vous êtes un vrai team player, avide d’apprendre.
  • Vous pouvez travailler de manière autonome tout en respectant les délais fixés.
  • Vous disposez de bonnes compétences en communication et êtes capable d’expliquer des processus complexes dans un langage compréhensible. Vous vous exprimez également bien en néerlandais et en anglais.
  • C’est un atout si vous avez des connaissances en SAP RH et/ou SuccessFactors.

Chaque personne est unique. Il est important pour nous que vous puissiez être vous-même. C’est ce qui rend la SNCB plus forte. C’est pourquoi nous accordons beaucoup d’importance à la diversité et à l’inclusion .

Qu'avons-nous à vous offrir ?

Choisir la SNCB, c'est choisir un environnement où vous pouvez apprendre et vous épanouir. Vous serez entouré de chouettes collègues qui vous soutiendront. Nous vous offrons un package salarial qui se compose de : 

  • Un salaire attractif complété d'un 13e mois, d'une indeminté de frais, des chèques-repas et d'un bonus collectif et individuel.
  • Une partie du salaire est offerte sous forme de budget flexible. Vous pouvez opter pour la location d'un vélo, une voiture en leasing, pour le remboursement de l'épargne-pension, etc.
  • Une assurance hospitalisation et collective.
  • Un horaire flexible, un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à 33 jours de congés par an.
  • Un abonnement de train en Belgique, des avantages sur les lignes internationales et une indemnité vélo.
  • Des avantages pour votre famille comme des réductions sur les sorties en famille et dans les magasins.

Où allez-vous travailler ?

Vous travaillerez à proximité de la gare du Midi, dans le bâtiment Atrium.

What’s next ?

  • Vous postulez en ligne.
  • Nous lisons votre CV et votre lettre de motivation avec grande attention. Nous vous appelons éventuellement pour faire plus ample connaissance.
  • Vous passez un premier entretien d’embauche (en ligne) dans lequel vous pourrez montrer votre motivation et vos compétences. Pour préparer cet entretien, vous complétez un questionnaire de personnalité. Lors de l’entretien, un cas pratique vous sera également présenté afin que nous puissions mieux comprendre votre approche et votre processus de réflexion.
  • Un second entretien pourra éventuellement être organisé.
  • Nous vous faisons une proposition de contrat.
  • Vous commencez votre premier jour de travail !

Nous nous réservons le droit d'ajuster ou de suspendre cette procédure en cas de nécessité. Notre équipe de recrutement sélectionnera les profils les plus en adéquation avec les exigences du poste afin de garantir une correspondance optimale.

Avez-vous encore des questions?

Jobreq: 50949

M. leentje.brion@sncb.be

Sur la procédure de sélection :

M. zoe.mbeka@sncb.be

4295020534,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-in-data-analytics-at-bosch-belgium-4295020534?position=42&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=BOAwWKfaToCJ%2Bj%2FvmDnd0w%3D%3D,Internship in Data Analytics,Bosch Belgium,"Mechelen, Flemish Region, Belgium","The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services. It employs roughly 418,000 associates worldwide (as of December 31, 2024). The company generated sales of 90.3 billion euros in 2024. Its operations are divided into four business sectors: Mobility, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. With its business activities, the company aims to use technology to help shape universal trends such as automation, electrification, digitalization, connectivity, and an orientation to sustainability. In this context, Bosch's broad diversification across regions and industries strengthens its innovativeness and robustness. Bosch uses its proven expertise in sensor technology, software, and services to offer customers cross-domain solutions from a single source. It also applies its expertise in connectivity and artificial intelligence in order to develop and manufacture user-friendly, sustainable products. With technology that is “Invented for life,” Bosch wants to help improve quality of life and conserve natural resources.
You will be working as a Data Analytics Intern in the Business Intelligence department at Bosch Thermotechnology in Mechelen.
Your main responsibility will be to further develop and maintain the 360-degree view of our customers, which will be used to steer the departments (Marketing, Sales, Sales Operations, etc).
You will support in projects and process optimization.
You will maintain and harmonize the data present in different applications.
You will be responsible for several Sales reports (in Power BI and Excel) and may be asked to conduct several analyses.
Currently studying Data Analytics, Statistics, International Business Management, Marketing, Economical Studies at a Bachelor's or Masters level.
Fluent in English. Dutch or French is a plus.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Good knowledge of Excel and Power BI
Good knowledge of Python, SQL, Alteryx, KNIME and/or data modelling is a plus
What's in for you?
A competitive renumeration.
Professional development in one of Europe's leading global tech and innovation companies.
Growth of professional network across European Institutions and Brussels policy community.
A learning opportunity to develop critical policy skills and gain practical knowledge about industry, technology, innovation and public funding dynamics.
If you are a student enrolled in a University/College (or if you are available for a voluntary internship outside a university curriculum) you will be granted an allowance of € 1056,00/month.
If you want to apply for a voluntary internship, you must be a citizen of the EU or have a work permit in Belgium.
In case that you need to do a mandatory internship, your University/College must be located in a member state of the EU.
Ready to Take the Next Step?
If you're eager to make a difference and gain hands-on experience, we want to hear from you! Apply now and embark on an exciting journey with Bosch in Brussels!
Join us and be part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and growth!

Don't worry if you don't meet every single requirement—if you're passionate and believe you can contribute to our team, we encourage you to apply! Your unique perspective and enthusiasm could be just what we're looking for.
We are looking forward to receiving your application by email in English. Do not hesitate to contact us if you have any further questions.
Starting date: October 2025
Duration: 6 months
Important note
Please be advised that a valid work permit for Belgium is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient language skills may not be considered.

The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services. It employs roughly 418,000 associates worldwide (as of December 31, 2024). The company generated sales of 90.3 billion euros in 2024. Its operations are divided into four business sectors: Mobility, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. With its business activities, the company aims to use technology to help shape universal trends such as automation, electrification, digitalization, connectivity, and an orientation to sustainability. In this context, Bosch's broad diversification across regions and industries strengthens its innovativeness and robustness. Bosch uses its proven expertise in sensor technology, software, and services to offer customers cross-domain solutions from a single source. It also applies its expertise in connectivity and artificial intelligence in order to develop and manufacture user-friendly, sustainable products. With technology that is “Invented for life,” Bosch wants to help improve quality of life and conserve natural resources.

  • You will be working as a Data Analytics Intern in the Business Intelligence department at Bosch Thermotechnology in Mechelen.
  • Your main responsibility will be to further develop and maintain the 360-degree view of our customers, which will be used to steer the departments (Marketing, Sales, Sales Operations, etc).
  • You will support in projects and process optimization.
  • You will maintain and harmonize the data present in different applications.
  • You will be responsible for several Sales reports (in Power BI and Excel) and may be asked to conduct several analyses.
  • Currently studying Data Analytics, Statistics, International Business Management, Marketing, Economical Studies at a Bachelor's or Masters level.
  • Fluent in English. Dutch or French is a plus.
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
  • Good knowledge of Excel and Power BI
  • Good knowledge of Python, SQL, Alteryx, KNIME and/or data modelling is a plus

What's in for you?

  • A competitive renumeration.
  • Professional development in one of Europe's leading global tech and innovation companies.
  • Growth of professional network across European Institutions and Brussels policy community.
  • A learning opportunity to develop critical policy skills and gain practical knowledge about industry, technology, innovation and public funding dynamics.

If you are a student enrolled in a University/College (or if you are available for a voluntary internship outside a university curriculum) you will be granted an allowance of € 1056,00/month.

If you want to apply for a voluntary internship, you must be a citizen of the EU or have a work permit in Belgium.

In case that you need to do a mandatory internship, your University/College must be located in a member state of the EU.

Ready to Take the Next Step?

If you're eager to make a difference and gain hands-on experience, we want to hear from you! Apply now and embark on an exciting journey with Bosch in Brussels!

Join us and be part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and growth!

Don't worry if you don't meet every single requirement—if you're passionate and believe you can contribute to our team, we encourage you to apply! Your unique perspective and enthusiasm could be just what we're looking for.

We are looking forward to receiving your application by email in English. Do not hesitate to contact us if you have any further questions.

Starting date: October 2025

Duration: 6 months

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Belgium is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient language skills may not be considered.

4281681057,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-bi-engineer-data-analyst-at-capgemini-4281681057?position=43&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=wfzspQ7rAGDTJV%2B0tuvywA%3D%3D,Junior BI Engineer / Data Analyst,Capgemini,"Diegem, Flemish Region, Belgium","Job Description
About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.
Get The Future You Want | https://www.capgemini.com/be-en
Your role

Data Analyst and BI Engineers are the foundation of the Data and AI profession, applying their expertise to ensure governance and management, and influencing business decisions by the stories they tell with data.
At Capgemini, this multifaceted specialism has significant experience across traditional warehousing technologies and databases, Big Data and Cloud. There is never a dull moment in this career path!
As a junior Data Analyst & Bi Engineer, you will be responsible for:
Integrate, transform and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems.
Create and design data models.
Translate functional requirements into a scalable, fit-for-use technical design.
Own the delivery of data modelling and data pipelines.
Implementing a new operating model which supports innovation and acceleration through data & analytics.
Contributing data expertise to strategic projects that align with the clients goals.
Your profile
We are looking for someone who :
Owns a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Data Science, Business Engineering, Computer Sciences, or equivalent.
Has strong knowledge of SQL (this is a must).
Is fluent in Dutch or French and English, but notion of other language and willing to improve.
Is geographically mobile: Although you must be ready to accept assignments anywhere in Belgium, most of your assignments will be Brussels based.Is eligible for security clearance.
Success in this role often comes down to :
Strong communication skills: You can convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
Teamwork: You excel at collaborating and building meaningful relationships.
Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.
Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.
Why Capgemini?
We offer a supportive, flexible, and growth-oriented workplace where your contributions make a difference. Here’s what you can expect:
A hybrid work model with up to 70% remote work.
Access to world-class learning platforms to upskill in marketing, communications, and leadership.
A dynamic, fun, and collaborative marketing team.
A brand-new, state-of-the-art office in Diegem.
Competitive salary with a flex plan to customize your benefits, including a company car or mobility budget.
Comprehensive health and group insurance, meal & eco vouchers.
32 vacation days, plus bank holidays, with options to purchase extra time off.
Opportunities for international exposure and travel to support exciting projects and events.
Ready to shape the future?
We'd love to hear from you if you’re passionate about communication and eager to grow in a fast-paced, innovative, and international company.
Apply today and Get The Future You Want!

4157708884,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-forensic-investigations-at-deloitte-4157708884?position=44&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=exWg8%2Fz6Y5r6d0lHitb6CQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst Forensic Investigations,Deloitte,"Zaventem, Flemish Region, Belgium","Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond. Your journey with us

Do you want to sharpen your profile in the field of Financial Advisory – Forensic and broaden your horizons in interdisciplinary projects? Our team ensures the investigation and prevention of financial and white-collar crime across all industries. Secure our joint success and make a difference with us: as a Experienced Consultant Data Analyst Forensic.
Location: Brussels, Belgium
Your impact:

As an Experienced Consultant Forensic, you will support the reappraisal of financial and white-collar crime as well as their prevention - and thus contribute to the security and business viability of companies.
Investigation: You will support us in conducting special investigations in cases of economic and corporate crime.
Dispute and Litigation: To this end, you will prepare expert opinions on accounting law or business management issues for legal disputes, for example.
Fraud Prevention: You will be actively involved in the design and implementation of preventive measures as well as the improvement of internal processes and control systems.
Innovative approaches: In addition, you will develop solutions with us that take into account current and future customer needs and offer significant added value.
Teamwork: You will work with other Deloitte Practices in Belgium and abroad on an interdisciplinary basis and take on responsible tasks at an early stage.
Let's talk about you
Your skillset:
Degree  business engineer,  economics, business informatics or a comparable course of study successfully completed
Proficiency in advanced data analytics techniques and tools (e.g., statistical modeling, data mining, machine learning) with the ability to apply these skills to complex business problems.
Ideally, initial practical experience in the areas of forensic, compliance, audit, tax consulting, accounting or controlling
High self-motivation, Independence and enjoyment of complex issues and conceptual tasks
Strong team orientation, good presentation and communication skills
Willingness to travel as well as very good written and spoken Dutch and English
Your chance:
Best-in-class continuing education at Deloitte University as well as within the framework of individual qualification offers and training courses

Comprehensive development opportunities through structured career planning, inclusive leadership, secondment programs, project-based job rotation as well as promotion of social commitment and corporate volunteering
Work-life balance thanks to mobile working & part-time, sabbaticals and family services, e.g. to support family caregivers, parental leave counselling and much more
Focus on health and fitness through regular health days, cooperation with fitness providers and support for sports and team events
Attractive employer benefits including bike and car leasing, company smartphone for private use and flexible working models such as trust-based working hours and EU remote working
Diverse creative freedom and active promotion of an inclusive corporate culture - including through our Diversity & Inclusion employee networks

Our Risk, Regulatory & Forensic practice is a global leader in helping clients manage risk and uncertainty from the boardroom to the network. We provide a broad array of services that allow our clients around the world to better measure, manage and control risk to enhance the reliability of systems and processes throughout their organization.
Who is Deloitte?

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.
Why Deloitte?
Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.
Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.
We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.
Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:
My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities
Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte
Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte
Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte
Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities
Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangementsremains essential in today's reality:
Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).
Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.
Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

relative overflow-hidden"">
Can’t wait to make an impact on the world?
column2:
You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond. Your journey with us
Do you want to sharpen your profile in the field of Financial Advisory – Forensic and broaden your horizons in interdisciplinary projects? Our team ensures the investigation and prevention of financial and white-collar crime across all industries. Secure our joint success and make a difference with us: as a Experienced Consultant Data Analyst Forensic.
Location: Brussels, Belgium
Your impact:
As an Experienced Consultant Forensic, you will support the reappraisal of financial and white-collar crime as well as their prevention - and thus contribute to the security and business viability of companies.
  • Investigation: You will support us in conducting special investigations in cases of economic and corporate crime.
  • Dispute and Litigation: To this end, you will prepare expert opinions on accounting law or business management issues for legal disputes, for example.
  • Fraud Prevention: You will be actively involved in the design and implementation of preventive measures as well as the improvement of internal processes and control systems.
  • Innovative approaches: In addition, you will develop solutions with us that take into account current and future customer needs and offer significant added value.
  • Teamwork: You will work with other Deloitte Practices in Belgium and abroad on an interdisciplinary basis and take on responsible tasks at an early stage.

Let's talk about you
Your skillset:
  • Degree
column3: business engineer,&nbsp
column4:
economics, business informatics or a comparable course of study successfully completed
  • Proficiency in advanced data analytics techniques and tools (e.g., statistical modeling, data mining, machine learning) with the ability to apply these skills to complex business problems.
  • Ideally, initial practical experience in the areas of forensic, compliance, audit, tax consulting, accounting or controlling
  • High self-motivation, Independence and enjoyment of complex issues and conceptual tasks
  • Strong team orientation, good presentation and communication skills
  • Willingness to travel as well as very good written and spoken Dutch and English
    • Your chance:
    • Best-in-class continuing education at Deloitte University as well as within the framework of individual qualification offers and training courses
    • Comprehensive development opportunities through structured career planning, inclusive leadership, secondment programs, project-based job rotation as well as promotion of social commitment and corporate volunteering
    • Work-life balance thanks to mobile working &
column5:
part-time, sabbaticals and family services, e.g. to support family caregivers, parental leave counselling and much more
  • Focus on health and fitness through regular health days, cooperation with fitness providers and support for sports and team events
  • Attractive employer benefits including bike and car leasing, company smartphone for private use and flexible working models such as trust-based working hours and EU remote working
  • Diverse creative freedom and active promotion of an inclusive corporate culture - including through our Diversity &
column6: Inclusion employee networks Our Risk, Regulatory &
column7:
Forensic practice is a global leader in helping clients manage risk and uncertainty from the boardroom to the network. We provide a broad array of services that allow our clients around the world to better measure, manage and control risk to enhance the reliability of systems and processes throughout their organization.



Who is Deloitte?

We provide industry-leading audit and assurance, tax and legal, consulting and related services. We are committed to driving innovation across offerings to help our clients address their challenges, while giving our professionals opportunities to learn and grow in this era of transformation.

In Belgium, +5000 dedicated professionals active in +10 offices, take great pride in bringing multidisciplinary expertise to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.


Why Deloitte?

Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you.

Never stop growing!Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact.

We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.

Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:

  • My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and priorities

  • Sustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte

  • Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte

  • Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte

  • Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities



Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangementsremains essential in today's reality:

  • Hybrid workplace:combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises).

  • Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.



Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!

4276026752,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/quantitative-analyst-at-engie-belgium-4276026752?position=45&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=qp31cLlWnO091A7SsbHvEg%3D%3D,Quantitative Analyst,ENGIE Belgium,"Uccle, Brussels Region, Belgium","Quantitative analyst
About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (“raison d’être”) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 100,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress
About S&EM:

BU Supply & Energy Management provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients (businesses and retail) through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE’s assets and contributing to value creation.

15000 employees around the world develop our solutions, through international business platforms and B2C entities. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors, industrials and retail. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.
At S&EM we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation

Context: The Expertise Center (EC) Quantitative Research and Modeling (QRM) within GEMS is a team of around 115 quantitative analysts. It’s mission is to provide advanced quantitative expertise to all Business Platforms (BP) of GEMS and to Engie worldwide. The quantitative analyst will be part of the “Pricing” team (approximately 15 people) and will be fully dedicated to the Business Platform Power Trading & Commercial.
Role:
The quantitative analyst should design and provide robust quantitative tools that have a concrete impact on the power business:

Work very closely with the BP Power Trading & Commercial, mainly with the Renewable and Batteries Trading team and the Asset Backed Power Trading team. He / She needs to understand their business needs, and needs to provide them with high-quality quantitative support in their day to day activities.
Participate in enhancing the existing pricing and managing framework.
Deliver ad hoc tactical solutions as well as develop new pricers in the official pricing library.
Play a key role for developing new products, linked for example to the renewable and battery business (pricing, managing strategies, various risk indicators, …).
Promote best coding practices that comply with general rules and standards.
Document and share knowledge across GEMS on the different models used within GEMS.
Hard skills:
Must have:
Strong Financial Mathematical background (probability, stochastic calculus, various numerical methods such as Monte Carlo, finite differences, …)
Coding experience (preferably C# and python), object oriented programming skills
Familiar with Git
Good to have:
Experience on the power markets
Experience on different optimization methods
Experience in a trading environment
Soft skills:
Must have:
Practical and conceptual thinking
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues
Ability to deliver concrete solutions
Autonomy
Working together
Ed ucation and professional background:
Engineering or university degree (Master of PhD) in Computer Sciences, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Financial Engineering.
0 to 3 years of experience in a similar role.
Languages:
English
Travels: Occasional travels (for example conferences) are possible, but limited.
If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!
Apply by attaching your updated CV.
ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals.

All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.
Business Unit: GEMS
Divisie: GEMS - EC QUANTITATIVE RESEARCH & MODELING
Juridische entiteit: ENGIE GLOBAL MARKETS, BELGIAN BRANCH
Professionele werkervaring: Junior (<3 jaar ervaring)
Opleidingsniveau: WO / Master opleiding

Product Analyst required to join a forward thinking & innovative technology business. They are marketing leading with their space and looking for people from digitally driven environment or iGaming & betting space. They offer excellent career advancement alongside regular salary reviews.
Main skills:
SQL
Tableau
A/B testing
Stakeholder management
Person profile
Strong SQL and Tableau, along with Excel and MS Office.
Strong applied statistics. Including experimental design and analysis, cross-sectional and time-series data analysis techniques, and familiarity with regular probability theory and concepts.
Strong R or Python, or similar open-source data manipulation and analysis tool.
Strong data and analytical skills. Including ability to identify and specify data requirements for projects.
Strong verbal, written and presentational skills, including the ability to explain analytical concepts and results to non-technical audiences, and writing work specifications for others to implement.
Able to work on multiple projects, including ability to keep track of deliverables and deadlines.
Self-motivated, proactive, independent, responsible and eager to learn.
Gaming experience in a relevant role would be preferred.

4288950402,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/consultant-business-intelligence-analyst-at-exsolv%C3%A6-4288950402?position=49&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=VrZJpvnV4sU49hwCI3MmLQ%3D%3D,Consultant - Business Intelligence Analyst,Exsolvæ,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"Your Role

As a BI Analyst, you play a crucial role in analyzing, modeling, visualizing and optimizing data to gain strategic insights. You will work with various teams to develop robust data models, create impactful visualizations and ensure that data is accurately, consistently, and efficiently mapped and processed.
Requirements
At least 3 years of experience as a BI/Data Analyst or in a similar role
Deep expertise in Power BI, including designing and maintaining dashboards that deliver clear, actionable insights
Strong SQL and DAX skills, with experience creating efficient queries, calculations, and measures
Hands-on experience with Databricks for data transformation, preparation, and modeling to support BI solutions
Proven experience designing, maintaining, and optimizing tabular models for high-performance analytics
Knowledge of data modeling (e.g., star schemas, dimensional models) and experience applying these in BI projects
Familiarity with implementing role-based data access and security measures (RLS/OLS)
Excellent communication skills and the ability to clearly convey complex insights
Strong analytical thinking and a structured approach to complex problems
Languages: Bilingual – Fluent in Dutch & English or French & English
What You Will Do
Develop and optimize data models that support strategic decision-making
Build, enhance, and maintain Power BI dashboards that transform complex datasets into clear, actionable insights for stakeholders
Work with large datasets in Power BI, ensuring efficient processing and responsive visualization
Streamline and enhance data transformations using best practices in tools like Power Query and DAX
Implement and manage data security measures to ensure the right users access the right information at the right time
Analyze data using statistical and analytical techniques
Contribute to organization-wide BI strategies, including guidelines and knowledge sharing
Improve current data governance and implement procedures for high-quality, trusted, and consistent data
Why Choose Exsolvæ?
Work on impactful data projects
Collaborate with experts in an innovative and learning-driven environment
Access professional development opportunities to strengthen your skills
Hybrid work environment with a healthy balance between remote and on-site
Competitive salary package and comprehensive benefits

Your Role


As a BI Analyst, you play a crucial role in analyzing, modeling, visualizing and optimizing data to gain strategic insights. You will work with various teams to develop robust data models, create impactful visualizations and ensure that data is accurately, consistently, and efficiently mapped and processed.


Requirements


  • At least 3 years of experience as a BI/Data Analyst or in a similar role
  • Deep expertise in Power BI, including designing and maintaining dashboards that deliver clear, actionable insights
  • Strong SQL and DAX skills, with experience creating efficient queries, calculations, and measures
  • Hands-on experience with Databricks for data transformation, preparation, and modeling to support BI solutions
  • Proven experience designing, maintaining, and optimizing tabular models for high-performance analytics
  • Knowledge of data modeling (e.g., star schemas, dimensional models) and experience applying these in BI projects
  • Familiarity with implementing role-based data access and security measures (RLS/OLS)
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to clearly convey complex insights
  • Strong analytical thinking and a structured approach to complex problems
  • Languages: Bilingual – Fluent in Dutch &
column2: English or French &amp

English



What You Will Do


  • Develop and optimize data models that support strategic decision-making
  • Build, enhance, and maintain Power BI dashboards that transform complex datasets into clear, actionable insights for stakeholders
  • Work with large datasets in Power BI, ensuring efficient processing and responsive visualization
  • Streamline and enhance data transformations using best practices in tools like Power Query and DAX
  • Implement and manage data security measures to ensure the right users access the right information at the right time
  • Analyze data using statistical and analytical techniques

4289458954,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-data-analyst-bene-at-schneider-electric-4289458954?position=50&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=rSdCl4tJ5zrazu4ar1xhjQ%3D%3D,Senior Data Analyst BeNe,Schneider Electric,"Ukkel, Brussels Region, Belgium","Location: Brussels or Hoofddorp

Are you driven by data and passionate about creating exceptional customer experiences? Join our BeNe Customer Experience & Quality team as a Senior Data Analyst, where your insights will shape the future of how we serve our customers.

This is a high-impact role at the heart of a major transformation, including the rollout of AI and the evolution of our Customer Contact Center. You’ll be the bridge between raw data and strategic decisions, helping us improve satisfaction, streamline operations, and future-proof our services.
Key responsibilities:
Customer Insights: Analyze feedback from loyalty and transactional surveys, mapping it by persona and touchpoint to uncover opportunities across the customer journey.
Root Cause Analysis: Identify recurring themes in quality cases and complaints to drive long-term solutions and process improvements.
Operational Efficiency: Use data to optimize key metrics like FTE, workload, AHT, and quality scores, supporting smarter resource planning.
AI Readiness: Assess data maturity and support the deployment of scalable AI and agent-assist technologies.
Reporting & Dashboards: Build and maintain dashboards using Tableau, BFO, and Medallia to support leadership with consistent, time-saving insights.
Data Management: Clean, structure, and manage large datasets, developing robust data models and reporting systems.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with teams across the business, including Finance, to enhance data governance and prioritize Cost of Poor Quality (CoPQ) initiatives.
Qualifications:
3+ years of experience in data analytics, ideally in customer-facing or pricing environments.
Proficiency in Tableau, Excel, PowerPoint, and SQL.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and storytelling abilities to turn data into actionable insights.
Experience managing multiple priorities and working cross-functionally.
Fluency in English plus French or Dutch.
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Marketing, or a related field.
Bonus: Experience with data warehousing and ETL tools like Amazon Glue.
Let us learn about you! Apply today.
You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.
Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?

When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our  IMPACT values - Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork - starts with us.

IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.
We are looking for IMPACT Makers
column2: exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.

Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and ‘inclusion’ is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do.

At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. You can find out more about our Trust Charter here

column2: Are you driven by data and passionate about creating exceptional customer experiences? Join our BeNe Customer Experience &
column3: Quality team as a<span>&nbsp
column4:
Senior Data Analyst, where your insights will shape the future of how we serve our customers.

This is a high-impact role at the heart of a major transformation, including the rollout of AI and the evolution of our Customer Contact Center. You’ll be the bridge between raw data and strategic decisions, helping us improve satisfaction, streamline operations, and future-proof our services.
column5:
Key responsibilities:

  • Customer Insights: Analyze feedback from loyalty and transactional surveys, mapping it by persona and touchpoint to uncover opportunities across the customer journey.
  • Root Cause Analysis: Identify recurring themes in quality cases and complaints to drive long-term solutions and process improvements.
  • Operational Efficiency: Use data to optimize key metrics like FTE, workload, AHT, and quality scores, supporting smarter resource planning.
  • AI Readiness: Assess data maturity and support the deployment of scalable AI and agent-assist technologies.
  • Reporting &
column6:
Dashboards: Build and maintain dashboards using Tableau, BFO, and Medallia to support leadership with consistent, time-saving insights.
  • Data Management: Clean, structure, and manage large datasets, developing robust data models and reporting systems.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with teams across the business, including Finance, to enhance data governance and prioritize Cost of Poor Quality (CoPQ) initiatives.

    • Qualifications:

    • 3+ years of experience in data analytics, ideally in customer-facing or pricing environments.
    • Proficiency in Tableau, Excel, PowerPoint, and SQL.
    • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
    • Excellent communication and storytelling abilities to turn data into actionable insights.
    • Experience managing multiple priorities and working cross-functionally.
    • Fluency in English plus French or Dutch.
    • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Marketing, or a related field.
    • Bonus: Experience with data warehousing and ETL tools like Amazon Glue.

    Let us learn about you! Apply today.

4280019469,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-van-de-velde-4280019469?position=53&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=ZdvFjM%2FKogz%2FpCF7ZINy8A%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Van de Velde,"Schellebelle, Flemish Region, Belgium","Introductie

Van de Velde is een ambitieus & internationaal bedrijf dat met meer dan 100 jaar ervaring de bekende premium lingeriemerken Marie Jo, PrimaDonna en Sarda creëert en produceert. Wil je deel uitmaken van een zeer toegewijd en uiterst professioneel team, +1500 medewerkers wereldwijd? Van de Velde lingerie, reeds 25 jaar beursgenoteerd, blijft groeien.
Onze missie: ‘we ignite the power in women’

Van de Velde is een bedrijf waar medewerkers altijd centraal hebben gestaan. Wij geloven sterk in de kracht en het potentieel van mensen, en in de kracht in vrouwen in het bijzonder. Dat uit zich in onze relatie met medewerkers, consumenten en vrouwen in de samenleving.
We zijn gedreven door Passie | We ademen Kwaliteit | We zijn authentiek | We richten ons op Consumenten en Klanten | We zijn Ondernemend | Samen zijn we Sterk.

Wij zijn op zoek naar een collega die ons kan helpen groeien, dezelfde waarden deelt en ernaar uitkijkt om samen met een goed contact met onze klanten te onderhouden. Ben je bereid om een positief verschil te maken? Zet je carrière verder en kom werken bij Van de Velde lingerie!
Je Functie

Als data-analist maak je deel uit van het datateam en speel je een centrale rol in het waarborgen van kwalitatieve, consistente en goed beheerde data binnen de organisatie. Samen met de data engineers bouw je mee aan het data platform van de toekomst, gebaseerd op Azure-technologie.

Als brugfunctie tussen data engineers, IT en de commerciële teams (marketing, sales en e-commerce) denk je actief mee over hoe strategische en commerciële behoeften vertaald kunnen worden naar concrete, datagedreven oplossingen.
Jouw verantwoordelijkheden:
Je gaat op zoek naar gegevens uit interne en externe bronnen en beschrijft de benodigde data voor de data engineers
Je verdiept je in de commerciële business en stel data oplossingen voor die aansluiten bij hun noden.
Je bouwt mee aan een structuur en de fundamenten om te zorgen voor een eenduidige rapportering en benadering rond data.
Je sorteert, presenteert, vertaalt en visualiseert de data naar powerbi en zet dit om in dashboards die jouw resultaat inzichtelijk maken.
Je draagt bij aan het versterken van de datacultuur binnen de organisatie
Je Profiel
Je hebt een masterdiploma en minstens 3 jaar ervaring in data analyse
Je bent vertrouwt met PowerBI en Business Intelligence oplossingen
Kennis van machine learning concepten, Azure analytics zijn een pluspunt
Bij voorkeur heb je affiniteit met commerciële interne klanten, idealiter vanuit een fashion of retail omgeving.
Goede communicatie vaardigheden in het Nederlands en Engels
Je skills en vaardigheden:
Je combineert jouw analytische en cijfermatige vaardigheden met een change mindset.
Je vindt de balans tussen vooruitgang en perfectie, voelt aan waar detailgerichtheid primeert op vooruitgang en andersom.

Jouw interpersoonlijke vaardigheden doen je makkelijk connecteren binnen IT, data en de business partners. Je kan zowel technisch als qua business meepraten en weet stakeholders met elkaar te verbinden.
Je slaagt erin door te denken en diepgang te brengen in je werk. Je zoekt naar een strategische en structurele impact.
You love living the Van de Velde values!
Ons Aanbod

Een contract van onbepaalde duur en voltijdse tewerkstelling in een stabiel en internationaal beursgenoteerd modebedrijf met een aangename bedrijfscultuur waar ruimte is voor eigen initiatief en ideeën.
Competitief loonpakket en extralegale voordelen, zoals een bedrijfswagen.
Grondig opleidingstraject bij opstart en permanente opleiding
9 ADV-dagen bovenop het wettelijk verlof, flexibel op te nemen.
Extra voordelen zoals personeelskortingen, een jaarlijkse teamuitstap en gezellige ""Van de Velde Cafés"".
Gezien de vakantieperiode is het mogelijk dat er wat vertraging in het proces zit. Bedankt voor uw begrip!

4264766321,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-specialist-statistician-%E2%80%93-based-in-luxembourg-at-european-investment-bank-eib-4264766321?position=54&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=JtepA9cnOCUgq02T3dMC6g%3D%3D,Data specialist/Statistician – based in Luxembourg,European Investment Bank (EIB),"Brussels Region, Belgium","This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Secretariat General (SG) – Economic Department (ECON) – Economic Studies Division (ES) – Statistical Unit (SU) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a Data specialist/Statistician*.
This is a full-time position at grade 4 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.
Internal benchmark Associate Economist
Panel interviews are foreseen as from the end of August 2025 .
Purpose

You will maintain economic databases, statistics, as well as contribute to economic and econometric analysis to derive recommendations that help shape strategic decision-making of the EIB in order to contribute to policy formulation and dialogue.
Operating Network

The unit is positioned in SG/ECON/ES but serves the needs of the whole department. The unit designs, develops and maintains all databases, manages the contractual agreements with private database providers, offers statistical and econometric support to ECON staff, maintains the ECON server and various data toolkits posted on the EIB website and organises the sharing of data through secured and restricted web access with external collaborators.

In addition, the unit contributes to automatize processes related to country, policy and research work, provides technical support related to the ratings of sovereigns and banks as well as to local currency pricing. Relatedly, it manages control functions and critical report declarations such as EUC and ICF. You will report to the Head of the Statistical Unit, under the overall supervision of the Head of the Economic Studies Division and the Director of the Department.
Accountabilities
Maintain the Department’s data-architecture, including databases, tools and interfaces.
Support and contribute to statistical, econometric and economic analyses.
Support the technical implementation of tools for surveys and data analytics based on surveys.
Communicate analytical results visually and contribute to standardizing reporting and presentation outputs in a way that can be understood by non-experts.
Contribute to the development of tools to standardize the presentation of economic output of the department.
Collaborate with the assigned IT team on the solutions of the process simplification and automation.
Liaise with relevant counterparts within the Department, the Bank as well as in other national, EU, and international institutions and think tanks.

Contribute through database development and relevant analysis to the policy dialogue and the analysis of key models and policy papers and presentations as well as for other internal and external stakeholders.
Propose improvements of processes, procedures, methodologies and working methods.
Qualifications
University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in econometrics, quantitative economics, mathematics, statistics, information technology

At least 3 years of experience in statistical analyses, database management and econometrics, for example acquired working in the relevant units of an international or EU institution, statistical office, consulting, government, banking, academia
Programming skills (Python, R, SQL, VBA, MiKTeX, JavaScript) and knowledge of relevant software for data management and analysis (Stata, RStudio, SAS)
Knowledge of applied quantitative methods
Knowledge of economic concepts and standard relevant macroeconomic and microeconomic data series and sources
Previous experience in integrating big data in economic analysis and/or knowledge of survey statistical methods would be an advantage
Experience in written, visual and oral communication of complex quantitative analyses
Ability to deliver under time pressure when needed
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French and a good knowledge of the other (**). Working knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.
Competencies
Find out more about EIB core competencies here
To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here

(**) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
This is an open campaign to consecutively fill an open position. The campaign will remain open until the 8th of September 2025. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

    We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

    By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.

    This is an open campaign to consecutively fill an open position. The campaign will remain open until the 8th of September 2025. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

4285849314,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-analyst-at-innova-solutions-4285849314?position=55&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=6%2FKCU70A8Hh44ZJpc8N4WA%3D%3D,Digital Analyst,Innova Solutions,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Job Title: Senior Digital Customer Journey Analyst
Job type : CDI Contracts / Freelancers
Location: Brussels
Work Regime: Hybrid
Keywords: Adobe Analytics/ Content square / monitor KPIs/ Performance metrics

Sector: Our client is a prominent player in the financial sector, recognized for its comprehensive range of banking and financial services. With a global presence, it serves a diverse clientele, including individuals, corporations, and institutions. Emphasizing innovation and customer-centricity, it leverages advanced technologies to deliver tailored solutions that meet the evolving needs of its stakeholders.

Position Overview: As a Senior Digital Customer Journey Analyst, your mission is to capture and understand the end-to-end customer journey across all digital touchpoints (web and app). Your insights will help continuously improve customer experience and drive the performance of our digital business.
What you'll do:
Tagging Strategy & Implementation
Challenge business needs by clarifying objectives and defining KPIs and supporting metrics.
Develop and document tagging strategies and technical specifications for implementation by Front-End developers.
Collaborate with developers by creating detailed User Stories for tagging requirements.
Analytics & Reporting
Build dashboards and reports to monitor KPIs and performance metrics.
Conduct in-depth quantitative analyses to identify opportunities for improvement.
Present findings through compelling data storytelling tailored to various audiences.
Data-Driven Culture
Promote a data-driven mindset across the organization.
Educate stakeholders on data usage and facilitate data-informed decision-making.
What you bring:
Experience- Minimum 4 years of relevant experience in digital analytics or customer journey analysis.
Technical Skills -Mandatory: Adobe Analytics, Contentsquare
Preferred: Experience with Agile methodologies
Business Skills- Ability to translate business objectives into KPIs and tagging strategies.
A little about us:

Innova Solutions is a diverse and award-winning global technology services partner. We provide our clients with strategic technology, talent, and business transformation solutions, enabling them to be leaders in their field.
in 1998, headquartered in Atlanta (Duluth), Georgia.
over 50,000 professionals worldwide, with annual revenue approaching $3.0B.
strategic technology and business transformation solutions globally.
through global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe.
services for data center migration and workload development for cloud service providers.

Choice Awards - Best Companies to Work for Women & Millennials, 2024

4292652511,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/power-bi-consultant-at-organi-4292652511?position=56&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=M8JX8UPHFw9fXr%2B%2BqaDeDw%3D%3D,Power BI Consultant,Organi,Antwerp Metropolitan Area,"Ben je een gedreven consultant met een passie voor data en BI? Wil je jouw technische vaardigheden in Power BI inzetten om schaalbare dataoplossingen te ontwikkelen? En sta je graag mee aan de wieg van een nieuwe business unit? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou!
Wie zijn wij?

Organi is actief op de markt sinds 1977 en is een gevestigde waarde in de IT-sector. We zijn expert in sectorspecifieke totaaloplossingen: business software en IT-services. Na een samenwerking met een externe partner hebben we besloten om zelf intern een business unit BI & AI te ontwikkelen, zodat we onze klanten nog beter kunnen ondersteunen met innovatieve en flexibele oplossingen.
Wie ben jij?
Je hebt minstens 4-5 jaar ervaring met Power BI, inclusief het bouwen van geavanceerde rapporten en dashboards. Ervaring met andere BI-tools zoals Tableau en Qlik is een plus.
Je hebt een professionele achtergrond in business intelligence, data science of een relevant vakgebied. Ervaring in onze sector is een troef.
Je hebt een goede kennis van DAX en bent ook goed onderlegd in data modeling, visualisatie en reporting.
Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatie-, presentatie-, analytische en probleemoplossende vaardigheden.
Een vlotte kennis van de Nederlandse taal is essentieel, aangezien je regelmatig klantencontact hebt.
Hoe zal jouw werkdag als Power BI Consultant eruitzien?

Je ontwerpt, ontwikkelt en beheert geavanceerde Power BI-rapporten, je verbetert datastromen en je creëert inzichtelijke en bruikbare dashboards voor klanten. Samen met je collega’s tweak je deze dashboards en reports op die manier dat ze voldoen aan de specifieke wensen van de business.
Je bent medeverantwoordelijk voor het verzorgen van data en transformeert ze in intuïtieve dashboards die rechtstreeks door klanten worden gebruikt.
Je werkt nauw samen met diverse teams binnen de organisatie om hun databehoeften te begrijpen, de logica te implementeren en te vertalen naar bruikbare inzichten.
Je past best practices toe op het gebied van datavisualisatie en gebruikerservaring.
Je implementeert automatische systemen voor datamonitoring en datakwaliteit.
Je denkt actief mee na over procesverbeteringen en efficiëntie en draagt actief bij aan de verbetering van data governance en kwaliteitsnormen binnen onze organisatie.
Je hebt een sleutelrol in het bevorderen van een datagedreven cultuur binnen het bedrijf.
Wat heeft Organi jou te bieden?

Een aantrekkelijke verloning aangevuld met mooie voordelen: bedrijfswagen, laptop, flexibel werken, 6 extra vakantiedagen, anciënniteitsverlof, groepsverzekering, hospitalisatieverzekering, maaltijdcheques & groepsbonus.
Je werkt bij onze klanten of op kantoor in Wilrijk, afgewisseld met thuiswerk.

Een uitdagende en afwisselende job, want je werkt voornamelijk voor Organi, maar bent inzetbaar voor de ganse groep. Dit betekent dat je betrokken bent binnen de verschillende bedrijven voor diverse projecten en klanten waar je geregeld ook ter plaatse zal gaan.
Mogelijkheden voor professionele groei en ontwikkeling.
Een dynamische en stimulerende werkomgeving met een open en informele cultuur.
De kans om deel uit te maken van een innovatief en datagedreven team.
Last but not least: een groep van 150 Belgische en Nederlandse collega’s en veel fun tijdens onze extra activiteiten!

4116238397,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/statistical-analyst-at-medpace-4116238397?position=59&pageNum=0&refId=U8Gt5olF1zkinZSbiQucxw%3D%3D&trackingId=GJflSNwrOYJBs98%2BvSnhcQ%3D%3D,Statistical Analyst,Medpace,"Leuven, Flemish Region, Belgium","Our corporate activities are growing rapidly, and we are currently seeking a full-time, office-based Statistical analyst to join our statistics team. This position will work on a team to accomplish tasks and projects that are instrumental to the company’s success. If you want an exciting career where you use your previous expertise and can develop and grow your career even further, then this is the opportunity for you.
Responsibilities
Write statistical programs for use in creating analysis datasets, tables, listings, and figures
Review analysis plans for appropriate methods
Program study analyses and review study results
column2: and

column1: Communicate the project requirements for cleanup and data capture to ensure the key study variables are suitable for analysis.
Qualifications
Master’s Degree
2-3 years of industry working experience with SAS programming, or SAS certificate
Knowledge of databases and data management process
column2: and

column1: Knowledge of statistical methods commonly used in pharmaceutical clinical trials.
We kindly ask to send applications in English.
Medpace Overview

Medpace is a full-service clinical contract research organization (CRO). We provide Phase I-IV clinical development services to the biotechnology, pharmaceutical and medical device industries. Our mission is to accelerate the global development of safe and effective medical therapeutics through its scientific and disciplined approach. We leverage local regulatory and therapeutic expertise across all major areas including oncology, cardiology, metabolic disease, endocrinology, central nervous system, anti-viral and anti-infective. Headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, employing more than 5,000 people across 40+ countries.
Why Medpace?
People. Purpose. Passion. Make a Difference Tomorrow. Join Us Today.

The work we’ve done over the past 30+ years has positively impacted the lives of countless patients and families who face hundreds of diseases across all key therapeutic areas. The work we do today will improve the lives of people living with illness and disease in the future.
Medpace Perks
Flexible work environment
Competitive compensation and benefits package
Competitive PTO packages
Structured career paths with opportunities for professional growth
Company-sponsored employee appreciation events
Employee health and wellness initiatives
Awards
Recognized by Forbes as one of America's Most Successful Midsize Companies in 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024
Continually recognized with CRO Leadership Awards from Life Science Leader magazine based on expertise, quality, capabilities, reliability, and compatibility
What To Expect Next
A Medpace team member will review your qualifications and, if interested, you will be contacted with details for next steps.

4282450023,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-equans-belux-4282450023?position=2&pageNum=2&refId=SlS%2BsThmOw4EaKbEnH5bYA%3D%3D&trackingId=3zT3tSf1HKnlhGqJubUWqA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Equans BeLux,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","What if you could shape the future of HR decision-making?
With us, your expertise won’t just sit in dashboards – it will actively support HR innovation across the entire organization.
To strengthen our HR IS team, we’re looking for a Data Analyst who thrives in a dynamic, agile environment and is eager to turn complex HR data into powerful insights.

You’ll get to work on varied, business-critical HR projects with real impact – all while collaborating with a supportive and passionate team. If you love working at the intersection of data, people, and technology, this job was made for you.
Your work location: our Equans-site in Brussels
As our HR Data Analyst, you will:
translate business needs into clear analysis and reporting actions
collaborate closely with analysts with different expertise within HR
work in an agile team
act as the bridge between business and the developers
collect, clean and prepare data from multiple sources (databases, systems…)
prototype Power BI reports
evaluate results and help steer improvements
document processes, solutions and user guides
support the business during testing phases and guide them through test scenarios
What You Bring To The Table
5+ years of experience in data analysis,
2+ years of experience working in agile teams
hands-on knowledge of Power BI and MS Office
experience with Azure DevOps, MS Visio, DAX or SAP BI is a plus
strong communication & social skills and a proactive mindset
analytical, independent and focused on solutions
customer-oriented and eager to keep learning
fluent in Dutch, French and English
Ready to shape the way data drives HR?
Want to tackle tomorrow’s multi-technical challenges with us?

At Equans, you find an exciting career within a stable and financially sound company. You work on challenging, diverse projects and assist our clients with today’s three major transitions: the energy transition, the industrial transition, and the digital transition.
You have the opportunity to discover cutting-edge technologies and further develop your skills.
Joining Equans is more than that! You also get:
a competitive salary in line with your education and experience
interesting training and career opportunities
group-, hospitalization-, disability insurance
eco & meal vouchers, 13th month, holiday pay
concessionary travel, lease car (with fuel/charging card), parking, bicycle lease plan
smartphone with subscription, internet fee
additional paid leave, seniority leave, homeworking
discounts through Benefits@Work (culture, sports, travel, and more)
Add to that the contagious warm atmosphere at Equans, and what are you waiting for?
We look forward to welcoming you!

Does this description fit you and would you like more information? Contact our HR colleague Erwin Verniers – 02 370 30 62 – erwin.verniers@external.equans.com – https://www.linkedin.com/in/erwin-verniers
