4285585062,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/assistant-secretary-general-operations-at-nato-4285585062?position=3&pageNum=2&refId=SlS%2BsThmOw4EaKbEnH5bYA%3D%3D&trackingId=kNt15a7fwib8mwQBF9mGbw%3D%3D,"Assistant Secretary General, Operations",NATO,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Primary Location
Belgium-Brussels
NATO Body
NATO International Staff (NATO IS)
Schedule
Full-time
Application Deadline
Grade
Unclassified
SUMMARY

The mission of the Operations Division (OPS) of the International Staff is to prepare NATO for the defence of Alliance territory, to respond to crises at home and abroad, and to strengthen the capabilities of partners. The Operations Division advances the core tasks of the Alliance (Deterrence and Defence, Crisis Prevention and Management and Cooperative Security) by providing situational awareness, advance planning, well-exercised and executed crisis response, and outcome-oriented defence and related security cooperation programmes. The Assistant Secretary General (ASG) for Operations is also the NATO Secretary General’s Special Coordinator for the fight against terrorism. The Division consists of two directorates.

The Operations Directorate provides comprehensive advice and support to the Secretary General, the North Atlantic Council, Allies and partners to facilitate the decision-making process relating to NATO’s defence plans as well as the entire spectrum of crisis management. This advice and support cover strategic political, civil and military aspects of current and potential operations, missions, assistance and exercises.

The Defence and Security Cooperation Directorate (DSCD) facilitates political-military decision-making, programme design and programme implementation with partner nations – including Ukraine - to enhance their defence capabilities and institutions, strengthen resilience, promote integrity, transparency, accountability and good governance in the defence and related security sector.

The ASG/OPS manages the Operations Division (approximately 140 staff members) and is supported in this task by the Deputy ASG, one director who is in charge of the Operations Directorate and one Director who is in charge of the DSCD.

There are 6 Assistant Secretaries General, all of whom report to the NATO Secretary General through the Chief of Staff and are also accountable to the North Atlantic Council. As a member of the Secretary General’s senior leadership, each Assistant Secretary General is also expected to contribute to overall policy development and delivery, including in areas beyond their direct set of responsibilities.
QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE
Essential
The candidate must:
have at least 15 years of experience working on political-military issues, preferably at a large security policy and defence-related national or multi-national organisation
hold a university degree (Master’s level preferred) or equivalent level of qualification in a relevant field for this position
have experience working in a multilateral environment or an environment with a variety of stakeholders from multi-cultural backgrounds
have a proven track record of experience in progressively senior leadership positions and significant professional experience in managerial positions
have extensive people management experience and the capacity to lead, motivate and engage diverse and multidisciplinary teams
have extensive experience in the integration of complex political and military issues, ideally to include the politico-military aspects of crisis management or military operations
have a proven track record in facilitating high-level dialogue and consensus
be an innovative, strategic, conceptual thinker and be able to design and use complex influencing strategies to fulfil the required objectives
possess the following minimum levels of NATO’s official languages (English/French): VI (“Proficiency”) in one
column2: II (“Elementary”) in the other.

column1: DESIRABLE
The following would be considered an advantage:
a higher level of proficiency in NATO’s second official language (English/French)
experience in leading change management projects/programmes
experience in theater operations
an advanced degree, postgraduate studies, or equivalent level, in a relevant field.
ACCOUNTABILITIES

The ASG/OPS deals directly with NATO members and partners, as well as other International Organisations, on issues relating to operations and missions. S/he works extensively with other NATO bodies, other International Staff Divisions and the International Military Staff, employing cross-cutting approaches on topics relevant to the core areas.

The ASG/OPS is responsible for chairing several senior NATO committees, including the Operations Policy Committee, and the Council Operations and Exercise Committee. Experience of facilitating high-level dialogue and consensus is therefore essential. The incumbent will also be called upon to represent the Secretary General at high-level meetings and will speak in public fora on behalf of the Secretary General. There is a substantial representation function associated with this appointment. As a Senior Leader, the incumbent will aim to achieve the following objectives:
Vision and Direction: Develop, communicate and implement a vision for the future development of the Division to face the challenges of the future in an ever-changing environment
column2: champion change and federate the teams around common objectives, ensuring that vision guides their mid and long-term programme of work
column3: act as a role model of inclusive leadership and promote integrity, resilience and innovation.

column1: People Management: In their role as manager of the Division, lead and oversee a large team of international staff working under the direct supervision of Directors and Heads of Sections. More specifically:
Talent attraction: Ensure recruitment panels for posts in her/his Division are fair and objective
column2: make selection recommendations with the best interests of the Organization in mind

column1: Talent development: Adhere to sound management principles with staff, and provide in-depth mentoring, coaching and training opportunities
column2: be available for guidance at critical moments
column3: ensure that all divisional staff are clear on organisational and divisional objectives
column4: provide regular and fair feedback on performance, informally as appropriate and via the performance management system

column1: Performance Management: Participate in a collegial review of performance at divisional level to discuss possible development and mobility opportunities for individuals, identify high potentials and help ensure common standards are applied in the process across the Organization
column2: make contract renewal or conversion recommendations with the best interests of the Organization in mind

column1: Continual improvement culture: Actively contribute to the improvement of the Organizational policies and processes
column2: participate in leadership learning and development Programmes, related to the successful execution of her/his duties.

column1: COMPETENCIES
The candidate must demonstrate the following:
Achievement: Demonstrates decisiveness based on solid considerations and trade-offs.
Change Leadership: Champions change.
Conceptual Thinking: Creates new concepts
Developing Others: Provides in-depth mentoring, coaching and training.
Impact and Influence: Uses complex influence strategies.
Initiative: Plans and acts for the long term.
Leadership: Communicates a compelling vision.
Organizational Awareness: Understands underlying issues.
Self-Control: Stays composed and positive even under extreme pressure.
KEY CHALLENGES
Key challenges facing the successful candidate for ASG/OPS during the next 3 years will likely include:

Developing policy advice on NATO’s collective defence plans, current and future NATO operations and missions, including NATO Support to Ukraine (NSATU), NATO’s maritime operations, NATO’s KFOR operation, NATO’s Mission in Iraq, and NATO’s participation in the fight against terrorism
Designing and implementing a large rapidly growing programme of capacity building assistance to Ukraine, in close cooperation with relevant NATO bodies and Allied stakeholders
Developing the Alliance’s ability to respond rapidly threats and challenges to Allies’ security and other crisis management situations that might arise in the current security environment
Overseeing and further developing relationships with other International Organisations on operational issues.

Candidates are asked, as part of this application, to attach one MS Word document, summarising their views on these key (and possible other) challenges and how they would address them if selected for the position. This essay, which should be no more than 2 A4 pages long, will be evaluated as part of the longlisting assessment.
CONTRACT
The successful applicant will be employed for an initial period of 3 years. Exceptionally, there may be possibility of a one-year extension thereafter.
RECRUITMENT PROCESS
Applications must be submitted using one of the following links, as applicable:
For NATO civilian staff members only: please apply via the internal recruitment portal (for more information, please contact your local Civilian HR Manager)
For all other applications: www.nato.int/recruitment
Selection of candidates for NATO posts is based upon the merit principle.
Candidates are requested to attach their essay to their application on Taleo, by latest 14 October 2025.
The title of the attachment must include the vacancy referenceand the words “Key challenges”.
Shortlisted candidates will have to be available for the selection process, which is expected to take place in Brussels, Belgium at the beginning of November 2025.
COMPENSATION: candidates shortlisted will be provided with a simulation of the financial package for this post.

Appointment will be subject to receipt of a security clearance (provided by the national Authorities of the selected candidate) and approval of the candidate’s medical file by the NATO Medical Adviser.
More information about the recruitment process and conditions of employment, can be found at our website ( http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/recruit-hq-e.htm )

NATO will not accept any phase of the recruitment and selection prepared, in whole or in part, by means of generative artificial-intelligence (AI) tools, including and without limitation to chatbots, such as Chat Generative Pre-trained Transformer (Chat GPT), or other language generating tools. NATO reserves the right to screen applications to identify the use of such tools. All applications prepared, in whole or in part, by means of such generative or creative AI applications may be rejected without further consideration at NATO’s sole discretion, and NATO reserves the right to take further steps in such cases as appropriate.
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

NATO is committed to diversity and inclusion, and strives to provide equal access to employment, advancement and retention, independent of gender, age, nationality, ethnic origin, religion or belief, cultural background, sexual orientation, and disability. NATO welcomes applications of nationals from all member Nations, and strongly encourages women to apply. NATO is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible working environment, where all candidates living with disabilities can fully participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require reasonable accommodation, please inform us during your selection process. Candidates will be required to provide documented medical evidence to support their request for accommodation. Building Integrity is a key element of NATO’s core tasks. As an employer, NATO values commitment to the principles of integrity, transparency and accountability in accordance with international norms and practices established for the defence and related security sector. Selected candidates are expected to be role models of integrity, and to promote good governance through ongoing efforts in their work. Due to the broad interest in NATO and the large number of potential candidates, telephone or e-mail enquiries cannot be dealt with. Applicants who are not successful in this competition may be offered an appointment to another post of a similar nature, albeit at the same or a lower grade, provided they meet the necessary requirements. The nature of this position may require the staff member at times to be called upon to travel for work and/or to work outside normal office hours. The organization offers several work-life policies including Teleworking and Flexible Working arrangements (Flexitime) subject to business requirements. Please note that the International Staff at NATO Headquarters in Brussels, Belgium is a non-smoking environment. For information about the NATO Single Salary Scale (Grading, Allowances, etc.) please visit our website . Detailed data is available under the Salary and Benefits tab. NATO does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. For more info please click here .

4277210340,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-consultant-energy-department-at-capco-4277210340?position=6&pageNum=2&refId=SlS%2BsThmOw4EaKbEnH5bYA%3D%3D&trackingId=AQR2Y5F%2BRjE%2F%2BmRwBL5NIA%3D%3D,Data Analyst / Consultant (Energy Department),Capco,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Data Analyst / Data consultant
Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?
Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?
Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.
We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.
In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.
You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.
Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.
We Are Looking For Talent With The Following
Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis
Skills & Expertise
Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the energy industry (or financial / banking) or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English
What We Offer You
The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals

An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers

Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture
Show more ","<div class=""description__text description__text--rich"">
<section data-max-lines=""5"" class=""show-more-less-html"">
<div class=""show-more-less-html__markup show-more-less-html__markup--clamp-after-5
relative overflow-hidden"">

Data Analyst / Data consultant

Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?

Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?

Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.

We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.

In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.

You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.

Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.

We Are Looking For Talent With The Following

  • Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
  • Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
  • Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
  • Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
  • Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
  • Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
  • Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis

Skills &
column2:
Expertise

  • Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the energy industry (or financial / banking) or a consultancy firm
  • Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
  • Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
  • Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
  • Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
  • You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
  • Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English

What We Offer You

  • The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals
  • An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
  • Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
  • A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
  • A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
  • A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
  • A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture

4291760500,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-engineer-at-koda-staff-4291760500?position=7&pageNum=2&refId=SlS%2BsThmOw4EaKbEnH5bYA%3D%3D&trackingId=ci3aYsuqM0arEhc2vL2cug%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Engineer,Koda Staff,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Freelance BI (Business Intelligence) Developer to support our client in Brussels. The ideal candidate will bring deep experience in data modeling, dashboard/report development, and business data analysis, and will work closely with business stakeholders to deliver actionable insights.
Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and maintain BI solutions using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
Build and optimize data models and ETL pipelines using SQL, DAX, Power Query, or relevant technologies.
Collaborate with data engineers, analysts, and business teams to understand requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Develop interactive dashboards and reports to visualize KPIs and trends.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across reports.
Conduct performance tuning of BI tools and SQL queries.
Provide documentation, training, and support for BI solutions delivered.
Participate in regular meetings with stakeholders in Brussels.
Requirements:
Proven experience as a BI Developer or Data Analyst (minimum 3–5 years).
Proficiency in BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, QlikView/Qlik Sense, or similar.
Strong SQL skills
column2: experience with databases such as SQL Server, Oracle, or PostgreSQL.

column1: Knowledge of data modeling, star/snowflake schema, and DAX/MDX (if applicable).
Familiarity with ETL processes and tools (e.g., SSIS, Talend, Azure Data Factory).
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills in English.
French or Dutch speaking would be mandatory to facilitate collaboration with local stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and meet deadlines as a freelancer.
Nice to Have:
Experience with cloud data platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP).
Knowledge of Python or R for data analysis.
Background in finance, healthcare, or the public sector is a plus.
Show more ","<div class=""description__text description__text--rich"">
<section data-max-lines=""5"" class=""show-more-less-html"">
<div class=""show-more-less-html__markup show-more-less-html__markup--clamp-after-5
relative overflow-hidden"">

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Freelance BI (Business Intelligence) Developer to support our client in Brussels. The ideal candidate will bring deep experience in data modeling, dashboard/report development, and business data analysis, and will work closely with business stakeholders to deliver actionable insights.


Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and maintain BI solutions using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
  • Build and optimize data models and ETL pipelines using SQL, DAX, Power Query, or relevant technologies.
  • Collaborate with data engineers, analysts, and business teams to understand requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
  • Develop interactive dashboards and reports to visualize KPIs and trends.
  • Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across reports.
  • Conduct performance tuning of BI tools and SQL queries.
  • Provide documentation, training, and support for BI solutions delivered.
  • Participate in regular meetings with stakeholders in Brussels.


Requirements:

  • Proven experience as a BI Developer or Data Analyst (minimum 3–5 years).
  • Proficiency in BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, QlikView/Qlik Sense, or similar.
  • Strong SQL skills
column2:
experience with databases such as SQL Server, Oracle, or PostgreSQL.
  • Knowledge of data modeling, star/snowflake schema, and DAX/MDX (if applicable).
  • Familiarity with ETL processes and tools (e.g., SSIS, Talend, Azure Data Factory).
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication skills in English.
  • French or Dutch speaking would be mandatory to facilitate collaboration with local stakeholders.
  • Ability to work independently and meet deadlines as a freelancer.


    • Nice to Have:

    • Experience with cloud data platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP).
    • Knowledge of Python or R for data analysis.
    • Background in finance, healthcare, or the public sector is a plus.

4285535468,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-data-analyst-freelance-at-brainbridge-it-staffing-4285535468?position=8&pageNum=2&refId=SlS%2BsThmOw4EaKbEnH5bYA%3D%3D&trackingId=HkJseD0Jg7nNHUoiSx8Kqg%3D%3D,Data Engineer / Data Analyst (Freelance),Brainbridge IT Staffing,"Brussels Region, Belgium","Are you an experienced Data Engineer/Data Analyst who thrives in the ever-changing world of Information Technology? Then we have exciting opportunities for you!

We are looking for multiple freelance professionals for different projects. Your personal passion, interests and experience will be decisive in setting the right accents and determining your personal journey.
Your job responsibilities:
Have experience in one or more of the following: data modelling, data warehousing, databases, ETL/ELT. Experience in data warehouse automation is considered as a plus.

Knowledge of advanced data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, or Microsoft Azure services such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Databricks, and Azure Blob Storage.
You can turn the organisation's data into impactful reporting and clear insights that provide interpretation and lead to business process improvements.
Creating data mappings, implementing standards, clean up data and implementing reference datasets.

Deep experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data, as well as a deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and the ability to translate this into business implications for our clients.
Your Requirements:
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, Business engineering, business management or equivalent experience (5+ years).
Dutch or French speaking with a strong knowledge of English.
You are located in Belgium & able to work on-site/remote depending on the client’s needs.
You will work at a variety of large enterprises depending on your interest and your preferred way of working. At Brainbridge we cover the IT landscape from A to Z.

Brainbridge IT Staffing, part of Brainbridge Workforce Solutions, provides flexible IT Staffing solutions. Our goal is to be the highest rated talent sourcing partner for every client and professional. Throughout the years we built long lasting relationships where we made a difference. We thrive for the absolute match, technically and personally, for both parties.
We are specialized in freelance IT talent: from juniors with minimal work experience to senior experts with highly specific IT expertise.
Is your passion IT? Are you dynamic, result driven and have you a “can do” attitude? Join our Brainbridge success story and support our growth with your enthusiasm!
Looking forward to welcome you to the world of Brainbridge!

4281289584,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/freelance-bi-consultant-at-brainbridge-it-staffing-4281289584?position=9&pageNum=2&refId=SlS%2BsThmOw4EaKbEnH5bYA%3D%3D&trackingId=jpwb%2FiW3b1M5SGLLhclk5Q%3D%3D,Freelance BI Consultant,Brainbridge IT Staffing,"Brussels Region, Belgium","Are you an experienced Freelance BI Consultant who thrives in the ever-changing world of Information Technology? Then we have exciting opportunities for you!
For our client in Brussels we are looking for a Freelance BI Consultant for a longterm project.

Analysis & Design: Translate business needs into technical specifications and design data architectures using tools like Open API and Azure. Comfortable designing technical architectures for data projects.

Development & Integration: Build secure, high-performance ETL pipelines with Azure Data Factory, connect heterogeneous data sources, and integrate systems using Python, MySQL, and GIT. Experience with Azure DevOps and automated data pipelines.
Delivery & Documentation: Deliver ready-to-use datasets for Power BI dashboards and KPIs. Document processes clearly using tools such as Confluence, SharePoint, or Notion.

Quality & Maintenance: Ensure data quality through testing, filtering, and profiling. Maintain and evolve BI, Datalake, and Data Warehouse platforms. Familiar with data quality concepts and production pipeline maintenance.

Continuous Improvement & Languages: Continuously refine processes and expand expertise in Business Intelligence. Languages: French (native/bilingual), English (full professional fluency), Dutch (nice to have). Experience in the public sector is a plus.
You will work at a variety of large enterprises depending on your interest and your preferred way of working. At Brainbridge, we cover the IT landscape from A to Z.

4279867669,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-bi-data-analyst-at-paynovate-4279867669?position=1&pageNum=5&refId=I4xS29nquPH8z9963UB00w%3D%3D&trackingId=XOgYj%2Bw55MyCMBl1TBNNfA%3D%3D,Senior BI / Data Analyst,Paynovate,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Why Paynovate?

Paynovate is a Belgium based fintech with more than 80 talented employees. We're building a company where dreams are shaped, where bold initiatives are taken, where your leadership, ownership and ability to follow-through are valued. As a growing e-money institution, we are bringing payment solutions to the next level – and you could be a part of that.
Context

At Paynovate, data isn't just a support function—it's a driver of business clarity and innovation. We're looking for a Senior BI & Data Analyst who's ready to bring structure, simplify complexity, and connect data to business decisions that matter.
What You'll Do
Build, maintain, and scale a robust data mart that powers decision-making
Ensure our internal systems and tools like HubSpot, Jira, Zendesk... speak the same language—clear, sharing consistent data flows
Deliver trusted data to core users across finance, operations, compliance and client services
Support strategic conversations with insights that go beyond reporting
Help shape how Paynovate manages, governs, and values its data assets
What You Bring
A strong BI foundation, with experience improving or rebuilding data marts
A proactive, structured approach—and a talent for making things work efficiently
The ability to move comfortably between technical tasks and business needs
A collaborative mindset: you like building solutions with people, not just for them
Proficiency with tools like AWS Athena, Metabase, Tableau, Qlik, …
Fluency in English, any other European language is an added value
The Right Fit
This Role Is Ideal For Someone Who
Enjoys working in lean environments where frameworks are still being defined
Is motivated by impact and autonomy rather than rigid processes
Sees data not just as numbers, but as a language to drive better decisions
Is comfortable with ownership and navigating real-world business challenges
What We Offer
An amazing job in a stimulating, profitable and fast-growing sector. Payment solutions is a complex and constantly evolving field, where innovation is key.
A role where your impact will be tangible. We are a company of owners and believe in empowering people to their full potential.
A team of talented, motivated and thoughtful individuals, coming together as one to fulfil a common goal – delivering smart, simple and innovative solutions to our clients.

A dynamic environment full of growth and development opportunities, where your career could take its next major turn. People are our greatest strength, and as an employer, we choose to deliver to you as much you deliver to us.
A modern and friendly working environment, where work-life balance is enforced as a structural part of the organization (hello hybrid work!).
And of course, a comprehensive and market-competitive salary package: 32 days holiday, mobility budget, meal vouchers, health and group insurance, phone, homeworking policy and allowance.

relative overflow-hidden"">

Why Paynovate?

Paynovate is a Belgium based fintech with more than 80 talented employees. We're building a company where dreams are shaped, where bold initiatives are taken, where your leadership, ownership and ability to follow-through are valued. As a growing e-money institution, we are bringing payment solutions to the next level – and you could be a part of that.

Context

At Paynovate, data isn't just a support function—it's a driver of business clarity and innovation. We're looking for a Senior BI &
column2:
Data Analyst who's ready to bring structure, simplify complexity, and connect data to business decisions that matter.

What You'll Do

  • Build, maintain, and scale a robust data mart that powers decision-making
  • Ensure our internal systems and tools like HubSpot, Jira, Zendesk... speak the same language—clear, sharing consistent data flows
  • Deliver trusted data to core users across finance, operations, compliance and client services
  • Support strategic conversations with insights that go beyond reporting
  • Help shape how Paynovate manages, governs, and values its data assets

What You Bring

  • A strong BI foundation, with experience improving or rebuilding data marts
  • A proactive, structured approach—and a talent for making things work efficiently
  • The ability to move comfortably between technical tasks and business needs
  • A collaborative mindset: you like building solutions with people, not just for them
  • Proficiency with tools like AWS Athena, Metabase, Tableau, Qlik, …
  • Fluency in English, any other European language is an added value

The Right Fit

This Role Is Ideal For Someone Who

  • Enjoys working in lean environments where frameworks are still being defined
  • Is motivated by impact and autonomy rather than rigid processes
  • Sees data not just as numbers, but as a language to drive better decisions
  • Is comfortable with ownership and navigating real-world business challenges

What We Offer

  • An amazing job in a stimulating, profitable and fast-growing sector. Payment solutions is a complex and constantly evolving field, where innovation is key.
  • A role where your impact will be tangible. We are a company of owners and believe in empowering people to their full potential.
  • A team of talented, motivated and thoughtful individuals, coming together as one to fulfil a common goal – delivering smart, simple and innovative solutions to our clients.
  • A dynamic environment full of growth and development opportunities, where your career could take its next major turn. People are our greatest strength, and as an employer, we choose to deliver to you as much you deliver to us.
  • A modern and friendly working environment, where work-life balance is enforced as a structural part of the organization (hello hybrid work!).
  • And of course, a comprehensive and market-competitive salary package: 32 days holiday, mobility budget, meal vouchers, health and group insurance, phone, homeworking policy and allowance.

4292924512,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/functional-analyst-at-agad-technology-4292924512?position=4&pageNum=5&refId=I4xS29nquPH8z9963UB00w%3D%3D&trackingId=vaXSAPhQ32VvBtWINTLw9w%3D%3D,Functional Analyst,AGAD Technology,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About The Role

We are seeking an experienced Functional Analyst with strong expertise in passenger information systems to join our client's team in Brussels. You will act as the bridge between business stakeholders and technical teams, ensuring that functional requirements are well defined, documented, and translated into solutions that align with project objectives. The role requires fluency in Dutch and French, with solid experience working in Agile environments.
Responsibilities
Gather, analyze, and document business and functional requirements for passenger information systems.
Translate business needs into functional specifications and user stories.
Collaborate closely with product owners, developers, testers, and external vendors.
Use project tracking and documentation tools (JIRA, Confluence, SharePoint) to manage requirements and workflows.
Support Agile ceremonies (refinement, sprint planning, retrospectives, etc.).
Monitor project progress and ensure alignment with business goals.
Provide support during testing, validation, and acceptance phases.
Act as the liaison between business stakeholders and outsourced technical partners.
Prepare and maintain functional documentation and process flows.
Requirements
Requirements
Must Have:
6+ years of proven experience as a Functional Analyst.
Hands-on experience in Agile environments.
Proficiency in JIRA, Confluence, SharePoint (or equivalent project tracking/documentation tools).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Language skills: C-level in Dutch/French + B-level in Dutch/French (oral & written).
Nice to Have:
Prince2 or similar project management certification.
Experience collaborating with outsourced partners.
Knowledge of Linux and SQL.
Background in passenger information systems or transport/railway industry
Benefits
Location: 2 days on-site (Brussels South), 3 days remote

4292156898,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ict-analist-%C2%A0-developer-m-v-x-at-fedasil-4292156898?position=5&pageNum=5&refId=I4xS29nquPH8z9963UB00w%3D%3D&trackingId=3luzKJRT%2BnA4ka4HMX%2FqOA%3D%3D,ICT Analist  - Developer (m/v/x),Fedasil,"Uccle, Brussels Region, Belgium","Fedasil biedt materiële hulp aan verzoekers om internationale bescherming en andere categorieën van vreemdelingen die ook recht hebben op opvang (opvangwet van 12 januari 2007). Fedasil organiseert, rechtstreeks of samen met zijn partners, een kwaliteitsvolle opvang en begeleiding. Het Agentschap beheert ook de observatie en begeleiding van niet-begeleide minderjarige vreemdelingen (NBMV's). Fedasil coördineert programma's voor vrijwillige terugkeer uit België. Het Agentschap neemt deel aan het ontwerp, de voorbereiding en de uitvoering van het opvangbeleid. In het kader van de verschillende initiatieven zorgt Fedasil ervoor dat de opvangcentra geïntegreerd worden in de lokale gemeenschap.
FEDASIL is op zoek naar een:
ICT Analist - Developer (m/v/x)
Voor de directie Algemene diensten
Interne & externe selectie / reserve
Referentienummer: 20250808-R99999-011
Functie
Doel
Je werkt mee aan de ontwikkeling van de interne toepassingen van Fedasil om te voldoen aan de specifieke behoeften van het agentschap en zijn medewerkers.
Je werkt mee aan de technische analyses die nodig zijn om deze applicaties te bouwen, samen met de business analisten en functioneel analisten.
Je werkt mee aan de daadwerkelijke ontwikkeling van de benodigde softwarecomponenten, samen met je directe collega's in het ontwikkelteam.

Je bent ook betrokken bij de implementatie, het onderhoud en de ondersteuning van deze applicaties, waarbij je nauw samenwerkt met de systeem-, netwerk- en infrastructuuringenieurs en met de helpdesk.
Context

Je komt terecht in het ICT-ontwikkelingsteam op de hoofdzetel van Fedasil. Deze dienst maakt deel uit van de directie Algemene Diensten van Fedasil. De ICT-afdeling voert projecten uit voor alle diensten van het agentschap en voor de opvangcentra van Fedasil.
Verantwoordelijkheden
Als ICT Analist - Developer zijn je belangrijkste taken:
Je analyseert de aanvragen van de organisatie vanuit een technisch oogpunt
Je bent betrokken bij de planning van ontwikkelingsprojecten
Je ontwikkelt de nodige software
Je helpt je collega's bij hun ontwikkelingstaken
Je informeert de verantwoordelijken tijdig over eventuele obstakels die je tegenkomt
Je documenteert je werk nauwgezet
Je helpt om je werk in productie te nemen
Je werkt mee aan het langetermijnonderhoud van de applicatie, inclusief alle mogelijke preventieve onderhoudsmaatregelen
Je helpt de toepassing te ondersteunen en houdt mogelijke verbeteringen in het oog
Je neemt actief deel aan team- en projectvergaderingen.
Profiel
Je hebt initiële ervaring en/of kwalificaties in IT. Je bent geïnteresseerd in het implementeren van oplossingen die de sociale missie van FEDASIL ondersteunen.
Diploma
Optie 1: Je hebt een masterdiploma in ICT zonder ervaring
Optie 2: Je hebt een masterdiploma met minstens 1 jaar ervaring (zie onderdeel ""ervaring"")
Optie 3: Je hebt een bachelordiploma in ICT met minstens 1 jaar ervaring (zie onderdeel ""ervaring"")
Optie 4: Je hebt een bachelordiploma met minstens 2 jaar ervaring (zie onderdeel ""ervaring"").
Ervaring
Optie 1: geen ervaring
Optie 2 of 3: minstens 1 jaar ervaring
Optie 4: minimaal 2 jaar ervaring
Relevante werkervaring op IT-gebied is vereist, waarbij je ten minste de volgende taken hebt uitgevoerd :
Softwareontwikkeling
Technische analyse.
Je hebt ook deelgenomen aan de volgende taken:
Ingebruikname van software
Software op lange termijn onderhouden
Gebruikersondersteuning.
Om te kunnen bepalen of je aan de selectievoorwaarden voldoet, moet je de hierboven vereiste ervaring duidelijk in je cv beschrijven in de vorm van:
Domein: aantal jaren ervaring
Taak 1 voltooid
Taak 2 voltooid…
Zo niet, wordt uw sollicitatie niet in aanmerking genomen voor het vervolg van de selectie.
Technische vaardigheden
Vereisten:
Je bent vertrouwd met de basis IT-tools (internet, e-mail, Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Troeven:
Je hebt praktische ontwikkelervaring in een van de volgende drie talen:
JavaScript of TypeScript + React
NodeJS
Java
Je beheerst vlot Frans en/of Engels
Je hebt enige ervaring met Agile / Scrum methodologie
Eventuele technische ervaring op de volgende gebieden:
hulpmiddelen voor containerisatie (Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift)
cloudomgevingen (Azure)
besturingssysteem (Windows, Linux)
andere programmeertalen
databases (PostgreSQL)
Algemene vaardigheden
INFORMATIE INTEGREREN: Verbanden leggen tussen verschillende gegevens, alternatieven bedenken en passende conclusies trekken.
MEDEWERKERS MOTIVEREN: De kwaliteiten van werknemers erkennen, hen aanmoedigen om initiatief te nemen door hen verantwoordelijkheden te geven en hun eigen leiderschapsstijl aan te passen.
DOELSTELLINGEN BEHALEN: Betrokkenheid en ambitie tonen om resultaten te genereren en verantwoordelijkheid nemen voor de kwaliteit van de ondernomen acties.
ADVIES GEVEN: Het geven van advies aan zijn contacten en het ontwikkelen van een vertrouwensrelatie met hen op basis van zijn expertise.
Aanbod
Wij bieden je een interessante en stimulerende werkomgeving in een dienst die volop in beweging is.
Soort contract
Een voltijds contract voor onbepaalde tijd (38 uur).
Er wordt een wervingsreserve opgesteld voor alle soorten contracten voor een periode van 2 jaar.
Een administratieve dienstregeling met vaste en variabele uren en diensten van 7u36 per dag, van maandag tot vrijdag.
Plaats van het werk
Fedasil - Hoofdkantoor
Kartuizersstraat 21
1000 Brussel
Loon

Je wordt aangeworven op niveau NA11 met de salarisschaal die op jouw situatie van toepassing is. Het minimum bruto maandsalaris is 3869,66 € (startsalaris zonder anciënniteit op basis van een voltijdse arbeidsovereenkomst tegen de huidige index). Dit bedrag kan variëren afhankelijk van de relevantie van je beroepservaring. Ga voor meer informatie naar www.fedweb.be.
Voordelen
Flexibele werktijden en 26 vakantiedagen per jaar (vanaf het moment dat je begint te werken, in verhouding tot je salaris en werktijden).
Gratis openbaar vervoer voor verplaatsingen van en naar het werk.
Je kunt een fietsvergoeding krijgen voor verplaatsingen van en naar het werk.
Maaltijdcheques en speciale aanbiedingen met een federale kortingskaart.
Voordelige hospitalisatieverzekering en diverse sociale voordelen.
Mogelijkheid om je nuttige professionele ervaring te valoriseren.
Talrijke opleidingsmogelijkheden (te volgen tijdens de werkuren).
Een aanvullend pensioen in de vorm van een groepsverzekering.
Mogelijkheid tot telewerken.
Wil je solliciteren ?

Solliciteer tot uiterlijk 07/10/2025 door het sollicitatieformulier in te vullen via de link ""Solliciteren"" onderaan de vacature. Om in aanmerking te komen moet je sollicitatie de volgende documenten bevatten:
een motivatiebrief
een gedetailleerd CV (zodat we je academische eisen en ervaring kunnen beoordelen)
een kopie van het vereiste diploma.
Buitenlands diploma en/of diploma in een andere taal
Als je je diploma hebt behaald in een ander land dan België of in een andere taal dan het Nederlands, raadpleeg dan op de specifieke pagina van werkenvoor.be.

Solliciteer je voor een functie in een andere taal dan die van je diploma? Let dan op, want in sommige gevallen moet je bewijzen dat je de taal beheerst door een taaltest af te leggen! Schrijf je zo snel mogelijk in voor de vereiste test, want het behalen van een taalcertificaat is een voorwaarde voor het selectiegesprek. Controleer of dit op jou van toepassing is door de informatie te raadplegen op Buitenlands diploma of diploma in een andere taal.
Gelieve de nodige attesten toe te voegen bij jouw sollicitatie.
Juridische attesten
Als je weerhouden bent voor de functie, zullen we een bewijs van goed gedrag en zeden (uittreksel van het strafblad) algemeen model en model 2 vragen.

Je moet voldoen aan de wetgeving inzake de toegang tot het Belgische grondgebied en de arbeidsvergunningen. Indien je geen Belgisch staatsburger bent, moet je de gepaste documenten voorleggen wanneer je weerhouden bent voor de functie.
Diversiteit

Fedasil wil diversiteit bevorderen en moedigt onder andere mensen met een handicap aan om te solliciteren. Als je een handicap hebt, kun je tijdens de selectieprocedure verzoeken om redelijke aanpassingen. Maar om hier een beroep op te kunnen doen, vragen we je om de selectieverantwoordelijke te informeren.
Selectieprocedure
Preselectie

Het selectiecomité beoordeelt alle kandidaturen. De voorselectie is gebaseerd op je sollicitatiedossier (CV en motivatiebrief, diploma + gelijkstelling en attest indien nodig). Alleen kandidaten wier profiel het beste past bij de vereisten van de functie worden uitgenodigd voor het selectiegesprek.
Selectie

De selectie bestaat uit een test en een interview dat plaatsvindt in de maand oktober. De sollicitaties van geslaagde, maar niet-succesvolle kandidaten worden opgeslagen in een wervingsreserve voor alle soorten arbeidscontracten voor een periode van 2 jaar. Kandidaten die niet zijn geselecteerd, mogen gedurende 6 maanden niet deelnemen aan een nieuwe selectieprocedure voor een soortgelijke functie op hetzelfde niveau.
Voor meer informatie kunt u contact opnemen met christophe.mahaut@fedasil.be

    Algemene vaardigheden

    INFORMATIE INTEGREREN: Verbanden leggen tussen verschillende gegevens, alternatieven bedenken en passende conclusies trekken.

    MEDEWERKERS MOTIVEREN: De kwaliteiten van werknemers erkennen, hen aanmoedigen om initiatief te nemen door hen verantwoordelijkheden te geven en hun eigen leiderschapsstijl aan te passen.

    DOELSTELLINGEN BEHALEN: Betrokkenheid en ambitie tonen om resultaten te genereren en verantwoordelijkheid nemen voor de kwaliteit van de ondernomen acties.

    ADVIES GEVEN: Het geven van advies aan zijn contacten en het ontwikkelen van een vertrouwensrelatie met hen op basis van zijn expertise.

    Aanbod

    Wij bieden je een interessante en stimulerende werkomgeving in een dienst die volop in beweging is.

    Soort contract

    Een voltijds contract voor onbepaalde tijd (38 uur).

    Er wordt een wervingsreserve opgesteld voor alle soorten contracten voor een periode van 2 jaar.

    Een administratieve dienstregeling met vaste en variabele uren en diensten van 7u36 per dag, van maandag tot vrijdag.

    Plaats van het werk

    Fedasil - Hoofdkantoor

    Kartuizersstraat 21

    1000 Brussel

    Loon

    Je wordt aangeworven op niveau NA11 met de salarisschaal die op jouw situatie van toepassing is. Het minimum bruto maandsalaris is 3869,66 € (startsalaris zonder anciënniteit op basis van een voltijdse arbeidsovereenkomst tegen de huidige index). Dit bedrag kan variëren afhankelijk van de relevantie van je beroepservaring. Ga voor meer informatie naar www.fedweb.be.

    Voordelen

    Flexibele werktijden en 26 vakantiedagen per jaar (vanaf het moment dat je begint te werken, in verhouding tot je salaris en werktijden).

    Gratis openbaar vervoer voor verplaatsingen van en naar het werk.

    Je kunt een fietsvergoeding krijgen voor verplaatsingen van en naar het werk.

    Maaltijdcheques en speciale aanbiedingen met een federale kortingskaart.

    Voordelige hospitalisatieverzekering en diverse sociale voordelen.

    Mogelijkheid om je nuttige professionele ervaring te valoriseren.

    Talrijke opleidingsmogelijkheden (te volgen tijdens de werkuren).

    Een aanvullend pensioen in de vorm van een groepsverzekering.

    Mogelijkheid tot telewerken.

    Wil je solliciteren ?

    Solliciteer tot uiterlijk 07/10/2025 door het sollicitatieformulier in te vullen via de link ""Solliciteren"" onderaan de vacature. Om in aanmerking te komen moet je sollicitatie de volgende documenten bevatten:

    • een motivatiebrief
column17: • een gedetailleerd CV (zodat we je academische eisen en ervaring kunnen beoordelen)
column18:
• een kopie van het vereiste diploma.


    • Buitenlands diploma en/of diploma in een andere taal

    Als je je diploma hebt behaald in een ander land dan België of in een andere taal dan het Nederlands, raadpleeg dan op de specifieke pagina van werkenvoor.be.

    Solliciteer je voor een functie in een andere taal dan die van je diploma? Let dan op, want in sommige gevallen moet je bewijzen dat je de taal beheerst door een taaltest af te leggen! Schrijf je zo snel mogelijk in voor de vereiste test, want het behalen van een taalcertificaat is een voorwaarde voor het selectiegesprek. Controleer of dit op jou van toepassing is door de informatie te raadplegen op Buitenlands diploma of diploma in een andere taal.

    Gelieve de nodige attesten toe te voegen bij jouw sollicitatie.

    Juridische attesten

    Als je weerhouden bent voor de functie, zullen we een bewijs van goed gedrag en zeden (uittreksel van het strafblad) algemeen model en model 2 vragen.

    Je moet voldoen aan de wetgeving inzake de toegang tot het Belgische grondgebied en de arbeidsvergunningen. Indien je geen Belgisch staatsburger bent, moet je de gepaste documenten voorleggen wanneer je weerhouden bent voor de functie.

    Diversiteit

    Fedasil wil diversiteit bevorderen en moedigt onder andere mensen met een handicap aan om te solliciteren. Als je een handicap hebt, kun je tijdens de selectieprocedure verzoeken om redelijke aanpassingen. Maar om hier een beroep op te kunnen doen, vragen we je om de selectieverantwoordelijke te informeren.

    Selectieprocedure

    Preselectie

    Het selectiecomité beoordeelt alle kandidaturen. De voorselectie is gebaseerd op je sollicitatiedossier (CV en motivatiebrief, diploma + gelijkstelling en attest indien nodig). Alleen kandidaten wier profiel het beste past bij de vereisten van de functie worden uitgenodigd voor het selectiegesprek.

    Selectie

    De selectie bestaat uit een test en een interview dat plaatsvindt in de maand oktober. De sollicitaties van geslaagde, maar niet-succesvolle kandidaten worden opgeslagen in een wervingsreserve voor alle soorten arbeidscontracten voor een periode van 2 jaar. Kandidaten die niet zijn geselecteerd, mogen gedurende 6 maanden niet deelnemen aan een nieuwe selectieprocedure voor een soortgelijke functie op hetzelfde niveau.

    Voor meer informatie kunt u contact opnemen met christophe.mahaut@fedasil.be

4283512778,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-consultant-analyst-project-manager-financial-services-at-square-management-belgium-4283512778?position=6&pageNum=5&refId=I4xS29nquPH8z9963UB00w%3D%3D&trackingId=i0dAxNrwc9CI11vE9Uf2aw%3D%3D,Data Consultant (Analyst & Project Manager) - Financial Services,Square Management Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Data Consultant (Analyst & Project Manager) - Financial Services (min 1 year of experience)

Square Management Belgium est à la recherche de consultants expérimentés (minimum 1 an) possédant une expérience significative et un intérêt dans le domaine de la data dans le secteur financier (banque et assurance).
🏢 Qui est Square Management Belgium ?
Cabinet de référence dans le secteur financier, nous accompagnons nos clients dans leurs projets de transformation grâce à l’expertise de nos 100 consultants.
Square Management Belgium fait partie du groupe Square Management, un cabinet de conseil européen en stratégie et organisation fondé en 2008, présent en France, en Belgique et au Luxembourg.
💡 Qu’attendons-nous de vous dans notre domaine d’expertise Data ?
Identifier et hiérarchiser les actifs de données critiques
Élaborer et maintenir des procédures et des politiques de planification, de surveillance et de contrôle des données
Prendre des décisions basées sur les données grâce à des analyses, des visualisations, des quality checks et des data sets
Structurer et exploiter les données de nos clients pour améliorer et renforcer leur activité
Formuler des recommandations et des conclusions

En interne, vous serez impliqué dans la production de contenus d’expertise (articles, publications, podcasts, …), ainsi que dans la participation aux réponses aux appels d’offres et aux initiatives autour de votre communauté.
🔝 Êtes-vous la personne idéale pour ce poste ?
Vous êtes titulaire d'un Master d'une école de commerce, d'une école d'ingénieur ou d'une université
Vous disposez d'au minimum 1 an d'expérience dans un cabinet de conseil, un environnement projet ou dans les services financiers (banque/assurance)
Vous parlez français ou néerlandais (langue maternelle) et parlez couramment l'anglais
Vous possédez des connaissances et des compétences en data analyse et data management
Des expériences en tant que chef de projet, Business/ Functional Analyst et Process Analyst sont un atout majeur.
Vous êtes orientés client, vous comprenez les besoins et les attentes des parties prenantes
Rigoureux dans l'atteinte de vos objectifs, vous possédez de bonnes capacités d'analyse et de communication orale et écrite
Vous êtes proactif, impliqué et vous adaptez rapidement aux nouvelles situations
🎁 Qu’est-ce que Square Management Belgium peut vous offrir ?
Un parcours professionnel en adéquation avec vos ambitions et votre expérience. Vos responsabilités varient selon votre grade (de consultant confirmé à Principal)
Un parcours de formations articulé autour de nos domaines d'excellence : plus de 150 formations certifiantes (méthodologie, métier, langues, développement personnel)

Une excellente opportunité d’évolution personnelle et professionnelle : des missions enrichissantes pour des clients majeurs dans de multiples secteurs (finance, assurance, banque, secteur public, énergie, etc.)
column2: partager vos connaissances avec vos collègues et impliquez-vous dans un rôle interne qui encourage l'intrapreneuriat et l'intelligence collective autour de la production de contenus (articles, publications, podcast)

column1: Un environnement de travail où l'équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée, l'ambiance bienveillante et la communication ouverte sont essentiels
Une offre attractive et compétitive : voiture et carte essence, ordinateur, téléphone portable, chèques repas, 13ème mois, programmes de formations, éco-chèques...

4280904762,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/consultant-data-engineer-at-sia-4280904762?position=7&pageNum=5&refId=I4xS29nquPH8z9963UB00w%3D%3D&trackingId=E8lrIwez1L1NbY%2FhFedaNA%3D%3D,Consultant Data Engineer,Sia,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.
Job Description

The Data Science team is young, diverse and growing. As we are still relatively small you will be in the driver seat to shape its future. We have a flat structure and value the entrepreneurial spirit of our members: initiative is highly encouraged. We are also striving for well-being, diversity and knowledge-sharing inside the team, so that we all grow.
As a Data engineer consultant you will be working on various client projects as well as on building our own Sia AI solutions, together with our French Data Engineering team:
Cloud Services at GCP, AWS and Azure: architecture choices, use of storage & compute services, cost monitoring and optimization, role management, Infrastructure as Code
Docker and Kubernetes: containerization & orchestration of applications, management of K8s clusters adapted to Data Science workloads
Python programming: development of server-side tools (bulk data processing, REST API server, authentication, ...)
CI/CD: managing the integration and ongoing deployment of our applications and internal platforms, supporting the deployment of Data Science projects at our clients' sites
Data pipelines: development of ETL scripts in Big Data environments
Infrastructures & Services adapted to Machine Learning: technology watch and implementation of solutions useful to Data Scientists in the learning and provision of their ML models.
Qualifications
You hold a Master’s Degree with a strong quantitative component (e.g. Econometrics, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, Quantitative Finance)
You have 1-3 years of relevant experience in Data, DevOps, Cloud or Software Engineering.
You have a good level in Python and have a solid foundation in other languages. You are familiar with at least one SQL DBMS (ideally PostgreSQL) and ideally noSQL (ideally MongoDB).

Ideally, you are already familiar with at least one cloud services platform (GCP, AWS, Azure) with experience mixing different services within the same project. If not, you have a strong appetite to learn more about these topics.
You are comfortable using Docker, automating CI/CD pipelines and have a strong appetite for gaining competence in Kubernetes if you do not yet have experience with this solution.

You will be able to work in a DevOps culture, taking responsibility for the code lifecycle, from development to deployment and maintenance of applications (mastery of the Gitlab-CE ecosystem is a plus). You are also familiar with Infrastructure as Code concepts and tools (ideally Terraform).
You are sensitive to security issues and have experience in implementing application protection solutions (certificate management, HTTPS security, OAuth2 authentication, credential management)
You have excellent interpersonal and team working skills
Excellent English, Dutch & French verbal and written skills are required.
Additional Information
Sia is certified ""Great Place to Work"". Come and join us to take part in this great company.
Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

4264766321,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-specialist-statistician-%E2%80%93-based-in-luxembourg-at-european-investment-bank-eib-4264766321?position=9&pageNum=5&refId=I4xS29nquPH8z9963UB00w%3D%3D&trackingId=cFSu0WGwkb0zCw%2BJHeKu4Q%3D%3D,Data specialist/Statistician – based in Luxembourg,European Investment Bank (EIB),"Brussels Region, Belgium","This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Secretariat General (SG) – Economic Department (ECON) – Economic Studies Division (ES) – Statistical Unit (SU) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a Data specialist/Statistician*.
This is a full-time position at grade 4 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.
Internal benchmark Associate Economist
Panel interviews are foreseen as from the end of August 2025 .
Purpose

You will maintain economic databases, statistics, as well as contribute to economic and econometric analysis to derive recommendations that help shape strategic decision-making of the EIB in order to contribute to policy formulation and dialogue.
Operating Network

The unit is positioned in SG/ECON/ES but serves the needs of the whole department. The unit designs, develops and maintains all databases, manages the contractual agreements with private database providers, offers statistical and econometric support to ECON staff, maintains the ECON server and various data toolkits posted on the EIB website and organises the sharing of data through secured and restricted web access with external collaborators.

In addition, the unit contributes to automatize processes related to country, policy and research work, provides technical support related to the ratings of sovereigns and banks as well as to local currency pricing. Relatedly, it manages control functions and critical report declarations such as EUC and ICF. You will report to the Head of the Statistical Unit, under the overall supervision of the Head of the Economic Studies Division and the Director of the Department.
Accountabilities
Maintain the Department’s data-architecture, including databases, tools and interfaces.
Support and contribute to statistical, econometric and economic analyses.
Support the technical implementation of tools for surveys and data analytics based on surveys.
Communicate analytical results visually and contribute to standardizing reporting and presentation outputs in a way that can be understood by non-experts.
Contribute to the development of tools to standardize the presentation of economic output of the department.
Collaborate with the assigned IT team on the solutions of the process simplification and automation.
Liaise with relevant counterparts within the Department, the Bank as well as in other national, EU, and international institutions and think tanks.

Contribute through database development and relevant analysis to the policy dialogue and the analysis of key models and policy papers and presentations as well as for other internal and external stakeholders.
Propose improvements of processes, procedures, methodologies and working methods.
Qualifications
University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in econometrics, quantitative economics, mathematics, statistics, information technology

At least 3 years of experience in statistical analyses, database management and econometrics, for example acquired working in the relevant units of an international or EU institution, statistical office, consulting, government, banking, academia
Programming skills (Python, R, SQL, VBA, MiKTeX, JavaScript) and knowledge of relevant software for data management and analysis (Stata, RStudio, SAS)
Knowledge of applied quantitative methods
Knowledge of economic concepts and standard relevant macroeconomic and microeconomic data series and sources
Previous experience in integrating big data in economic analysis and/or knowledge of survey statistical methods would be an advantage
Experience in written, visual and oral communication of complex quantitative analyses
Ability to deliver under time pressure when needed
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French and a good knowledge of the other (**). Working knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.
Competencies
Find out more about EIB core competencies here
To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here

(**) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
This is an open campaign to consecutively fill an open position. The campaign will remain open until the 8th of September 2025. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

relative overflow-hidden"">

This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Secretariat General (SG) – Economic Department (ECON) – Economic Studies Division (ES) – Statistical Unit (SU) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a Data specialist/Statistician*.

This is a full-time position at grade 4 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.

  • Internal benchmark Associate Economist

Panel interviews are foreseen as from the end of August 2025 .

Purpose

You will maintain economic databases, statistics, as well as contribute to economic and econometric analysis to derive recommendations that help shape strategic decision-making of the EIB in order to contribute to policy formulation and dialogue.

Operating Network

The unit is positioned in SG/ECON/ES but serves the needs of the whole department. The unit designs, develops and maintains all databases, manages the contractual agreements with private database providers, offers statistical and econometric support to ECON staff, maintains the ECON server and various data toolkits posted on the EIB website and organises the sharing of data through secured and restricted web access with external collaborators.

In addition, the unit contributes to automatize processes related to country, policy and research work, provides technical support related to the ratings of sovereigns and banks as well as to local currency pricing. Relatedly, it manages control functions and critical report declarations such as EUC and ICF. You will report to the Head of the Statistical Unit, under the overall supervision of the Head of the Economic Studies Division and the Director of the Department.

Accountabilities

  • Maintain the Department’s data-architecture, including databases, tools and interfaces.
  • Support and contribute to statistical, econometric and economic analyses.
  • Support the technical implementation of tools for surveys and data analytics based on surveys.
  • Communicate analytical results visually and contribute to standardizing reporting and presentation outputs in a way that can be understood by non-experts.
  • Contribute to the development of tools to standardize the presentation of economic output of the department.
  • Collaborate with the assigned IT team on the solutions of the process simplification and automation.
  • Liaise with relevant counterparts within the Department, the Bank as well as in other national, EU, and international institutions and think tanks.
  • Contribute through database development and relevant analysis to the policy dialogue and the analysis of key models and policy papers and presentations as well as for other internal and external stakeholders.
  • Propose improvements of processes, procedures, methodologies and working methods.

Qualifications

  • University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in econometrics, quantitative economics, mathematics, statistics, information technology
column2: • At least 3 years of experience in statistical analyses, database management and econometrics, for example acquired working in the relevant units of an international or EU institution, statistical office, consulting, government, banking, academia
column3: • Programming skills (Python, R, SQL, VBA, MiKTeX, JavaScript) and knowledge of relevant software for data management and analysis (Stata, RStudio, SAS)
column4: • Knowledge of applied quantitative methods
column5:
• Knowledge of economic concepts and standard relevant macroeconomic and microeconomic data series and sources
  • Previous experience in integrating big data in economic analysis and/or knowledge of survey statistical methods would be an advantage
column6: • Experience in written, visual and oral communication of complex quantitative analyses
column7: • Ability to deliver under time pressure when needed
column8:
• Excellent knowledge of English and/or French and a good knowledge of the other (**). Working knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.

    • Competencies

    Find out more about EIB core competencies here

    To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here

    (**) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

    We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

    We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

    By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.

    This is an open campaign to consecutively fill an open position. The campaign will remain open until the 8th of September 2025. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

4291777144,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/it-support-specialist-at-netcompany-4291777144?position=1&pageNum=7&refId=HbWoSYjgP1EQOf%2BUG0hsYw%3D%3D&trackingId=HsnCAYCdc%2FY80M%2F2%2Be8D3A%3D%3D,IT Support Specialist,Netcompany,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Company Description
Are you ready to shape the future technological landscape in Europe?

We are dedicated to responsible digitalisation, building innovative, inclusive solutions that drive meaningful impact. With over 8,900 professionals across Europe, we help EU institutions, public and private organisations thrive in a rapidly evolving digital world. Are you ready to shape the future through technology? Your journey starts here. Take a look at some of our impactful projects here: https://netcompany.com/cases/
Job Description
Are you ready to discover the role of a IT Support Specialist in Netcompany?
As An IT Support Specialist You Will Do
Analyze incidents, first and second-line customer liaison with the purpose of maximising the first call resolution rate
Act as a service desk agent, incident agent and analyst, problem agent and analyst
Provide first and second-line support: remote and on-site support
Record & track incident and request information
Record & track Problem information
Participate in reconfiguration/installation of PC environment
Document operational support procedures
Draft technical content for knowledge database
Perform testing and administration of applications
Qualifications
What would make you a fit for the role:
Minimum 3+ years of professional experience, including IT support in person (direct proximity to users), support for desktops, laptops, smartphones, tablets, and video conferencing
Fluency in both English/French both written and oral
Being highly autonomous and broadly IT skilled
Strong knowledge in all of the MS office applications
Knowledge of end user computers and, more specifically, Windows computers
Good understanding of the main mobile devices platforms and core mobile applications
ITIL V4 Foundation Certification
Experience in liaising with system and database administration for execution of administration tasks
Good communication skills and being empathetic and user oriented
Knowledge of additional official EU languages, specifically German would be considered as an advantage
Additional Information
Being a part of the Netcompany team, you will be provided with:
The opportunity to work in a modern environment.
A competitive compensation & benefits package
Hospitalization plan
Meal and commuting allowance
Well-being activities (on premises)
Continuous learning opportunities using the most modern methods (unlimited access to Udemy for Business, ad-hoc trainings)
A personalized development plan for targeted career growth

If you are looking forward to be part of a diverse environment, and have the opportunity to work alongside well-experienced professionals, on challenging, large-scale projects that directly impact millions of citizens around the globe, then this is the place to be!

By joining Netcompany Belgium, you will be an integral part of a distinguished team of 600+ tech enthusiasts working for international projects, primarily within the European Institutions market, with a unique opportunity to shape the future of digital services in an environment that values ideas and fosters growth.
Please upload your CV in English via the Apply button. All applications will be treated as strictly confidential.

We ensure equal opportunities, treatment, and consideration to all candidates. Discrimination based on sex, racial or ethnic origin, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other factor protected by applicable laws and regulations is prohibited. As part of the Netcompany culture, we respect human rights and focus on creating a positive workplace, where all employees are valued, and where diversity and inclusion are a vital part of our everyday working experience.
In the following link you may find our CV Submission privacy notice: https://netcompany.com/cv-submission-privacy-notice/
