4283142720,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-cream-consulting-4283142720?position=2&pageNum=7&refId=HbWoSYjgP1EQOf%2BUG0hsYw%3D%3D&trackingId=ZrnWtEOf1w6JtcBvMFRsMQ%3D%3D,Data Engineer,Cream Consulting,"Brussels Region, Belgium","Permanent position only
What is Cream all about?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company specialized in IT development and Business improvement. We are active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.
Cream’s special recipe:
- 1/3 of Personal development
- 1/3 of Collective Intelligence
- 1/3 of Intrapreneurship
And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀
What is a Data Engineer at Cream?

As a Data Engineer at Cream, you can be in charge of the implementation of BI Business Projects or potentially coaching junior data engineers. As well, be responsible for the development of data ingestion and analytics solutions (data warehouses, data marts, etc.)
Your tasks :
Architecting Data Systems: Designing robust and scalable data models to meet business needs.
ETL Development: Creating or improving efficient Extract, Transform, Load processes to integrate and process data.
Performance Optimization: Monitoring and fine-tuning data pipelines and databases foR optimal speed and efficiency.
Data Security Implementation: Establishing data security measures to protect sensitive information and ensure compliance.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Working closely with data scientists, analysts, and other teams to understand data requirements and provide technical solutions.
How do we imagine our future consultant?
You have at least 2 years experience in data engineering
You have a Master’s degree, preferably in IT (Computer or industrial engineering) or in Business Administration or equivalent by experience (more than 5 years).
You are used to working with different data tools such as SSAS, SSIS, SSRS, AWS, Azure data factory, Apache Spark, SQL, Python, Tableau
You have a good database knowledge (SQL and NoSQL)
You are fluent in French or Dutch and have full professional capacity in English
You know what it means to work in an Agile mode
You are passionate about data, pay attention to details and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
Why should you taste the lime flavor?
· A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
· You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
· You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
· You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
· We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!
THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE, CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY""

What is Cream all about?

column2:

What is a Data Engineer at Cream?

As a Data Engineer at Cream, you can be in charge of the implementation of BI Business Projects or potentially coaching junior data engineers. As well, be responsible for the development of data ingestion and analytics solutions (data warehouses, data marts, etc.)


Your tasks :

  • Architecting Data Systems: Designing robust and scalable data models to meet business needs.
  • ETL Development: Creating or improving efficient Extract, Transform, Load processes to integrate and process data.
  • Performance Optimization: Monitoring and fine-tuning data pipelines and databases foR optimal speed and efficiency.
  • Data Security Implementation: Establishing data security measures to protect sensitive information and ensure compliance.
  • Cross-functional Collaboration: Working closely with data scientists, analysts, and other teams to understand data requirements and provide technical solutions.


How do we imagine our future consultant?

  • You have at least 2 years experience in data engineering
  • You have a Master’s degree, preferably in IT (Computer or industrial engineering) or in Business Administration or equivalent by experience (more than 5 years).
  • You are used to working with different data tools such as SSAS, SSIS, SSRS, AWS, Azure data factory, Apache Spark, SQL, Python, Tableau
  • You have a good database knowledge (SQL and NoSQL)
  • You are fluent in French or Dutch and have full professional capacity in English
  • You know what it means to work in an Agile mode
  • You are passionate about data, pay attention to details and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business


Why should you taste the lime flavor?

· A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box

· You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues

· You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology

· You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company

We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!

4291257479,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/credit-risk-data-analyst-at-luminus-4291257479?position=3&pageNum=7&refId=HbWoSYjgP1EQOf%2BUG0hsYw%3D%3D&trackingId=dvaHabTnycac%2BEKnAkR2JQ%3D%3D,Credit Risk Data Analyst,Luminus,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Publication date: August 25, 2025
Brussels
Contract open-end
Turn data into powerful decisions – become our next Credit Risk Data Analyst!

As a Credit Risk Data Analyst, you play a vital role in safeguarding Luminus from financial exposure. You take ownership of the full credit risk process – from extracting and analyzing data to translating insights into action. Your expertise will sharpen credit decisions, improve portfolio steering, and keep bad debt under control, ensuring our Retail, B2B, and Affiliate units stay on track for success.
What you’ll do
From start to finish, you take charge of the credit risk process, transforming raw data into strategies that drive impact.
While monitoring performance, you maintain and enhance credit risk models, dashboards, and reports to ensure accuracy and relevance.
You deliver precise credit risk figures to business systems like Salesforce, SAP, SAS, and eRAM, making sure processes run efficiently.
Using predictive models, you improve credit scoring and default detection across multiple portfolios.
You optimize and automate workflows, replacing manual tasks with scalable, data-driven solutions.
In collaboration with IT, you configure, test, and validate credit system features, guaranteeing they meet operational and risk requirements.
What you bring
You have a Master’s degree in economics, finance, or commercial engineering, plus at least 4 years of experience in financial risk analysis or modelling.
You combine a sharp analytical mind with strong skills in tools like Power BI, SAS, Python, or SQL.
You thrive on turning complex technical concepts into clear, actionable ideas.
You bring a proactive mindset, challenging the status quo to improve processes.
You are resilient under pressure and comfortable navigating large amounts of data.
You speak fluent Dutch and English or French.
Why join us
You are part of a team that directly shapes Luminus’ financial resilience and success.
You work in a data-driven environment where your insights directly influence strategic decisions.
You grow your skills while working with cutting-edge tools and talented colleagues.
What you’ll get in return?
The energy sector is one of the most rewarding industries in Belgium with a highly rewarding compensation and benefits package:
Competitive compensation: Attractive salary with a performance-based bonus that can be optimized to your personal preferences, plus meal vouchers.
Insurance & social benefits: Group insurance and hospitalization coverage for the entire family. Additional reimbursement for healthcare and pharmaceutical costs.
Mobility: Full reimbursement for public transport, kilometer-based cycling reimbursement and flexible mobility choices: you can choose between a company car or mobility budget.
Internet & communication: Home internet covered, reimbursement for a personal mobile device with a phone subscription.
Home Office: A fully-equipped home office, including an ergonomical ICT set-up.

Exclusive discounts: 30% off gas and electricity after six months, discounts on energy-saving services (e.g., solar panels, heat pumps) and reduced prices on top brands, amusement parks, festivals and more.
Curious about your benefits and more? Visit our jobsite.
Luminus values e.v.e.r.y individual.

Are you looking for a workplace where you can truly be yourself, where you feel respected, supported regardless of your background, identity and unique story? Then you’ve come to the right place. Diversity equity and inclusion are not empty words for us — we grant that everyone can flourish and feel valued, so let’s build it together!
What does that mean in practice?
Do you have specific needs or require adjustments during the recruitment process or once you are hired? Let’s discuss about it and we’ll do our best to find a solution.
Together we make the difference

What you’ll get in return?

The energy sector is one of the most rewarding industries in Belgium with a highly rewarding compensation and benefits package:

  • Competitive compensation: Attractive salary with a performance-based bonus that can be optimized to your personal preferences, plus meal vouchers.
  • Insurance &
column2:
social benefits: Group insurance and hospitalization coverage for the entire family. Additional reimbursement for healthcare and pharmaceutical costs.
  • Mobility: Full reimbursement for public transport, kilometer-based cycling reimbursement and flexible mobility choices: you can choose between a company car or mobility budget.
  • Internet &
column3:
communication: Home internet covered, reimbursement for a personal mobile device with a phone subscription.
  • Home Office: A fully-equipped home office, including an ergonomical ICT set-up.
  • Exclusive discounts: 30% off gas and electricity after six months, discounts on energy-saving services (e.g., solar panels, heat pumps) and reduced prices on top brands, amusement parks, festivals and more.

    • Curious about your benefits and more? Visit our jobsite.

    Luminus values e.v.e.r.y individual.

    Are you looking for a workplace where you can truly be yourself, where you feel respected, supported regardless of your background, identity and unique story? Then you’ve come to the right place. Diversity equity and inclusion are not empty words for us — we grant that everyone can flourish and feel valued, so let’s build it together!

    What does that mean in practice?

    Do you have specific needs or require adjustments during the recruitment process or once you are hired? Let’s discuss about it and we’ll do our best to find a solution.

    Together we make the difference

4288493059,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-expert-at-thaleria-4288493059?position=8&pageNum=7&refId=HbWoSYjgP1EQOf%2BUG0hsYw%3D%3D&trackingId=BukY%2BMIwyp0o6ece%2B5Th%2Bg%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Expert,Thaleria,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Tasks
Develop, deploy, and maintain scalable data pipelines from REST APIs using Python, SQL, and ETL tools (Azure Synapse) to ingest, transform, and prepare data.

Process and transform complex JSON and GIS data into structured datasets optimized for analysis and reporting. This includes parsing, transforming, and validating JSON data to ensure data quality and consistency.
Load and organize processed data into cloud-based Azure Data Lake storage ensuring accessibility and performance.
Document ETL processes, metadata definitions, data lineage, and technical specifications to ensure transparency and reusability.
Collaborate with data analysts, BI developers, and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver reliable, well-documented datasets aligned with organizational needs.
Implement data quality checks, logging, and monitoring within data pipelines to support maintainability and troubleshooting.
Requirements
B2 level of English minimum. Any knowledge of French is an asset.
Educational Background in Computer Science and/or Software Engineering.
At least 5 years of excellent knowledge in Azure data lake storage and Oracle databases
At least 5 years of excellent expertise in developing data pipelines from REST APIs and on integration (such as Python, Azure Synapse, SQL)
At least 5 years of excellent expertise in processing JSON and GIS data
Excellent knowledge of data engineering tools such as Python and Azure Synapse Analytics
Excellent knowledge of working with REST APIs, including ingestion and parsing of JSON and GIS data
Excellent knowledge of Azure data lake storage and Oracle database
Ability to implement robust data quality checks, logging, and monitoring in ETL processes
Ability to document ETL workflows, metadata, and technical specifications clearly and consistently
Familiarity with DevOps and version control best practices. Experience with CI/CD pipelines
Analysis and problem solving skills
Ability to participate in technical meetings and good communication skills
Certificates
Following certificates & standards are mandatory for the performance of tasks:
Microsoft Azure Data Engineer Associate
Following certifications are a plus:
Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert
Microsoft Certified: Azure Developer Associate
Microsoft Certified: Azure Database Administrator Associate
Show more ","<div class=""description__text description__text--rich"">

<div class=""show-more-less-html__markup show-more-less-html__markup--clamp-after-5
relative overflow-hidden"">

Tasks

  • Develop, deploy, and maintain scalable data pipelines from REST APIs using Python, SQL, and ETL tools (Azure Synapse) to ingest, transform, and prepare data.
  • Process and transform complex JSON and GIS data into structured datasets optimized for analysis and reporting. This includes parsing, transforming, and validating JSON data to ensure data quality and consistency.
  • Load and organize processed data into cloud-based Azure Data Lake storage ensuring accessibility and performance.
  • Document ETL processes, metadata definitions, data lineage, and technical specifications to ensure transparency and reusability.
  • Collaborate with data analysts, BI developers, and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver reliable, well-documented datasets aligned with organizational needs.
  • Implement data quality checks, logging, and monitoring within data pipelines to support maintainability and troubleshooting.

Requirements

  • B2 level of English minimum. Any knowledge of French is an asset.
  • Educational Background in Computer Science and/or Software Engineering.
  • At least 5 years of excellent knowledge in Azure data lake storage and Oracle databases
  • At least 5 years of excellent expertise in developing data pipelines from REST APIs and on integration (such as Python, Azure Synapse, SQL)
  • At least 5 years of excellent expertise in processing JSON and GIS data
  • Excellent knowledge of data engineering tools such as Python and Azure Synapse Analytics
  • Excellent knowledge of working with REST APIs, including ingestion and parsing of JSON and GIS data
  • Excellent knowledge of Azure data lake storage and Oracle database
  • Ability to implement robust data quality checks, logging, and monitoring in ETL processes
  • Ability to document ETL workflows, metadata, and technical specifications clearly and consistently
  • Familiarity with DevOps and version control best practices. Experience with CI/CD pipelines
  • Analysis and problem solving skills
  • Ability to participate in technical meetings and good communication skills

Certificates

  • Following certificates &
column2:
standards are mandatory for the performance of tasks:
  • Microsoft Azure Data Engineer Associate
  • Following certifications are a plus:
  • Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert
  • Microsoft Certified: Azure Developer Associate
  • Microsoft Certified: Azure Database Administrator Associate

4253766929,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-junior-tempo-determinato-at-bnl-bnp-paribas-4253766929?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=0jm9BmKHmRcs6Ze49Q1StA%3D%3D,Data Analyst Junior - Tempo Determinato,BNL BNP Paribas,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Ti piacerebbe lavorare come Data Analyst Junior nella Direzione IT di BNL?

Entrare a far parte di BNL Gruppo BNP Paribas significa lavorare in una delle principali banche italiane, parte di un Gruppo internazionale leader europeo nei servizi bancari e finanziari, presente in più di 70 paesi con circa 199 mila collaboratori. Significa quindi lavorare in un ambiente sfidante, con una cultura internazionale e fortemente orientato all’innovazione.

Siamo alla ricerca di un* giovane talent* da inserire nel nostro team IT dedicato alle attività di Data Platform. Se sei appassionat* di tecnologia, ami risolvere problemi e vuoi crescere in un contesto dinamico e innovativo, questa è l’opportunità giusta per te!
Cosa farai concretamente?
Sarai parte attiva di un progetto innovativo in ambito Data Platform che punta alla realizzazione di una nuova piattaforma dati centralizzata denominata “Data Hub”
Avrai la possibilità di lavorare con tecnologie cloud native attraverso un ecosistema di strumenti eterogeni che consentono la trasmissione e la manipolazione del dato
Ti confronterai su tematiche funzionali afferenti all’ambito dei servizi di investimento attraverso attività di analisi, sviluppo ed elaborazione del dato
Potrai collaborare con team di sviluppo, operation e business per garantire la continuità dei servizi
Documentazione delle attività e aggiornamento della knowledge base
Il/la candidato/a ideale:
Ha una laurea in discipline STEM (preferibilmente Informatica o Ingegneria)
Ha una conoscenza di base sulle tematiche: architetture dati, data engineering, data management, sviluppo software ETL
È orientat* al problem solving e al lavoro in team
Ha buone capacità comunicative e voglia di imparare
Cosa offriamo:
Formazione continua e affiancamento
Ambiente giovane e collaborativo
Possibilità di crescita professionale in ambito IT e Digital
La nostra offerta:
Il contratto previsto è a tempo determinato di 6 mesi (CCNL del credito)
Sede di lavoro
Roma

In un mondo che cambia, la diversità e l'inclusione sono valori fondamentali. BNP Paribas offre pari opportunità di lavoro a tutti i candidati idonei e si impegna attivamente a garantire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo in cui tutte le diversità siano valorizzate. Insieme, costruiamo la banca del domani: innovativa, responsabile e sostenibile.
Il presente annuncio si rivolge a candidati di ambo i sessi (D.Lgs. 198/2006, Codice Pari Opportunità)

In un mondo che cambia, la diversità e l'inclusione sono valori fondamentali. BNP Paribas offre pari opportunità di lavoro a tutti i candidati idonei e si impegna attivamente a garantire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo in cui tutte le diversità siano valorizzate. Insieme, costruiamo la banca del domani: innovativa, responsabile e sostenibile.


Il presente annuncio si rivolge a candidati di ambo i sessi (D.Lgs. 198/2006, Codice Pari Opportunità)

4274313414,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analyst-planning-and-control-at-siae-4274313414?position=2&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=gBmu4Ar%2FKUhfqCJBQoCL7g%3D%3D,Junior Data Analyst - Planning and Control,SIAE,"Rome, Latium, Italy","🚀 Ruolo: Junior Data Analyst - Planning and Control
📍 Località: Roma
🕒 Tipo di Contratto: Tempo Indeterminato

✨ Su di noi: Benvenuto/a in SIAE, la Società Italiana degli Autori ed Editori! Siamo il faro per chi opera nel mondo della cultura e dello spettacolo e proteggiamo i diritti d’autore delle opere dei nostri associati e delle nostre associate, garantendo il giusto compenso per il loro talento. Unirsi a noi è una scelta volontaria che offre una tutela economica indispensabile per chi crea.
🎯 La tua sfida: sei curioso/a di partecipare con noi e contribuire al cambiamento digitale di SIAE? Hai la passione per i progetti tecnologici e per la semplificazione dei processi?
Il candidato che stiamo cercando ha maturato almeno 2 anni di esperienza come Data Analyst in organizzazioni strutturate
column2: avrà una solida mentalità analitica, una profonda comprensione dei dati e la capacità di tradurre informazioni complesse e dati grezzi in insights utili per guidare le decisioni strategiche dell’azienda.

column1: La risorsa verrà inserita nell’U.O. Management Accounting & Segment Reporting, all’interno della Direzione Planning and Control e sarà chiamato a supportare il raggiungimento degli obiettivi aziendali attraverso lo svolgimento delle seguenti attività:
💼 Le Tue Responsabilità:

Analisi dati: raccogliere, elaborare e analizzare dati aziendali e da fonti esterne, sviluppare e implementare database per consentire l’analisi delle performance aziendali e la definizione di obiettivi.
Pianificazione: collaborare con il team per sviluppare piani strategici e operativi basati sull'analisi dei dati, supportando le attività di budgeting, forecasting e simulazioni.

Controllo di gestione: supportare il monitoraggio e la valutazione delle performance aziendali rispetto ai budget e ai forecast e la conseguente analisi degli scostamenti rispetto ai risultati attesi. Supportare il team nello sviluppo di query e nella definizione di procedure operative, nonché nella gestione e ottimizzazione della procedura di cost allocation.
Reportistica: supportare lo sviluppo e l’implementazione di report e dashboard per comunicare i risultati delle analisi e facilitare la presa di decisioni da parte dei responsabili.
Data Modeling: creare modelli e strumenti di analisi predittiva per supportare la previsione delle tendenze e la valutazione degli impatti delle decisioni aziendali.
Collaborazione interfunzionale: essere in grado di interfacciarsi con le diverse strutture aziendali per comprenderne di supporto analitico e le esigenze informative del management.
Ottimizzazione dei processi: identificare opportunità per ottimizzare i processi aziendali attraverso l'analisi dei dati e la proposta di soluzioni migliorative.
🎓 Requisiti:
Laurea in Statistica, Matematica, Data Science, Economia/Finanza o campo correlato
Esperienza nell’analisi ed interpretazione dei dati
Interesse e predisposizione all’approfondimento di tematiche contabili e finanziarie
Buona conoscenza di Excel
Conoscenza avanzata di SQL. Nice to have conoscenza di altri linguaggi di programmazione (e.g. Python)
Esperienza nell'utilizzo di software di business intelligence e data analytics (Qlik Sense, Power BI, Tableau)
Capacità di comunicare in modo efficace e presentare i risultati in modo chiaro
Passione per l’analisi e la visualizzazione dei dati. Attenzione al dettaglio e capacità di problem-solving
Attitudine e coerenza con la cultura dell’apprendimento continuo e dell’innovazione
🌈 Nice to have:
Forte engagement con il Purpose SIAE “dalla parte di chi crea”
💰 Cosa Offriamo:
Contributo Welfare Aziendale
Buoni Pasto da €6,5 al giorno
Smart Working per 10 giorni al mese
Premio di Risultato
Assistenza Sanitaria UniSalute
Contributo Previdenza Complementare
Borse di Studio per i figli
Convenzioni aziendali (Corporate benefits
column2: Vickey)

column1: Piattaforma di e-learning Edflex
Piattaforma Bonoos per agevolazioni, sconti e altre forme di sostegno ai cittadini
🌟 I nostri valori
Trust: conquistiamo la fiducia con sincerità e rispetto
Innovation: guardiamo al futuro proteggendo la nostra identità
Execution: crediamo in ciò che facciamo con responsabilità e passione

🚀 Unisciti a Noi: valutiamo tutte le candidature ricevute coerentemente con la cultura inclusiva e i valori che ci contraddistinguono ogni giorno, volti a valorizzare la diversità nelle sue molteplici forme come fondamentale contributo per la crescita aziendale e collettiva.

4278347012,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analyst-data-analysis-at-ice-4278347012?position=3&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=0%2BVgTryam6hQJN8OAhf27Q%3D%3D,"Analyst, Data Analysis",ICE,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Job Description
Job Purpose

The role of the Data Analyst requires the maintenance and integration of both static and dynamic data related to equity securities listed on global stock exchanges and of related Entities, including all possible corporate actions and the types of dividends distributed.

This role calls for accuracy and a solid understanding of all types of equity or capital-participation financial instruments. Additionally, knowledge of national and international taxation related to the financial securities under analysis is required. The analyst is also responsible for managing the entity database, ensuring proper codification and the corporate group structure. A proactive attitude towards client interaction, strong problem-solving skills and teamwork abilities are also essential for this role.
Responsibilities
Track all life cycle events of financial instruments (such as dividends, corporate actions, etc.) for the full set of securities listed on designated stock exchanges.
Collect company and security data requested by clients, ensure complete coverage of corporate groups, and monitor Initial Public Offerings (IPOs)
Acquire financial data for issuers and securities from relevant markets
Manage both ordinary and extraordinary corporate actions involving issuers.
Interact occasionally with companies (e.g., investor relations) to acquire and update corporate information
Deliver client support via the help desk, assisting with the content monitored and implemented within internal systems
Analyze, monitor, and maintain specific tax-related content concerning the securities under review
Knowledge And Experience
Bachelor’s degree in an economic field
Experience in the financial services industry would be an asset
Strong collaboration skills - ability to navigate cross functional teams to deliver on shared objectives
Must have the ability to develop strong relationships with colleagues at all levels of the organization
Understanding of how data is stored and flows through systems and databases
Proficiency in English and Italian (spoken and written)
Experience in querying and retrieving data from structured databases (e.g. SQL) and in using programming languages such as Python

<section data-max-lines=""5"" class=""show-more-less-html"">
<div class=""show-more-less-html__markup show-more-less-html__markup--clamp-after-5
relative overflow-hidden"">

Job Description

Job Purpose

The role of the Data Analyst requires the maintenance and integration of both static and dynamic data related to equity securities listed on global stock exchanges and of related Entities, including all possible corporate actions and the types of dividends distributed.

This role calls for accuracy and a solid understanding of all types of equity or capital-participation financial instruments. Additionally, knowledge of national and international taxation related to the financial securities under analysis is required. The analyst is also responsible for managing the entity database, ensuring proper codification and the corporate group structure. A proactive attitude towards client interaction, strong problem-solving skills and teamwork abilities are also essential for this role.

Responsibilities

  • Track all life cycle events of financial instruments (such as dividends, corporate actions, etc.) for the full set of securities listed on designated stock exchanges.
  • Collect company and security data requested by clients, ensure complete coverage of corporate groups, and monitor Initial Public Offerings (IPOs)
  • Acquire financial data for issuers and securities from relevant markets
  • Manage both ordinary and extraordinary corporate actions involving issuers.
  • Interact occasionally with companies (e.g., investor relations) to acquire and update corporate information
  • Deliver client support via the help desk, assisting with the content monitored and implemented within internal systems
  • Analyze, monitor, and maintain specific tax-related content concerning the securities under review

Knowledge And Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in an economic field
  • Experience in the financial services industry would be an asset
  • Strong collaboration skills - ability to navigate cross functional teams to deliver on shared objectives
  • Must have the ability to develop strong relationships with colleagues at all levels of the organization
  • Understanding of how data is stored and flows through systems and databases
  • Proficiency in English and Italian (spoken and written)
  • Experience in querying and retrieving data from structured databases (e.g. SQL) and in using programming languages such as Python

4280162469,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/analyst-data-analysis-at-ice-4280162469?position=4&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=liLMzRulJS1oUFGiEmZaew%3D%3D,"Analyst, Data Analysis",ICE,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Job Description
Job Purpose

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team at ICE. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex financial datasets, identifying trends, and overseeing the collection and maintenance of critical data assets.
This role demands analytical abilities, proficiency with leading data analysis tools, and strong communication skills to present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

The Data Analyst will be tasked with Investments Funds and Warrants-Certificates reference data analysis, data management and standardization, sources research in order to set up wide financial reference datasets in proprietary systems.

Additionally, the candidate will be asked to establish and nurture relationships with Investments Funds and Warrant-Certificates issuers across Europe and, when required, in non-European regions. Among the duties there is the setup of issuing documents flows (KIDs, Factsheets, reporting and regulations Templates).
The candidate should proactively identify opportunities to optimize processes related to data entry and loading through the implementation of dedicated tools.

Furthermore, the role involves providing support to both Italian and international Clients by offering clear explanations and guidance regarding data standardization, content, frequency, and updates. The successful candidate will be instrumental in ensuring high data quality and supporting strategic business initiatives through actionable insights.
Responsibilities
Collect, process, and analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports to support business objectives.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver insights.
Perform data validation and ensure data integrity and accuracy.
Utilize statistical methods to analyze financial data.
Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of data-driven strategies and initiatives.
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and financial services.
Knowledge And Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Banking or Statistic and Data Science and related field.
Previous experience in data analysis, preferably in the financial sector would be an asset.
Experience with data modeling, statistical analysis is a plus.
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other data analysis software.
Knowledge of regulatory requirements and compliance in the financial industry is a plus
Fluent in Italian and English
Analytical Skills: Strong ability to analyze complex datasets and derive meaningful insights.
Technical Proficiency: Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R (preferably knowledge of data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI).
Attention to Detail: High level of accuracy and attention to detail in data analysis and reporting.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and strategically.
Team Collaboration: Ability to work effectively in a team environment and collaborate with various departments is a must.
Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing business needs and priorities.

Job Description

Job Purpose

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team at ICE. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex financial datasets, identifying trends, and overseeing the collection and maintenance of critical data assets.

This role demands analytical abilities, proficiency with leading data analysis tools, and strong communication skills to present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

The Data Analyst will be tasked with Investments Funds and Warrants-Certificates reference data analysis, data management and standardization, sources research in order to set up wide financial reference datasets in proprietary systems.

4242956137,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-organizational-analyst-at-tim-4242956137?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=bUoLd%2FG8xOA3T2FbMuszoA%3D%3D,DATA & ORGANIZATIONAL ANALYST,TIM,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Per una delle nostre Competence Development Area della sede di Roma ricerchiamo una persona con Laurea Magistrale in Economia, Statistica o Ingegneria Gestionale.

La persona si occuperà di mappatura, analisi e reingegnerizzazione dei processi aziendali, revisione e formalizzazione della normativa interna, definizione dei modelli operativi di funzionamento, gestione della job architecture aziendale e delle job evaluation manageriali, supporto specialistico per i progetti strategici del Gruppo.
In particolare, tale attività dovrà essere svolta con riferimento al processo di integrazione delle competenze funzionali al percorso di trasformazione aziendale in atto.
Le competenze tecniche richieste sono le seguenti:
Process Design
Project Management
Data Analysis
Organizational Management
Job Evaluation
Conoscenza MS Office Excel, Word e Power Point
Conoscenza della lingua inglese

Alle persone interessate viene richiesta una seniority di almento due anni, oltre a spiccate capacità di relazione, negoziazione e comunicazione, proattività, propensione a lavorare in team, capacità di problem solving, orientamento al risultato.
Costituiscono, infine, titoli preferenziali la conoscenza di PowerBI e di strumenti di Data Analysis, AI, SAP, Success Factor.
Offriamo un contratto di lavoro a tempo indeterminato e formazione continua, unitamente all’opportunità di lavorare in un contesto dinamico e strategico per il presidio dei processi di TIM.
Sede: Roma

Per una delle nostre Competence Development Area della sede di Roma ricerchiamo una persona con Laurea Magistrale in Economia, Statistica o Ingegneria Gestionale.

La persona si occuperà di mappatura, analisi e reingegnerizzazione dei processi aziendali, revisione e formalizzazione della normativa interna, definizione dei modelli operativi di funzionamento, gestione della job architecture aziendale e delle job evaluation manageriali, supporto specialistico per i progetti strategici del Gruppo.

In particolare, tale attività dovrà essere svolta con riferimento al processo di integrazione delle competenze funzionali al percorso di trasformazione aziendale in atto.

Le competenze tecniche richieste sono le seguenti:

  • Process Design
  • Project Management
  • Data Analysis
  • Organizational Management
  • Job Evaluation
  • Conoscenza MS Office Excel, Word e Power Point
  • Conoscenza della lingua inglese

Alle persone interessate viene richiesta una seniority di almento due anni, oltre a spiccate capacità di relazione, negoziazione e comunicazione, proattività, propensione a lavorare in team, capacità di problem solving, orientamento al risultato.

Costituiscono, infine, titoli preferenziali la conoscenza di PowerBI e di strumenti di Data Analysis, AI, SAP, Success Factor.

Offriamo un contratto di lavoro a tempo indeterminato e formazione continua, unitamente all’opportunità di lavorare in un contesto dinamico e strategico per il presidio dei processi di TIM.

Sede: Roma

4240143422,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-data-analyst-at-msx-international-4240143422?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=2ElzZk2KngF3lqDtcdrb4g%3D%3D,Business Data Analyst,MSX International,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Company Description
With over 5,000 employees based in more than 80 countries across the globe, our teams provide industry leading expertise that spans:
Consumer Engagement
Parts, Accessories & Service Performance
Actionable Insights
Diagnostics & Repair Enhancement
Warranty and Repair Efficiency
Technical Information
Learning Solutions
Sales Performance
Building trust since 1931, our proven track record means that we now partner with almost every car manufacturer on the market.
The MSXI Purpose
To empower Movers and Makers to thrive in our ever-changing world
The MSXI Mission
To harness our expertise in mobility, the creativity of our global teams,
and the power of technology, to craft tailored and innovative solutions
The MSXI Vision
To enhance every journey in the world of mobility
Job Description
Business Data Analyst
40 hours per week, Monday-Friday
Rome, hybrid
Are you an automotive fan and have a passion for data analysis? Do you enjoy collecting and analyzing data to detect improvements? MSXI has the job for you!
MSX is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Business Data Analyst to join our team in Rome.
The Role
Responsibilities

As part of our team, you will support the data management and analysis processes as well as the development and deployment of our Data and AI literacy program. Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes. Your key tasks will be:
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide insights into Lean program performance and business operations
Provide data-driven recommendations to stakeholder
Document processes, findings, and recommendations clearly and effectively for both technical and non-technical audiences
Qualifications
About you
About

We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Business Data Analyst has a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field, as well as:
3+ years experience as a Business Analyst, with background in data analytics and AI
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Entry level knowledge of SQL, ETL processes, and data modeling
Experience with BI tools and data visualization platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Experience of planning complex schedules of activities
Fluent level of English
If you’re ready to make an impact and contribute to our company’s success, apply now!
What’s in it for you?

At MSX, our employees are the force behind our success. We are dedicated to empowering and encouraging our people and offer flexible working methods to suit all. We are a Disability Confident Committed organisation who takes pride in our diverse workforce.
In Joining MSX, You Can Enjoy
Competitive salary
Company laptop and phone
Lunch voucher
Working Pattern
40 hours per week
Monday – Friday
Rome - hybrid
You can learn more about MSX International on our website: www.msxi.com
Additional Information

MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

4270052686,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-consultant-data-analyst-intern-at-kpmg-italy-4270052686?position=7&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=jlliAbrl3uVj6eRnKwI%2BrQ%3D%3D,Junior Consultant Data Analyst (Intern),KPMG Italy,"Rome, Latium, Italy","We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l’opportunità di aiutare i clienti, la società, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide più attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonché supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.
Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse.
La Lighthouse è il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalità e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti dell'ingegneria dei dati, con un forte focus sulla progettazione delle informazioni e visualizzazione dei dati. Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacità di interpretare e gestire i dati.
Nello specifico, ti occuperai di:
Disegno di basi dati con finalità analitiche
Analisi e integrazione di fonti dati
Analisi, progettazione e implementazione di reporting e cruscotti di monitoraggio
Analisi dei processi di business e disegno di modelli analitici a supporto
Implementazione di soluzioni analitiche, supporto al go-live e application maintenance.
Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche
Questa opportunità è perfetta per te se:
Possiedi una Laurea in economia, matematica, ingegneria matematica, statistica, ingegneria informatica, ingegneria gestionale o informatica
Hai sviluppato conoscenza in ambito dati e database (modelli dati entità/relazioni, DBMS)
Hai sviluppato interesse per l'ambito Business Intelligence/Data & Analytics
Hai sviluppato la capacità di combinare competenze aziendali con competenze IT, inclusa la modellazione dei dati
Hai maturato onoscenza di strumenti di Business Intelligence come Qlik, Power BI, Tableau o equivalenti.
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero
Possiedi conoscenza di almeno uno dei seguenti database (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) e hai sviluppato competenze in SQL
column2: la conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione rappresenta un vantaggio.

column1: Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG
Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversità
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creatività e il lavoro di squadra
Modalità di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Mindset internazionale e progettualità innovative
Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico.
Together for Better – I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualità, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunità, integrità: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all’impegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network risulta conforme agli standard dei requisiti ISO 30415, sul Sistema di Gestione per la Diversità e l’Inclusione, e UNI PdR 125, relativa alla parità di genere. All’interno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).
Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunità
At KPMG - no secrets with big data
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to pursue a profession that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, the company and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory offers consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitisation, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.
Specifically, you will join our Lighthouse team.
Lighthouse is the KPMG Advisory centre of excellence delivering an array of data & analytics solutions.

Alongside the team, you will develop innovative solutions by drawing on our global expertise,with access to shared knowledge from our centres of excellence Your experience in IT, mathematics and statistics along with your corporate expertise will allow you to design and implement predictive analytical solutions, integrating different factors and presenting them in a professional manner. In a business- and technological innovation-orientated environment, your work will embrace data science, data engineering and information visualisation.
Specifically, you will be tasked with:
Designing databases for analytical purposes
Analyzing and integrating data sources
Analyzing, designing, and implementing reporting and monitoring dashboards
Analyzing business processes and designing analytical models to support them
Implementing analytical solutions, go-live support, and application maintenance.
Skills
Come As You Are - Your skills and characteristics
This is the perfect opportunity for you if:
You have a degree in economics, mathematics, mathematical engineering, statistics, computer engineering, management engineering, or computer science.
You have developed knowledge in the field of data and databases (entity/relationship data models, DBMS).
You have developed an interest in the field of Business Intelligence/Data & Analytics.
You have developed the ability to combine business skills with IT skills, including data modeling
You have a good command of English, preferably with experience studying and/or working abroad
You have knowledge of at least one of the following databases (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) and have developed skills in SQL
column2: knowledge of programming languages is an advantage.

column1: Your Future With Us - What you’ll find at KPMG
An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity.
A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork.
Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
Advanced training and development programmes to stay current.
International mindset and innovative projects.
Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being.
Together for Better – Our values and commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect every individual, continuous learning, transparency, commitment to the community and integrity. These are the KPMG values that create an environment that encourages the sharing of ideas and knowledge, so our professionals can achieve their full potential.

AAs a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarised all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.
Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - “GDPR”), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG’s privacy policy.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

column18:
knowledge of programming languages is an advantage.

Your Future With Us - What you’ll find at KPMG

  • An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity.
  • A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork.
  • Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
  • Advanced training and development programmes to stay current.
  • International mindset and innovative projects.
  • Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being.

Together for Better – Our values and commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect every individual, continuous learning, transparency, commitment to the community and integrity. These are the KPMG values that create an environment that encourages the sharing of ideas and knowledge, so our professionals can achieve their full potential.

AAs a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarised all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - “GDPR”), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG’s privacy policy.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

3889705659,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/candidatura-spontanea-neolaureati-at-engineering-group-3889705659?position=8&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=rsXRDX6QU6VnJZ5Hr3ry%2FA%3D%3D,Candidatura Spontanea Neolaureati,Engineering Group,"Rome, Latium, Italy","CRESCI CON NOI: CREA UN FUTURO DIGITALE E SOSTENIBILE!

Se hai appena concluso, o stai concludendo, i tuoi studi e sei alla ricerca di un'opportunità per far emergere il tuo potenziale, allora sei nell’Azienda giusta. Sarai affiancato dai migliori professionisti per continuare ad apprendere. Il tuo successo è il nostro obiettivo comune!

In Engineering cerchiamo menti brillanti che abbiano voglia di crescere con noi. Sarai immerso in un ambiente che valorizza la tua crescita attraverso un training on the job continuo e una formazione specialistica che potenzierà le tue hard e soft skills. La nostra IT & Management Academy ‘Enrico della Valle’ da più di 30 anni crea percorsi di apprendimento innovativi ed esperienziali mirati a valorizzarti, trasmettendoti le conoscenze più richieste sul mercato del lavoro e accompagnandoti nella tua carriera con noi.
We do IT, We teach IT!
SEI L’INNOVAZIONE CHE CERCHIAMO?
Se vuoi trasformare la tua passione in una carriera e riconosci in te queste caratteristiche, non esitare a candidarti:
Hai conseguito o stai conseguendo una laurea in discipline STEM o di Economia
Consideri il mondo IT e la DIGITAL TRANSFORMATION tra i tuoi interessi principali
Sei predisposto al lavoro in team e alla condivisione di nuove idee
Pensi fuori dagli schemi e ti piace creare soluzioni innovative
Vuoi metterti alla prova, imparare e raggiungere obiettivi ambiziosi.
Invia la tua candidatura e raccontaci come puoi fare la differenza.
SEDI DI INSERIMENTO
Tutte le principali sedi di Italia dove Engineering è presente, come:
Roma | Milano | Torino | Bologna | Palermo | Napoli | Firenze | Genova | Padova
L’annuncio è rivolto a tutti i candidati, senza distinzione di sesso, nel rispetto del Codice delle pari opportunità di cui al D.Lgs. 198/2006 e ss.mm.ii.

4291585364,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/international-data-operations-analyst-at-siae-4291585364?position=12&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=ovIe8tlCiawfoVas%2Fx6TZA%3D%3D,International Data & Operations Analyst,SIAE,"Rome, Latium, Italy","🚀 Ruolo: International Data & Operations Analyst
📍 Località: Roma
🕒 Tipo di Contratto: Tempo Indeterminato
✨ Su di noi:

Benvenuto/a in SIAE, la Società Italiana degli Autori ed Editori! Siamo il faro per chi opera nel mondo della cultura e dello spettacolo e proteggiamo i diritti d’autore delle opere dei nostri associati e delle nostre associate, garantendo il giusto compenso per il loro talento. Unirsi a noi è una scelta volontaria che offre una tutela economica indispensabile per chi crea.
🎯 La tua sfida:

Hai la passione per i l’analisi dei dati e per la semplificazione dei processi? Sei curioso/a di sapere come funziona il diritto d’autore a livello internazionale? Il/la candidato/a che cerchiamo parla e scrive fluentemente in lingua inglese e si trova a suo agio in situazioni di dialogo con società estere. La sfida offerta da SIAE è quella di analizzare grandi quantità di dati e trasformarle in informazioni utili ad accrescere il valore del repertorio SIAE utilizzato all’estero. Se sarai la persona giusta, farai parte del team di International Distribution.
💼 Le Tue Responsabilità:
• Analisi dati: raccoglierai e organizzerai dati per migliorarne la qualità e l’affidabilità, e identificherai modelli, tendenze e insight.
• Pianificazione: collaborare con il team per sviluppare piani strategici e operativi basati sull’analisi dei dati, supportando le attività di budgeting, forecasting e simulazioni.
• Ottimizzazione dei processi: identificare opportunità per ottimizzare i processi aziendali attraverso l’analisi dei dati e la proposta di soluzioni migliorative.

• Collaborazione interfunzionale: sei in grado di interfacciarti con le diverse strutture aziendali e con società internazionali, rappresentando SIAE e i suoi aventi diritto all’infuori del territorio italiano.
🎓 Requisiti:
• Formazione: laurea in discipline STEM
• 2 anni di esperienza nella gestione operativa e monitoraggio dei processi aziendali
• Lingue: ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese scritta e parlata
• Pacchetto Office: conoscenza eccellente di Excel e Power Point
• Conoscenza base SQL ed esperienza nell’utilizzo di software BI (es Qlik, Power BI, Tableau)
• Soft Skills: eccellenti capacità comunicative, problem-solving e team working
🌈 Nice to have:
• Conoscenza di una seconda lingua straniera (francese, spagnolo)
• Conoscenza di altri linguaggi di programmazione: Python, R SQL, Qlik, Power BI, Tableau
• Attitudine e coerenza con la cultura dell’apprendimento continuo e dell’innovazione
• Forte engagement con il Purpose SIAE “dalla parte di chi crea”
💰 I Benefit che Offriamo:
• Contributo Welfare Aziendale
• Buoni Pasto da €6,5 al giorno
• Smart Working per 10 giorni al mese
• Premio di Risultato
• Assistenza Sanitaria UniSalute
• Contributo Previdenza Complementare
• Borse di Studio per i figli
• Convenzioni aziendali (Corporate benefits
column2: Vickey)

column1: • Piattaforma di e-learning Edflex
• Piattaforma Bonoos per agevolazioni, sconti e altre forme di sostegno ai cittadini
🌟 I nostri valori
• Trust: conquistiamo la fiducia con sincerità e rispetto
• Innovation: guardiamo al futuro proteggendo la nostra identità
• Execution: crediamo in ciò che facciamo con responsabilità e passione
🚀 Unisciti a Noi:

Valutiamo tutte le candidature ricevute coerentemente con la cultura inclusiva e i valori che ci contraddistinguono ogni giorno, volti a valorizzare la diversità nelle sue molteplici forme come fondamentale contributo per la crescita aziendale e collettiva.
“Per informazioni sul trattamento dei dati personali, ti invitiamo a consultare la nostra Informativa sulla Privacy.”

4236562644,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-science-sas-at-kpmg-italy-4236562644?position=13&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=ajdV8V5hju5%2Bw7KsDv0IPg%3D%3D,Junior Data Science - SAS,KPMG Italy,"Rome, Latium, Italy","We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l’opportunità di aiutare i clienti, la società, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide più attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonché supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.
Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse di Roma.
La Lighthouse è il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalità e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti di Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing e molto altro! Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacità di interpretare e gestire i dati.
Nello specifico, ti occuperai di:
Integrazione dei dati: capire quali fonti di dati sono importanti e come devono essere trattate al fine di potenziare nuovi strumenti e metodologie Data Driven
Modellazione: sviluppo di nuovi modelli di Machine Learning ad hoc per soddisfare le richieste e i requisiti aziendali
Piattaforme di analisi avanzate: Sviluppo di pipeline ML complete, dall'ingestione dei dati alle applicazioni frontend.

Incontri ed eventi orientati al business: concentrandosi fortemente sulla condivisione con gli utenti aziendali dei dettagli del progetto, si costruisce la fiducia nello strumento e nella metodologia utilizzata per svilupparlo
Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche
Questa opportunità è perfetta per te se:
Possiedi una Laurea in Data Science, Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Matematica, Statistica o altra ritenuta attinente
Hai una buona conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione come Python e SAS
Hai competenze nella comprensione del ciclo di vita dei modelli: preparazione dei dati dell'ultimo miglio, sviluppo di modelli di intelligenza artificiale e distribuzione in un'infrastruttura cloud
Hai una buona conoscenza di: Data Warehouse, estrazione, manipolazione e preparazione dei dati
Hai competenze di base di Data Visualization, con soluzioni Enterprise (es. PowerBI) o soluzioni open-source come ggplot o plotly
Hai competenze di base con le principali piattaforme cloud (Azure, AWS)
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero
Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG
Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversità
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creatività e il lavoro di squadra
Modalità di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Mindset internazionale e progettualità innovative
Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico
Together for Better – I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualità, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunità, integrità: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all’impegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network risulta conforme agli standard dei requisiti ISO 30415, sul Sistema di Gestione per la Diversità e l’Inclusione, e UNI PdR 125, relativa alla parità di genere. All’interno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).
Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunità.
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory provides consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitization, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.
Specifically, you will join the Lighthouse Team in Rome.
Lighthouse is KPMG Advisory's center of excellence offering Data & Analytics solutions in the market.

Joining the team, you will develop innovative solutions drawing on our global expertise. You will combine computer science, mathematics, statistics and business to create predictive analytics, presenting and communicating them with professionalism and expertise. You will work in a technology innovation-oriented environment, dealing with Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing and more! We have received international recognition for our ability to interpret and manage data.
Specifically, you will be involved in:
Data Integration: understanding which data sources are important and how they should be treated in order to enhance new Data Driven tools and methodologies
Modeling: developing new Machine Learning models ad hoc to meet business demands and requirements
Advanced Analytics Platforms: Development of complete ML pipelines from data ingestion to frontend applications.
Business-oriented meetings and events: Strong focus on sharing project details with business users builds confidence in the tool and the methodology used to develop it
Come As You Are - Your Skills And Characteristics.
This opportunity is perfect for you if:
You hold a Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, Statistics or other deemed relevant
You have a good understanding of major programming languages such as Python and SAS
You have skills in understanding the model lifecycle: last mile data preparation, artificial intelligence model development and deployment in a cloud infrastructure
You have a good understanding of: Data Warehouse, data extraction, manipulation and preparation
You have basic skills in Data Visualization, with Enterprise solutions (e.g., PowerBI) or open-source solutions such as ggplot or plotly
You have basic skills with major cloud platforms (Azure, AWS)
You have a good command of the English language, preferably with study and/or work experience abroad
Your Future With Us - What you will find at KPMG.
An inclusive, equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity
A stimulating and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork
Hybrid work mode to promote a healthy work-life balance
Advanced training and development programs to stay current
International mindset and innovative projects
Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being
Together for Better - Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for each individuality, continuous deepening, transparency, commitment to the community, integrity: these are KPMG's Values that give rise to an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, enabling our professionals to reach their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarized all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.
Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) No. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - “GDPR”) as amended. For more information, please see KPMG's privacy policy.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. guarantees equal opportunities.

We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l’opportunità di aiutare i clienti, la società, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide più attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonché supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.

Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse di Roma.

La Lighthouse è il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data &
column2:
Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalità e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti di Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing e molto altro! Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacità di interpretare e gestire i dati.

Nello specifico, ti occuperai di:

  • Integrazione dei dati: capire quali fonti di dati sono importanti e come devono essere trattate al fine di potenziare nuovi strumenti e metodologie Data Driven
column3: • Modellazione: sviluppo di nuovi modelli di Machine Learning ad hoc per soddisfare le richieste e i requisiti aziendali
column4:
• Piattaforme di analisi avanzate: Sviluppo di pipeline ML complete, dall'ingestione dei dati alle applicazioni frontend.
  • Incontri ed eventi orientati al business: concentrandosi fortemente sulla condivisione con gli utenti aziendali dei dettagli del progetto, si costruisce la fiducia nello strumento e nella metodologia utilizzata per svilupparlo

4234279975,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/aml-data-analyst-intern-at-worldline-4234279975?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=cWYB2vncIPEc44EAYuzCOA%3D%3D,AML Data Analyst Intern,Worldline,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Job Description
AML Data Analyst Intern
AML Data Analyst Intern
Rome, Italy
This is Worldline

We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. The solutions our people build today power the growth of millions of businesses tomorrow. From your local coffee shop to unicorns and international banks. From San Francisco to Auckland. We are in every corner of the world, in every part of commerce. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
The Opportunity

Join a dynamic team dedicated to support the growth in full compliance with Worldline’s merchant risk policies safeguarding our financial forefront, where every day offers the chance to make an impact in the fight against money laundering and terrorism financing. We are seeking a AML Data Analyst Intern to join our team, reporting to the Head of First Line of Defense Risk and Compliance at Worldline Merchant Services Italia. Your role will play a crucial role in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support business decision-making, to streamline operations and ensure compliance with the company's standards.
Day-to-Day Responsibilities

Reporting KYC: Gather data needed for AML KYC purposes from different business sources and prepare monthly reports detailing KYC information, ensuring weekly updates to reflect current review status in monthly committees

Reporting Internal Committee: Compile data related to KYC, Credit, and Fraud activities into an annual report file including statistics and updates from involved departments (Compliance, Operations, AML) on periodic basis
Reporting Business Information KPIs: Analyze Business Information KPIs in onboarding and ongoing merchant activities
column2: Identify consumption trends or changes, highlighting concerns or improvement opportunities in relation to contractual consumption caps

column1: Preparation of Functional Analysis Files for IT Implementations: Support internal Project Managers in the collaboration with Compliance, Operations, Information Technology to collect and document business requirements for different IT Implementation.
Who Are We Looking For
We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:
Master's degree in Economics, Management, or Law
Familiarity with data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R)
Strong critical thinking, analytical, and organizational skills
Excellent communication skills
Basic knowledge of KYC and AML processes as a plus
Good level of English in speaking and writing.
Perks & Benefits
At Worldline you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
Be part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide.
Work with inspiring colleagues and be empowered to learn, grow and accelerate your career.
Enjoy remote work (50%).
Enjoy wide range of training through our eLearning platforms (LinkedIn Learning, Percipio, Speex, Cross Knowledge).
Shape the evolution

We are on an exciting journey towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers, people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. With an empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career - wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of 18,000 innovators and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.

AML Data Analyst Intern

AML Data Analyst Intern

Rome, Italy

This is Worldline

We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. The solutions our people build today power the growth of millions of businesses tomorrow. From your local coffee shop to unicorns and international banks. From San Francisco to Auckland. We are in every corner of the world, in every part of commerce. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.

Your role will play a crucial role in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support business decision-making, to streamline operations and ensure compliance with the company's standards.

column8: • Excellent communication skills

Benefits

At Worldline you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:

  • Be part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide.
  • Work with inspiring colleagues and be empowered to learn, grow and accelerate your career.
  • Enjoy remote work (50%).
  • Enjoy wide range of training through our eLearning platforms (LinkedIn Learning, Percipio, Speex, Cross Knowledge).

Shape the evolution

We are on an exciting journey towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers, people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. With an empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career - wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of 18,000 innovators and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.

Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com
