Who We Are Is What We Do.

Deel is the all-in-one payroll and HR platform for global teams. Our vision is to unlock global opportunity for every person, team, and business. Built for the way the world works today, Deel combines HRIS, payroll, compliance, benefits, performance, and equipment management into one seamless platform. With AI-powered tools and a fully owned payroll infrastructure, Deel supports every worker type in 150+ countries—helping businesses scale smarter, faster, and more compliantly.

Among the largest globally distributed companies in the world, our team of 6,000 spans more than 100 countries, speaks 74 languages, and brings a connected and dynamic culture that drives continuous learning and innovation for our customers.

Why should you be part of our success story?

As the fastest-growing Software as a Service (SaaS) company in history, Deel is transforming how global talent connects with world-class companies – breaking down borders that have traditionally limited both hiring and career opportunities. We're not just building software
column2:
we're creating the infrastructure for the future of work, enabling a more diverse and inclusive global economy. In 2024 alone, we paid $11.2 billion to workers in nearly 100 currencies and provided healthcare and benefits to workers in 109 countries—ensuring people get paid and protected, no matter where they are.

Our momentum is reflected in our achievements and customer satisfaction: CNBC Disruptor 50, Forbes Cloud 100, Deloitte Fast 500, and repeated recognition on Y Combinator’s top companies list – all while maintaining a 4.83 average rating from 15,000 reviews across G2, Trustpilot, Captera, Apple and Google.

Your experience at Deel will be a career accelerator. At the forefront of the global work revolution, you'll tackle complex challenges that impact millions of people's working lives. With our momentum—backed by a $12 billion valuation and $1 B in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) in just over five years—you'll drive meaningful impact while building expertise that makes you a sought-after leader in the transformation of global work.

Summary

The Senior Data Analyst for Onboarding will play a foundational role in shaping and structuring our onboarding analytics from the ground up. You will bring clarity and structure to a complex, evolving area of the business. You’ll create the insights, tools, and metrics that help teams deliver faster, smoother onboarding experiences at scale—directly influencing both operational improvements and strategic direction.

Responsibilities

  • Own the development of a robust reporting framework for Onboarding, bringing structure and scalability to a currently fragmented ecosystem
  • Partner closely with onboarding, product, and data teams to define key onboarding metrics, build dashboards, and enable self-serve analytics
  • Identify bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and opportunities across the onboarding journey using data
  • Deliver insights to stakeholders across the company, from front-line teams to senior leadership, to inform strategic decisions and process improvements
  • Develop, maintain, and optimize reporting tools in Looker (or other BI tools), ensuring data is both reliable and actionable
  • Collaborate with data engineers and analytics engineers to model onboarding data and ensure pipelines are accurate and aligned with business logic

Desired Skills And Competencies

  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Math, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
  • 5+ years of experience in an analytical role, with at least some exposure to operational or product-facing analytics
  • Advanced SQL skills and experience working with large datasets
  • Excellent communication skills and a proven ability to turn complex data into compelling narratives for a range of stakeholders
  • Experience with BI tools (we use Looker) and dashboard development
  • Familiarity with data modeling, metric design, and scalable reporting architectures
  • Comfort operating in ambiguity and helping define success metrics where none yet exist
  • Experience with dbt, LookML, and version control tools (Git, GitHub, etc.)
  • Prior experience in high-growth B2B SaaS environments
  • Familiarity with customer journey analytics and lifecycle tracking

Total Rewards

Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.

Some things you’ll enjoy

  • Stock grant opportunities dependent on your role, employment status and location
  • Additional perks and benefits based on your employment status and country
  • The flexibility of remote work, including optional WeWork access

At Deel, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy or maternity or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Unless otherwise agreed, we will communicate with job applicants using Deel-specific emails, which include @deel.com and other acquired company emails like @payspace.com and @paygroup.com. You can view the most up-to-date job listings at Deel by visitingour careers page.

Deel is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects different abilities, backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, identities and perspectives.

Deel will provide accommodation on request throughout the recruitment, selection and assessment process for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team at recruiting@deel.com of the nature of the accommodation that you may require, to ensure your equal participation.

Certain features of the platform may qualify it as an Automated Employment Decision Tool (AEDT) under applicable regulations. For positions in New York City, our use of Covey complies with NYC Local Law 144.

We began using Covey Scout for Inbound on March 30, 2025.

4288536075,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-engineer-at-kirey-4288536075?position=36&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=NizFCAWnk48jfILxXTxa6Q%3D%3D,Junior Data Engineer,Kirey,"Rome, Latium, Italy","LA TUA NUOVA AZIENDA
✨Kirey è uno dei principali gruppi europei attivi nella consulenza tecnologica e nella system integration, con un posizionamento distintivo nell’ambito della data-driven innovation.

Attraverso un portafoglio completo di soluzioni che include Data & AI, Cloud, Software Development, Cybersecurity, Infrastructure & Automation e Monitoring, Kirey trasforma la complessità dei dati in soluzioni intuitive e accessibili, facilitando i propri clienti nel raggiungimento degli obiettivi di business.

Con sede principale in Italia, una presenza internazionale consolidata e quasi 1.500 dipendenti, Kirey ha realizzato più di 10.000 progetti per clienti leader nei settori Insurance, Banking, Manufacturing, Retail, Pubblica Amministrazione e Services & Energy.

Alla base di tutto questo ci sono le persone, che in Kirey trovano spazio per esprimere al massimo il proprio talento e per sentirsi parte attiva nella catena del valore dell'azienda. Ciò è possibile grazie a: investimenti costanti nei processi di miglioramento, attraverso la formazione
column2: idee innovative e stimolo alla creatività, grazie al consolidamento delle competenze
column3: e, ancora, a una particolare sensibilità - che si esprime in progetti ad hoc - nei confronti dell'inclusione e della diversità.

column1: IL TUO RUOLO

Come Data Engineer, entrerai a far parte del nostro team tecnico per lavorare su progetti innovativi e sfidanti nell'ambito dell'analisi dati, machine learning e intelligenza artificiale. Lavorerai a stretto contatto con il team di Data Scientist, Analisti e Devops.
Ti occuperai di:
Creazione e manutenzione di pipeline dati scalabili e performanti.
Progetti Big Data
Progetti di data engineering - analisi dati
REQUISITI
Esperienza in progetti di data engineering o analisi dati.
Conoscenza di Python (ETL, scripting, automazioni) ed SQL
Capacità di lavorare con dati strutturati e semi strutturati (CSV, Parquet, JSON) ed i formati open table
Conoscenza della lingua inglese (almeno B2)
Familiarità con almeno 2 tra i seguenti strumenti:
Apache Spark (and similar frameworks)
Apache Hive
Apache Impala
Apache Airflow
💡 PLUS
Esperienza in ambienti Cloud: AWS (o Azure o Google)
Conoscenza di tecnologie di versioning (Git) e CI/CD
Conoscenza Cloudera CDP Public (e/o Private Cloud)
Esperienza in ambienti containerizzati o cloud ibrido.
Conoscenza dei Docker tools
Big Data certifications, such as Cloudera, Databricks, etc. are welcome
Experience and knowledge of Big Data Architectures, cloud and on premise
COSA OFFRIAMO
Progetti complessi ed innovativi
Ambiente dinamico e meritocratico
Lavoro in team con metodologia Agile
Piano di crescita professionale
Corsi di formazione e certificazioni
Sistema di Welfare&Benefits
Smart working o full remote
column2: orario flessibile

column1: UNISCITI A NOI
Sede di lavoro: Roma - Firenze - Milano/Ibrido
Abbiamo una strategia di Flexible e Remote Working che è progettata per sfruttare il potere delle opportunità che il lavoro a distanza offre sia ai dipendenti che all'Azienda
column2: ci impegniamo a fornire un'esperienza coinvolgente per tutte le volte in cui siamo in ufficio. Il nostro approccio all'ambiente di lavoro riflette la convinzione che l'impatto, il contributo e il risultato di un dipendente sono più importanti della sua posizione fisica.

column1: Kirey Group sostiene la diversità nel suo ambiente di lavoro. Tutte le candidature per le posizioni aperte saranno accolte con favore e saranno considerate in base ai meriti.

In Kirey Group continuiamo ad assumere tantissimo. Se questa opportunità non è in linea con le tue aspettative, ma sei alla ricerca di un nuovo lavoro, visita il nostro sito Internet www.kireygroup.com per scoprirne di nuove.

I Suoi dati saranno trattati per la selezione del personale (esecuzione misure precontrattuali) da soggetti, anche esterni, coinvolti nella selezione del Titolare, Kirey S.r.l., con sede legale in Via Benigno Crespi, 57 - 20159 Milano, nella persona del Legale Rappresentante protempore, e/o dalle altre Società sottoposte al suo controllo e coordinamento, che può contattare all’indirizzo e-mail privacy@kireygroup.com, a cui potrà rivolgersi per esercitare i Suoi diritti (ex artt. 15-22 GDPR), compreso eventuale reclamo al Garante Privacy. I dati saranno conservati massimo 24 mesi (salvo eventi interruttivi o sospensivi) e, in ogni caso, non saranno diffusi. 4276869323,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-engineer-at-engineering-group-4276869323?position=37&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=AMuwcRCffPabdoVvbzZQ9Q%3D%3D,Junior Data Engineer,Engineering Group,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Cosa Ti Proponiamo

All’interno della divisione Eng Digital, nella Business Line Eng AI & Data, siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa per il ruolo di Junior Data Engineer. La figura verrà inserita nell’area Data Management e si occuperà di definire e sviluppare soluzioni e architetture in ambito Big Data e Cloud.
Quali saranno le tue attività e responsabilità?
Analisi dei requisiti tecnici e di gestione tecnica dei progetti
Definizione di Architetture Analitiche on prem o in cloud
Sviluppo di soluzioni distribuite
Creazione e manutenzione in lingua inglese della documentazione tecnica.
Qualifiche e Competenze Richieste
Laurea Magistrale in Informatica o Ingegneria Informatica
Conoscenza base di database relazionali (es. PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQL Server)
Conoscenza di SQL per interrogazione e manipolazione dati
Conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione con familiarità con linguaggi di programmazione come Python o Scala
Interesse per il mondo Big Data e le tecnologie di data pipeline
Conoscenza Inglese almeno livello B1.
Cosa cerchiamo nelle nostre persone?
Ambizione, nel perseguire grandi obiettivi e nell'investire sul miglioramento continuo
Proattività, nell’anticipare e affrontare le sfide con iniziativa
Trasparenza, nel comunicare apertamente e fornire feedback costruttivi
Motivazione a migliorare e a crescere insieme agli altri, manifestando apertura al confronto per favorire la crescita collettiva e il raggiungimento degli obiettivi comuni.
Invia la tua candidatura e raccontaci come puoi fare la differenza.
SEDI DI INSERIMENTO
Roma | Milano | Torino | Palermo | Napoli | Padova | Treviso (Lancenigo)
L’annuncio è rivolto a tutti i candidati, senza distinzione di sesso, nel rispetto del Codice delle pari opportunità di cui al D.Lgs. 198/2006 e ss.mm.ii.

4232686109,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-analyst-pmo-at-aeroporti-di-roma-4232686109?position=38&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=cpy6AQSLOV13VUZ2ni3Rtw%3D%3D,DATA SCIENTIST ANALYST - PMO,Aeroporti di Roma,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Job Description

Il Gruppo Aeroporti di Roma, nell’ambito della Business Unit Aviation nell’unità Operation & Maintenance, in particolare nell’asset “O&M and IoT Data Engineering, Environmental Operations” è alla ricerca di:
Data scientist analyst

L’asset O&M and IoT Data Engineering, Environmental Operations si occupa principalmente di garantire la progettazione, l’implementazione e l’integrazione di soluzioni IoT per la gestione degli asset, ingegnerizzando e analizzando i dati al fine di abilitare l’evoluzione della strategia manutentiva degli asset in ottica di value for money.

La risorsa avrà maturato un’esperienza di 3 – 5 anni in area automation presso realtà industriali preferibilmente del settore trasporti/alimentare/beverage/pharma/automotive o presso società impiantistiche costruttrici.

Sarà considerato un plus l’aver maturato esperienza nell’ambito di Data Science, Machine Learning o Software Engineering, preferibilmente in strutture di AI e Data analytics all’interno di aziende a forte componente industriale/operativa o in aziende di consulenza che hanno sviluppato progetti relativi ai sopracitati ambiti.
Principali attività e aree di responsabilità

Collaborare alla progettazione e allo sviluppo di nuove funzionalità di piattaforme di monitoraggio/SCADA di asset e impianti aeroportuali, automatizzando il processo di gestione dei dati e definendo la tipologia di dati da monitorare
Collaborare attivamente per progettare e concepire nuove sensorizzazioni

Definire, sviluppare e implementare i flussi di dati provenienti dai diversi asset e impianti aeroportuali, assicurando che i dati siano strutturati in modo coerente con le esigenze tecnico/manutentive e pronti per essere analizzati
Integrare nuove fonti di dati nei sistemi esistenti, collaborando con fornitori e strutture tecniche per l’implementazione delle soluzioni identificate
Definire e implementare le politiche di data governance, tra cui la definizione di standard di qualità dei dati e le linee guida di storicizzazione
Collaborare con i team di data science, data analysis e altri stakeholder aziendali per comprendere le esigenze di dati utili a sviluppare modelli di Machine Learning/AI.
Requisiti Ed Esperienze
Conoscenza pratica di PLC, DCS, SCADA, MES e problematiche relative allo scambio di segnali tra differenti sistemi di automazione
Esperienza con protocolli IoT: LoRaWAN, Zigbee, MQTT, OPC-UA per gestione e trasmissione dati sensoriali
Esperienza con protocolli di comunicazione industriale: PROFINET, PROFIBUS, KNX, BACnet, Modbus, Ethernet/IP, CANopen, EtherCAT
Esperienza con sensori e trasduttori per acquisizione dati (temperatura, umidità, pressione, accelerometri, giroscopi, vibrazionali, celle di carico, rogowski, sensori RFID/NFC)
Conoscenza di calibrazione, condizionamento segnali e interfacciamento con sistemi di acquisizione dati
Esperienza nello sviluppo di board IoT con Raspberry Pi, Arduino, STM32 per applicazioni industriali, monitoraggio remoto, automazione e integrazione sensori
Esperienza in process control, automazione, comunicazione machine-to-machine, machine-to-system e soluzioni Internet of Things (IOT)
Comprensione delle strutture dati, della modellazione dei dati e dell'architettura software
Conoscenza dei linguaggi di programmazione C, C++, VB.NET, SQL, Python
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.
Esperienza con i flussi di lavoro basati sui dati (importazione, pulizia, funzionalità)
Competenze
Capacità di analisi e sintesi
Pianificazione e organizzazione del lavoro
Problem Solving
Teamwork
Orientamento al risultato.
Titolo Di Studi
Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria dell’automazione, Ingegneria informatica, Ingegneria elettronica, Ingegneria elettrica.

Sarà considerato titolo preferenziale l’aver partecipato ad un master/corso di formazione in AI, Machine Learning, con particolare focus sull'integrazione delle tecnologie IoT nei processi di automazione e nella gestione dei sistemi industriali intelligenti, inclusi i sistemi di monitoraggio e controllo avanzato.
Sede Di Lavoro
Fiumicino Aeroporto
Tipologia Di Offerta
Contratto a tempo indeterminato
Modalità di lavoro ibrida.
La selezione è rivolta ad entrambi i sessi nel rispetto del D.lgs. 198/2006.
Offerta di lavoro tutelata dalla L. 68/99 – Categorie protette.

4294048300,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-miodottore-4294048300?position=39&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=rd5qqbSOGeiM3jxOpjZK1w%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Analyst,MioDottore,"Rome, Latium, Italy","At MioDottore, we’re reshaping the future of healthcare in Italy. As the country’s leading digital health platform, our goal is clear: helping people live longer, healthier lives. We're part of Docplanner, a global health tech unicorn operating in 13 countries and backed by top investors like Goldman Sachs and One Peak Partners.
We're growing fast, and we're looking for curious, driven, data-passionate people to join us on this journey.

We're on the hunt for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our vibrant BI team. You’ll be the connection point between raw data and smart decisions , empowering teams across the company with the insights they need to make an impact. If you love transforming complexity into clarity and collaborating with people from all corners of the business, this role is for you.
We’ll count on you to:
Turn data into insight: Identify patterns, trends, and business opportunities through reporting and storytelling.
Support decision-making: Help product, marketing, customer success, finance, HR and other teams understand performance and make data-backed choices.
Ensure data quality: Monitor KPIs, spot inconsistencies, and work with teams to fix issues at the source.
Build scalable solutions: Automate dashboards and reports that drive alignment and visibility across departments.
Collaborate and connect: Act as the go-to person for BI support, guiding stakeholders through their data needs and solutions.
🔧 Tools you'll use daily:
SQL (Redshift), Tableau, Superset, Airflow, Git, Excel, PowerPoint, HubSpot, Amplitude, Looker Studio and possibly Python/R if you're ready to explore more advanced analysis.
What We’re Looking For
We’re not just looking for someone who can crunch numbers, we’re looking for someone who’s curious, proactive, and wants to make an impact.
Here’s what will help you thrive in this role:
You’ve got 2–4 years of experience in business analysis, BI, or data roles.
You're comfortable writing SQL queries to answer real business questions.
You know your way around a BI tool (Bonus point: Superset).
You're detail-oriented, but also love seeing the big picture.
You enjoy talking to people and helping them turn “I think” into “I know”.
You’re fluent in English and Italian. You like working in an international, collaborative environment.
Willing to be relocated in Rome

Extra brownie points if you’ve dabbled with Python or R, have worked with CRMs like HubSpot or Salesforce, or have experience with tools like Amplitude or Segment. But don’t worry – none of these are must-haves.
Why Join Us?
Because here, you’re not just a number-cruncher , you’re a partner in making healthcare better.
🧠 Real impact: Your insights will help thousands of doctors and millions of patients.
🌍 Global vibes: Join an international team, but make a difference locally.
🚀 Ownership from day one: Your work won’t sit in a drawer. It’ll drive action fast.
💡 Growth mindset: Whether it’s learning new tools or owning bigger projects, we’ll help you grow.
❤️ People-first culture: We care about results, but we care about each other even more.
What we offer
💶 Competitive salary adequate to your experience and skills
🧾Employment contract CCNL del Commercio
📈 Share options plan after 6 months working with us.
👩‍💻50% of smart working
🧠 Ifeel, a well-being platform that offers personalised therapy solutions and support
💰Welfare Plan
🍝Ticket Restaurant , 8 euro/daily
🍻 Free Beer in our office
Recruitment process:
First call with Barbara Romano, Talent Acquisition Partner
First interview in the office with the Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Business Case
Second interview with Head of BI & BO & Business Strategy
Final interview with COO and CFO/CHRO
Offer
At MioDottore, your data tells a story, and that story helps people live healthier lives.

At MioDottore, we’re reshaping the future of healthcare in Italy. As the country’s leading digital health platform, our goal is clear: helping people live longer, healthier lives. We're part of Docplanner, a global health tech unicorn operating in 13 countries and backed by top investors like Goldman Sachs and One Peak Partners.

We're growing fast, and we're looking for curious, driven, data-passionate people to join us on this journey.

We're on the hunt for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our vibrant BI team. You’ll be the connection point between raw data and smart decisions , empowering teams across the company with the insights they need to make an impact. If you love transforming complexity into clarity and collaborating with people from all corners of the business, this role is for you.



We’ll count on you to:

  • Turn data into insight: Identify patterns, trends, and business opportunities through reporting and storytelling.
  • Support decision-making: Help product, marketing, customer success, finance, HR and other teams understand performance and make data-backed choices.
  • Ensure data quality: Monitor KPIs, spot inconsistencies, and work with teams to fix issues at the source.
  • Build scalable solutions: Automate dashboards and reports that drive alignment and visibility across departments.
  • Collaborate and connect: Act as the go-to person for BI support, guiding stakeholders through their data needs and solutions.


🔧 Tools you'll use daily:

SQL (Redshift), Tableau, Superset, Airflow, Git, Excel, PowerPoint, HubSpot, Amplitude, Looker Studio and possibly Python/R if you're ready to explore more advanced analysis.




What We’re Looking For

We’re not just looking for someone who can crunch numbers, we’re looking for someone who’s curious, proactive, and wants to make an impact.

Here’s what will help you thrive in this role:

  • You’ve got 2–4 years of experience in business analysis, BI, or data roles.
  • You're comfortable writing SQL queries to answer real business questions.
  • You know your way around a BI tool (Bonus point: Superset).
  • You're detail-oriented, but also love seeing the big picture.
  • You enjoy talking to people and helping them turn “I think” into “I know”.
  • You’re fluent in English and Italian. You like working in an international, collaborative environment.
  • Willing to be relocated in Rome


Extra brownie points if you’ve dabbled with Python or R, have worked with CRMs like HubSpot or Salesforce, or have experience with tools like Amplitude or Segment. But don’t worry – none of these are must-haves.



Why Join Us?

Because here, you’re not just a number-cruncher , you’re a partner in making healthcare better.

  • 🧠 Real impact: Your insights will help thousands of doctors and millions of patients.
  • 🌍 Global vibes: Join an international team, but make a difference locally.
  • 🚀 Ownership from day one: Your work won’t sit in a drawer. It’ll drive action fast.
  • 💡 Growth mindset: Whether it’s learning new tools or owning bigger projects, we’ll help you grow.
  • ❤️ People-first culture: We care about results, but we care about each other even more.


What we offer

  • 💶 Competitive salary adequate to your experience and skills
  • 🧾Employment contract CCNL del Commercio
  • 📈 Share options plan after 6 months working with us.
  • 👩‍💻50% of smart working
  • 🧠 Ifeel, a well-being platform that offers personalised therapy solutions and support
  • 💰Welfare Plan
  • 🍝Ticket Restaurant , 8 euro/daily
  • 🍻 Free Beer in our office


Recruitment process:

  • First call with Barbara Romano, Talent Acquisition Partner
  • First interview in the office with the Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
  • Business Case
  • Second interview with Head of BI &

Business Strategy
  • Final interview with COO and CFO/CHRO

    • At MioDottore, your data tells a story, and that story helps people live healthier lives.

4181094310,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/work-from-home-italy-at-telus-digital-4181094310?position=43&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=IZ%2FpY8H8UND8evF8T3uosw%3D%3D,Work from Home Italy,TELUS Digital,"Latium, Italy","Ready to ditch the traditional 9-5 grind? If you are an Italian speaker living in Italy join our community as a Media Search Analyst, set your own flexible schedule and complete engaging tasks with an innovative web-based evaluation tool!
What You’ll Do As A Media Search Analyst:
Assess diverse media categories: music, books, podcasts, videos, and more.
Evaluate app store content, ensuring search result accuracy and relevance.
Utilize your cultural knowledge and market expertise to validate query intent.
Why Join the AI Community?
Be part of the global and diverse TELUS Digital AI Community with 1M+ global contributors.
Support machine learning for world-leading brands with no prior professional experience.
Make use of your communication and analytical skills and enjoy extra income with great flexibility!
Basic Requirement and Assessment:
Full Professional Proficiency in Italian and English and being a resident on Italy for the past year, aware of local media and trends.
An active Apple ID email address is essential, ownership of an Apple device and familiarity with Apple products.
Complete ID verification at your convenience within a specific timeframe and pass an open book qualification exam with guidelines provided.
Join us today and help revolutionize digital media content!

Ready to ditch the traditional 9-5 grind? If you are an Italian speaker living in Italy join our community as a Media Search Analyst, set your own flexible schedule and complete engaging tasks with an innovative web-based evaluation tool!


What You’ll Do As A Media Search Analyst:

  • Assess diverse media categories: music, books, podcasts, videos, and more.
  • Evaluate app store content, ensuring search result accuracy and relevance.
  • Utilize your cultural knowledge and market expertise to validate query intent.


Why Join the AI Community?

  • Be part of the global and diverse TELUS Digital AI Community with 1M+ global contributors.
  • Support machine learning for world-leading brands with no prior professional experience.
  • Make use of your communication and analytical skills and enjoy extra income with great flexibility!


Basic Requirement and Assessment:

  • Full Professional Proficiency in Italian and English and being a resident on Italy for the past year, aware of local media and trends.
  • An active Apple ID email address is essential, ownership of an Apple device and familiarity with Apple products.
  • Complete ID verification at your convenience within a specific timeframe and pass an open book qualification exam with guidelines provided.


Join us today and help revolutionize digital media content!

4195481260,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/director-analyst-master-data-management-mdm-remote-at-gartner-4195481260?position=44&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=XgDa1lTni%2BQKI8054Ebc4g%3D%3D,"Director Analyst, Master Data Management (MDM), Remote",Gartner,"Rome, Latium, Italy","About the role:

Gartner Analysts are industry thought leaders who create must-have research, market predictions and best practices for a broad range of world-leading organizations. A Director serves as a leader within Gartner’s Research and Advisory sector, establishing oneself as a credible voice within their designated market at local, regional and global levels.

Utilizing exceptional research and analytical skills, a Senior Director plays a significant role in producing pragmatic and provocative research which Gartner clients consume and apply to propel their business toward key objectives. They are a trusted source of advice for clients, reinforcing Gartner’s value every day by engaging them via in-person meetings, virtual meetings, sales support visits and Gartner conferences to discuss complex client challenges and offer appropriate recommendations.

The successful candidate is a subject matter expert in Master Data Management (MDM) and understands its application across people, processes, and technologies. The candidate will focus on written and customer-facing deliverables to support Data & Analytics Leaders who face the challenges of improving/establishing/reviving MDM initiatives. This role will require in depth knowledge of the MDM Market in addition to a strategic level understanding of the topic.
What you will do:
Create innovative, thought provoking, and highly leveraged “must-have research” content
Develop new research and ideas through thought leadership and offer compelling, actionable approaches to client's needs and requests that accelerate the client's ability to act
Develop in-depth analysis to identify the root cause of a client’s barriers or overall needs and reframe thinking to drive strategy forward
Demonstrate thought leadership in establishing research positions across a team of analysts
Bring provocative, independent insights to Gartner leaders that can evolve the course of a research agenda
Research, analyze and predict market trends and shifts to provide clients and vendors with actionable insights
Provide clients and prospects with actionable advice aligned to their designated content area via virtual or face-to-face interactions
Create and deliver high value presentation materials on and off stage for Gartner events, industry and professional association conferences, and client briefings

Support Research and Sales: Provide sales support serving as voice of the market to help research teams create content and to drive engagement with clients to make progress against their critical priorities to grow their business
Provide high quality and timely research content peer review
Build credibility as an industry expert to represent Gartner research, methodology and strategy
Actively participate in innovation, ideation, and research discussions and collaborate effectively with peers in the research community
Identify research process improvements or develop new processes that help the team and Research & Advisory provide excellent service delivery
Be a mentor and a coach by supporting more junior team members
Be client-centric while actively seeking to help clients engage regularly and often with Gartner research and interactions
What you will need:
Subject matter expertise, with demonstrated knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) Strategy.
Deep understanding of the MDM market including (but not limited to): who the key players are, what core capabilities are required, the evolution of the market.
Detailed knowledge of one or more MDM Product(s), hands on experience of implementing an MDM solution is a plus.
Bachelor's Degree, Advanced Professional Qualification, or 10+ years direct experience in a field related to Data and Analytics.
Demonstrate executive presence
column2: can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders

column1: Strong organizational skills, ability to work under tight deadlines and produce high quality deliverables
Demonstrate excellence in research and writing ability
Strong written and verbal proficiency, analytical and presentation skills
column2: ability to engage clients and respond effectively to questions

column1: Proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data
column2: can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges

column1: Strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply
Subject matter expert comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements
Strong business and financial acumen
Deep knowledge of the global and competitive landscape within subject area as well as the interplay in that market
Ability to work independently, while also being intrinsically motivated to collaborate across teams and support the workflow of others, in a multicultural global team
Learning agile and adept with navigating highly matrixed environments
Ability to represent Gartner's research methodology and strategies effectively at all levels
Willingness and ability to travel up to 25% (where applicable)
Who you are:

You came from a Data & Analytics background and may have been a hands-on practitioner in the past but as your career progressed you may have transitioned into a leadership role, where you started leading teams or teams of teams.
You understand the bigger picture and the full lifecycle of data where considerations are made in governance, quality, integration, reusability, and management.
You are proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data
column2: can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges.

column1: You enjoy learning and being challenged intellectually on new topic areas or adjustments to previously held beliefs.
You are versatile and able to pivot to new topics to match the challenges faced by our clients.
You are a strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply.
You are a subject matter expert who is comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements.
You can demonstrate executive presence and can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders.
What makes Gartner Research a GREAT fit for you?
You are a team player who values expert insights, bold ideas and intellectual courage.
You are always learning and looking to discover what’s next in technology.
You pursue personal excellence through team collaboration and consensus.
You love to shape ideas and business-related recommendations to solve clients’ biggest challenges.
Who are we?
At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
What do we offer?
Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
Job Requisition ID:97651
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.

For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

<section data-max-lines=""5"" class=""show-more-less-html"">
<div class=""show-more-less-html__markup show-more-less-html__markup--clamp-after-5
relative overflow-hidden"">

About the role:

Gartner Analysts are industry thought leaders who create must-have research, market predictions and best practices for a broad range of world-leading organizations. A Director serves as a leader within Gartner’s Research and Advisory sector, establishing oneself as a credible voice within their designated market at local, regional and global levels.

Utilizing exceptional research and analytical skills, a Senior Director plays a significant role in producing pragmatic and provocative research which Gartner clients consume and apply to propel their business toward key objectives. They are a trusted source of advice for clients, reinforcing Gartner’s value every day by engaging them via in-person meetings, virtual meetings, sales support visits and Gartner conferences to discuss complex client challenges and offer appropriate recommendations.

The successful candidate is a subject matter expert in Master Data Management (MDM) and understands its application across people, processes, and technologies. The candidate will focus on written and customer-facing deliverables to support Data &
column2:
Analytics Leaders who face the challenges of improving/establishing/reviving MDM initiatives. This role will require in depth knowledge of the MDM Market in addition to a strategic level understanding of the topic.

What you will do:

  • Create innovative, thought provoking, and highly leveraged “must-have research” content
  • Develop new research and ideas through thought leadership and offer compelling, actionable approaches to client's needs and requests that accelerate the client's ability to act
  • Develop in-depth analysis to identify the root cause of a client’s barriers or overall needs and reframe thinking to drive strategy forward
  • Demonstrate thought leadership in establishing research positions across a team of analysts
  • Bring provocative, independent insights to Gartner leaders that can evolve the course of a research agenda
  • Research, analyze and predict market trends and shifts to provide clients and vendors with actionable insights
  • Provide clients and prospects with actionable advice aligned to their designated content area via virtual or face-to-face interactions
  • Create and deliver high value presentation materials on and off stage for Gartner events, industry and professional association conferences, and client briefings
  • Support Research and Sales: Provide sales support serving as voice of the market to help research teams create content and to drive engagement with clients to make progress against their critical priorities to grow their business
  • Provide high quality and timely research content peer review
  • Build credibility as an industry expert to represent Gartner research, methodology and strategy
  • Actively participate in innovation, ideation, and research discussions and collaborate effectively with peers in the research community
  • Identify research process improvements or develop new processes that help the team and Research &
column3:
Advisory provide excellent service delivery
  • Be a mentor and a coach by supporting more junior team members
  • Be client-centric while actively seeking to help clients engage regularly and often with Gartner research and interactions

    • What you will need:

    • Subject matter expertise, with demonstrated knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) Strategy.
    • Deep understanding of the MDM market including (but not limited to): who the key players are, what core capabilities are required, the evolution of the market.
    • Detailed knowledge of one or more MDM Product(s), hands on experience of implementing an MDM solution is a plus.
    • Bachelor's Degree, Advanced Professional Qualification, or 10+ years direct experience in a field related to Data and Analytics.
    • Demonstrate executive presence
column4:
can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders
  • Strong organizational skills, ability to work under tight deadlines and produce high quality deliverables
  • Demonstrate excellence in research and writing ability
  • Strong written and verbal proficiency, analytical and presentation skills
column5:
ability to engage clients and respond effectively to questions
  • Proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data
column6:
can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges
  • Strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply
  • Subject matter expert comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements
  • Strong business and financial acumen
  • Deep knowledge of the global and competitive landscape within subject area as well as the interplay in that market
  • Ability to work independently, while also being intrinsically motivated to collaborate across teams and support the workflow of others, in a multicultural global team
  • Learning agile and adept with navigating highly matrixed environments
  • Ability to represent Gartner's research methodology and strategies effectively at all levels
  • Willingness and ability to travel up to 25% (where applicable)

    • Who you are:

    • You came from a Data &
column7:
Analytics background and may have been a hands-on practitioner in the past but as your career progressed you may have transitioned into a leadership role, where you started leading teams or teams of teams.
  • You understand the bigger picture and the full lifecycle of data where considerations are made in governance, quality, integration, reusability, and management.
  • You are proficient in analyzing and synthesizing data
column8:
can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges.
  • You enjoy learning and being challenged intellectually on new topic areas or adjustments to previously held beliefs.
  • You are versatile and able to pivot to new topics to match the challenges faced by our clients.
  • You are a strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply.
  • You are a subject matter expert who is comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements.
  • You can demonstrate executive presence and can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders.

    • What makes Gartner Research a GREAT fit for you?

    • You are a team player who values expert insights, bold ideas and intellectual courage.
    • You are always learning and looking to discover what’s next in technology.
    • You pursue personal excellence through team collaboration and consensus.
    • You love to shape ideas and business-related recommendations to solve clients’ biggest challenges.

    Who are we?

    At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.

    Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

    Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.

    What makes Gartner a great place to work?

    Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.

    We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.

    Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

    We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.

    What do we offer?

    Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

    In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.

    Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

    The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

    Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.

4248028076,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/work-from-home-italy-at-telus-digital-4248028076?position=45&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=Xtvv9LFgORpPQ5WKQDow3g%3D%3D,Work from Home Italy,TELUS Digital,"Latium, Italy","Ready to ditch the traditional 9-5 grind? If you are an Italian speaker living in Italy join our community as a Media Search Analyst, set your own flexible schedule and complete engaging tasks with an innovative web-based evaluation tool!
What You’ll Do As A Media Search Analyst:
Assess diverse media categories: music, books, podcasts, videos, and more.
Evaluate app store content, ensuring search result accuracy and relevance.
Utilize your cultural knowledge and market expertise to validate query intent.
Why Join the AI Community?
Be part of the global and diverse TELUS Digital AI Community with 1M+ global contributors.
Support machine learning for world-leading brands with no prior professional experience.
Make use of your communication and analytical skills and enjoy extra income with great flexibility!
Basic Requirement and Assessment:
Full Professional Proficiency in Italian and English and being a resident on Italy for the past year, aware of local media and trends.
An active Apple ID email address is essential, ownership of an Apple device and familiarity with Apple products.
Complete ID verification at your convenience within a specific timeframe and pass an open book qualification exam with guidelines provided.
Join us today and help revolutionize digital media content!

What You’ll Do As A Media Search Analyst:

  • Assess diverse media categories: music, books, podcasts, videos, and more.
  • Evaluate app store content, ensuring search result accuracy and relevance.
  • Utilize your cultural knowledge and market expertise to validate query intent.


Why Join the AI Community?

  • Be part of the global and diverse TELUS Digital AI Community with 1M+ global contributors.
  • Support machine learning for world-leading brands with no prior professional experience.
  • Make use of your communication and analytical skills and enjoy extra income with great flexibility!


Basic Requirement and Assessment:

  • Full Professional Proficiency in Italian and English and being a resident on Italy for the past year, aware of local media and trends.
  • An active Apple ID email address is essential, ownership of an Apple device and familiarity with Apple products.
  • Complete ID verification at your convenience within a specific timeframe and pass an open book qualification exam with guidelines provided.


Join us today and help revolutionize digital media content!

4279877365,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analytics-engineer-at-immobiliare-it-4279877365?position=48&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=tOx1Iwe5f5Rx6qAThglSmQ%3D%3D,Data Analytics Engineer,Immobiliare.it,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Immobiliare.it S.p.A. is an Italian group composed of companies specializing in Digital Tech services for the sale and rental of real estate, aimed at individuals, real estate professionals, banking institutions and financial sector operators.

Founded in 2005, Immobiliare.it, the No. 1 real estate portal in Italy, has expanded its offering with specialized portals such as Trovacasa.it, MioAffitto and LuxuryEstate.com, dedicated to luxury properties.

Immobiliare.it Insights, the company's proptech division, offers digital advisory, insights and data diligence services to banks, investors and appraisers. A leading player in Italy in the mortgage sector, the group includes Immobiliare.it Mutui, specializing in remote credit brokerage, Euroansa with a network of over 800 credit brokers throughout the country and Genio Diligence, a company focused on credit risk and fraud prevention for brokers and financial institutions. The group is also present in foreign markets in Spain (Pisos.com, Indomio.es and Enalquiler.com), Greece (Spitogatos.gr, Indomio.gr), Slovenia (Nekretnine.net) and Croatia (Crozilla.com and Indomio.hr).
We are looking for a Data Analytics Engineer to join our Marketing team.
What You Will Do

As a Data Analytics Engineer, you will contribute to the management of our marketing data platform. Your mission will be to architect, build, and manage the infrastructure and flows that allow the marketing team to turn data into a strategic asset. Your responsibilities will include:

platform Architecture & Management: Design, build, and maintain a scalable and robust marketing data platform using cloud technologies (GCP, AWS) and modern open-source tools. You will be responsible for the entire data stack, from ingestion to analytics
data Pipeline Orchestration: Develop and manage resilient data pipelines. You will ensure data is ingested, modelled, and delivered reliably to power our marketing analytics and data products

data Product Development: Build and deploy end-to-end marketing data products. This involves integrating internal data with a wide array of external sources, such as market trends from Google searches, economic indicators, and competitive intelligence from platforms like Similarweb, data.ai, and Semrush. You will be responsible for proactively discovering and implementing the best methods to leverage data for providing value to the business.
Who you are:
graduate in Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Physics
analytical mindset with a problem solving approach
curious and passionate about business, marketing and tech platforms
fluent in English and working knowledge of Italian.
Hard requirements:
Python
SQL
Nice to have:
familiarity with GCP or AWS
experience with Data Modelling tools (dbt, SQLMesh, Dataform)
familiarity with Airflow
knowledge of containerization and container orchestration (e.g: Docker, Kubernetes)
basic knowledge of IaC (Terraform) and DevOps best practices.
About our team
Our team is responsible for all marketing activities of our Group: Immobiliare.it (Italy), Indomio.es (Spain), Immotop.lu (Luxembourg), Crozilla.com (Croatia) and LuxuryEstate (Global).
We focus mainly on:

Performance Marketing: we design, create and manage campaigns with different business objectives (e.g. user acquisition and engagement, lead generation and brand awareness). We are one of the top advertisers in our markets, we collaborate with the best partners and our strong relationship with them allow us to develop ad-hoc projects and to access new features, products and technologies before they’re widely released

Analytics: our products generate hundreds of millions of events every day, by analysing these interactions we can learn about our customers and their experience, optimise marketing investments, uncover new opportunities, and support data-driven decision-making

Market and Competitor Insights: we study the real estate market and our industry to uncover emerging trends, discover business opportunities and forecast demand as accurately as possible to stay ahead of the curve
Projects: we drive growth, operational and technological improvements working cross-team and cross-competence (Tech, Product, Sales, PR & Content teams).
What we offer:
a young and dynamic work environment
an opportunity in a fast-growing company
paid internship contract or fixed contract
ticket restaurants
free coffee and fresh fruit every day
break room with a foosball table
office located in the centre of Rome (Termini).
This announcement is addressed to people of any sex, pursuant to laws 903/77 and 125/91, and to people of all ages and all nationalities, pursuant to legislative decrees 215/03 and 216/03.

4274307689,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-artificial-intelligence-junior-researcher-at-engineering-group-4274307689?position=49&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=mKTRYgJRhuoaWozHxR%2FJsA%3D%3D,Data & Artificial Intelligence Junior Researcher,Engineering Group,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Cosa Ti Proponiamo

All’interno della divisione Digital Technologies nel Laboratorio Ricerca & Innovazione Data & Analytics siamo alla ricerca di talenti motivati per il ruolo di Data & Artificial Intelligence Junior Researcher.

Nel Laboratorio Ricerca & Innovazione Data & Analytics siamo impegnati su numerosi temi di ricerca che fanno uso di metodologie e tecnologie basate su tecniche di Artificial Intelligence, big data, gestione della conoscenza, analitiche avanzate, digital twin, cybersecurity, volte all’innovazione di settori strategici per la Comunità Europea, quali la sicurezza dei cittadini e la difesa dei suoi confini, la protezione delle infrastrutture critiche, l’efficientamento dei traporti, lo sviluppo industriale e del settore agroalimentare, la salute ed il wellbeing.

Attraverso un approccio interdisciplinare e collaborativo, nel contesto di programmi nazionali ed europei, realizziamo progetti ambiziosi e di alto impatto per migliorare l'efficienza, la sicurezza e la sostenibilità in un mondo sempre più interconnesso e data-driven.
Con oltre 60 progetti di ricerca attivi in ambito Data, Analytics e AI, siamo una delle realtà più attive nel panorama europeo della Ricerca & Innovazione.

All’interno del laboratorio, il Data & AI Junior Researcher sarà coinvolto in progetti di ricerca ed innovazione per lo sviluppo di soluzioni innovative, in ambiti e settori strategici per Engineering.
Quali saranno le tue attività e responsabilità?
Partecipare attivamente alle attività dei progetti di Ricerca & Innovazione in contesti nazionali ed internazionali.
Studiare, analizzare ed applicare metodi, metodologie, tecniche e strumenti innovativi per soddisfare i requisiti e gli obiettivi dei progetti in cui si è coinvolti.
Contribuire ai risultati di progetto mediante analisi, studi, requisiti, progettazione, report, ecc.
Design e sviluppo di prototipi in collaborazione con ricercatori europei ed in un ambiente multidisciplinare e multiculturale.
Qualifiche e Competenze Richieste
Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria delle Telecomunicazioni, Ingegneria Elettronica
Conoscenza dei principi fondamentali di ingegneria del software, object-orientation, design principles & patterns
Conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione (almeno uno tra Java e Python)
Costituisce un plus la conoscenza di principi, tecniche e metodi di di uno o più tra: (Big) Data management, AI & ML, Digital Twin e/o Cybersecurity
Eccellenti capacità comunicative, sia scritte che orali, in inglese (almeno livello B1).
Capacità di lavorare in modo indipendente e di prendere decisioni informate in situazioni complesse.
Cosa cerchiamo nelle nostre persone?
Ambizione, nel perseguire obiettivi sfidanti e nell'investire sul miglioramento continuo
Proattività, nell’anticipare e affrontare le sfide con iniziativa
Trasparenza, nel comunicare apertamente e fornire feedback costruttivi
Motivazione a migliorare e a crescere insieme agli altri, manifestando apertura al confronto per favorire la crescita collettiva e il raggiungimento degli obiettivi comuni.
Invia la tua candidatura e raccontaci come puoi fare la differenza.
SEDI DI INSERIMENTO
Palermo | Lecce | Roma | Milano | Torino | Bologna | Napoli | Genova
L’annuncio è rivolto a tutti i candidati, senza distinzione di sesso, nel rispetto del Codice delle pari opportunità di cui al D.Lgs. 198/2006 e ss.mm.ii.

column2: Innovazione Data &amp

Artificial Intelligence Junior Researcher.

Nel Laboratorio Ricerca &
column5: Innovazione Data &amp
column6:
Analytics siamo impegnati su numerosi temi di ricerca che fanno uso di metodologie e tecnologie basate su tecniche di Artificial Intelligence, big data, gestione della conoscenza, analitiche avanzate, digital twin, cybersecurity, volte all’innovazione di settori strategici per la Comunità Europea, quali la sicurezza dei cittadini e la difesa dei suoi confini, la protezione delle infrastrutture critiche, l’efficientamento dei traporti, lo sviluppo industriale e del settore agroalimentare, la salute ed il wellbeing.

Attraverso un approccio interdisciplinare e collaborativo, nel contesto di programmi nazionali ed europei, realizziamo progetti ambiziosi e di alto impatto per migliorare l'efficienza, la sicurezza e la sostenibilità in un mondo sempre più interconnesso e data-driven.

Con oltre 60 progetti di ricerca attivi in ambito Data, Analytics e AI, siamo una delle realtà più attive nel panorama europeo della Ricerca &
column7:
Innovazione.

All’interno del laboratorio, il Data &
column8:
AI Junior Researcher sarà coinvolto in progetti di ricerca ed innovazione per lo sviluppo di soluzioni innovative, in ambiti e settori strategici per Engineering.

Quali saranno le tue attività e responsabilità?

column9:

  • Contribuire ai risultati di progetto mediante analisi, studi, requisiti, progettazione, report, ecc.
  • Design e sviluppo di prototipi in collaborazione con ricercatori europei ed in un ambiente multidisciplinare e multiculturale.

column10:
patterns

4282187011,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-lottomatica-4282187011?position=50&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=mbtpixGLI77il6gKKHpTbw%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Lottomatica,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Siamo il Gruppo Lottomatica, leader nel settore del gioco regolamentato in Italia e uno dei maggiori operatori europei, in tutte le aree di attività: scommesse sportive, gioco online e macchine da intrattenimento. Offriamo ai nostri clienti esperienze di gioco sicure e di qualità, attraverso tutti i canali, ponendo la responsabilità e la sostenibilità al centro del business. Essere in Lottomatica è molto più che far parte di un'azienda: significa contribuire a un progetto imprenditoriale grande e responsabile.
Siamo alla ricerca di un profilo che entrerà a far parte del Dipartimento Operations & Technology come Data Scientist.
Principali attività:
Disegnare, progettare, implementare e documentare nuove soluzioni AI a supporto dei processi aziendali.
Contribuire allo sviluppo e all’evoluzione della Data Platform in relazione ad aspetti tecnologici, organizzativi e di processo.
Contribuire alla crescita del patrimonio dati aziendale.
Collaborare con gli altri membri del team al fine di promuovere una cultura organizzativa di gruppo improntata su principi di solidarietà, pragmaticità, efficacia e affiatamento.
Manutenzione, sviluppo ed evoluzione dei modelli attualmente in produzione, assumendone la gestione completa in collaborazione con il team.
Progettazione, implementazione, industrializzazione, manutenzione e monitoraggio di pipeline di machine learning e agenti virtuali in grado di supportare la trasformazione dei processi aziendali.
Relazione diretta col cliente interno per la valutazione dei risultati e la raccolta dei requisiti evolutivi.
Requisiti:
Laurea o diploma in ambito scientifico/informatico/statistico o comprovata esperienza nell’elaborazione di dati e nell’applicazione di modelli statistici/matematici/Machine Learning.
Conoscenza approfondita di algoritmi di Machine Learning e AI (LLM, modelli ad albero, NLP, clustering, neural network, time series, etc).
Conoscenza dei meccanicismi di analisi e preprocessing dei dati e feature engineering per progetti di Machine Learning (streaming e batch).

Capacità di coding e debugging in Pyspark e Python e quindi conoscenza delle principali librerie e frameworks di Machine Learning, soprattutto Spark e MLib, poi MLflow, Dataframe, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Numpy, Pandas, ScikitLearn…
Competenze in modellazione dati, modellazione di esperimenti statistici e conoscenza metodi quantitativi in generale.
Esperienza comprovata nel progettare, implementare e industrializzare soluzioni AI integrate.
Capacità di analisi di problemi di business, dati e contesto. Capacità di effettuare test delle ipotesi, comparazione di modelli, interpretazione e validazione dei risultati.
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.
Sono considerati requisiti preferenziali:
Conoscenza Databricks
Git per il versioning del codice e rudimenti di devops
Conoscenza servizi Azure
Conoscenza Power BI
Esperienza nell’utilizzo degli LLM open
Cosa troverai in Lottomatica:
Opportunità di lavorare nella più grande azienda di scommesse e giochi in Italia e una delle più grandi al mondo
Lavorare in un ambiente molto dinamico e migliorare le proprie competenze acquisendone di nuove
Essere sfidati a fornire soluzioni d'impatto per grandi organizzazioni e avere un impatto diretto sui loro dipendenti
Possibilità di partecipare a progetti di beneficenza, legalità e responsabilità attraverso l'impegno in Fondazione Lottomatica
Un modello di DNA aziendale definito in cui Inclusione, Valore della Diversità, Eccellenza e Collaborazione sono i pilastri
Far parte dell'azienda numero uno al mondo nel settore per impegno ESG
Eccellenti opportunità di crescita.
Cosa offriamo:
Contratto a tempo indeterminato e opportunità di lavoro ibrido
Laptop aziendale
Formazione continua su hard skills e soft skills
Stipendio annuo lordo commisurato all'esperienza (43k)

Lottomatica attua una politica che garantisce pari opportunità e promuove diversità e inclusione, contro ogni forma di discriminazione. In Lottomatica crediamo che ogni persona sia unica e consideriamo la diversity come una fonte di arricchimento personale e organizzativo. Ci impegniamo ogni giorno affinché il nostro sia un ambiente aperto, sicuro e inclusivo, dove ogni persona possa essere pienamente se stessa indipendentemente da genere, religione, sesso, età, etnia, nazionalità, disabilità, stato civile o orientamento sessuale.

We are the Lottomatica Group, leader in regulated gaming in Italy and one of the largest European operators, in all areas of activity: sports betting, online gaming and amusement machines. We offer our customers safe and quality gaming experiences, through all channels, putting responsibility and sustainability at the core of the business. Being in Lottomatica is much more than being part of a company: it means contributing to a great and responsible entrepreneurial project.
We are looking for a profile to join the Operations & Technology Department as Data Scientist.
Main Responsibilities:
• Design, engineer, implement, and document new AI solutions to support business processes.
• Contribute to the development and evolution of the Data Platform in terms of technological, organizational, and process aspects.
• Contribute to the growth of the company's data assets.
• Collaborate with other team members to foster a group organizational culture based on principles of solidarity, pragmatism, effectiveness, and teamwork.
• Maintain, develop, and evolve models currently in production, assuming full management in collaboration with the team.
• Design, implementation, industrialization, maintenance, and monitoring of machine learning pipelines and virtual agents capable of supporting the transformation of business processes.
• Direct contact with internal customers to evaluate results and gather development requirements.
Requirements:
• Degree or diploma in science/computer science/statistics, or proven experience in data processing and the application of statistical/mathematical/machine learning models.
• In-depth knowledge of machine learning and AI algorithms (LLM, tree models, NLP, clustering, neural networks, time series, etc.).
• Knowledge of data analysis and preprocessing mechanisms and feature engineering for machine learning projects (streaming and batch).

• Coding and debugging skills in Pyspark and Python, and therefore knowledge of the main machine learning libraries and frameworks, especially Spark and MLib, as well as MLflow, Dataframe, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Numpy, Pandas, ScikitLearn, etc.
• Expertise in data modeling, statistical experiment modeling, and general knowledge of quantitative methods.
• Proven experience designing, implementing, and industrializing integrated AI solutions.
• Ability to analyze business problems, data, and context. Ability to perform hypothesis testing, model comparison, and result interpretation and validation.
• Good knowledge of English.
Preferred qualifications:
• Knowledge of Databricks
• Git for code versioning and basic devops
• Knowledge of Azure services
• Knowledge of Power BI
• Experience using open LLMs
What you will find in Lottomatica:
Opportunity to work in the largest betting and gaming company in Italy and one of the largest in the world
Work in a very dynamic environment and improve your skills while acquiring new ones
Being challenged to provide impactful solutions for large organisations and have a direct impact on their employees
Opportunity to participate in charity, legality and responsibility projects through engagement in Fondazione Lottomatica
A defined corporate DNA model in which Inclusion, Value of Diversity, Excellence and Collaboration are the pillars
Being part of the world's number one company in the industry for ESG commitment
Excellent growth opportunities.
What we offer:
Permanent contract and hybrid job opportunities
Company laptop
Ongoing training on hard skills and soft skills
Gross annual salary commensurate with experience from 43K.

Lottomatica implements a policy that guarantees equal opportunities and promotes diversity and inclusion, against all forms of discrimination. At Lottomatica we believe that each person is unique and we consider diversity as a source of personal and organizational enrichment. We strive every day for ours to be an open, safe and inclusive environment, where each person can be fully himself or herself regardless of gender, religion, sex, age, ethnicity, nationality, disability, marital status or sexual orientation.

4264826822,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/work-from-home-italy-at-telus-digital-4264826822?position=51&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=suCersbeQykWxFQbwIMnbA%3D%3D,Work from Home Italy,TELUS Digital,"Aprilia, Latium, Italy","Ready to ditch the traditional 9-5 grind? If you are an Italian speaker living in Italy join our community as a Media Search Analyst, set your own flexible schedule and complete engaging tasks with an innovative web-based evaluation tool!
What You’ll Do As A Media Search Analyst:
Assess diverse media categories: music, books, podcasts, videos, and more.
Evaluate app store content, ensuring search result accuracy and relevance.
Utilize your cultural knowledge and market expertise to validate query intent.
Why Join the AI Community?
Be part of the global and diverse TELUS Digital AI Community with 1M+ global contributors.
Support machine learning for world-leading brands with no prior professional experience.
Make use of your communication and analytical skills and enjoy extra income with great flexibility!
Basic Requirement and Assessment:
Full Professional Proficiency in Italian and English and being a resident on Italy for the past year, aware of local media and trends.
An active Apple ID email address is essential, ownership of an Apple device and familiarity with Apple products.
Complete ID verification at your convenience within a specific timeframe and pass an open book qualification exam with guidelines provided.
Join us today and help revolutionize digital media content!

relative overflow-hidden"">

Ready to ditch the traditional 9-5 grind? If you are an Italian speaker living in Italy join our community as a Media Search Analyst, set your own flexible schedule and complete engaging tasks with an innovative web-based evaluation tool!


What You’ll Do As A Media Search Analyst:

  • Assess diverse media categories: music, books, podcasts, videos, and more.
  • Evaluate app store content, ensuring search result accuracy and relevance.
  • Utilize your cultural knowledge and market expertise to validate query intent.


Why Join the AI Community?

  • Be part of the global and diverse TELUS Digital AI Community with 1M+ global contributors.
  • Support machine learning for world-leading brands with no prior professional experience.
  • Make use of your communication and analytical skills and enjoy extra income with great flexibility!


Basic Requirement and Assessment:

  • Full Professional Proficiency in Italian and English and being a resident on Italy for the past year, aware of local media and trends.
  • An active Apple ID email address is essential, ownership of an Apple device and familiarity with Apple products.
  • Complete ID verification at your convenience within a specific timeframe and pass an open book qualification exam with guidelines provided.


Join us today and help revolutionize digital media content!

4291329619,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/monitoring-and-reporting-officer-at-idlo-international-development-law-organization-4291329619?position=54&pageNum=0&refId=P%2FOD8IGa6Z70bWpw0V%2BuSw%3D%3D&trackingId=vm6AONF5QF90Wj5OR8KBxg%3D%3D,Monitoring and Reporting Officer,IDLO - International Development Law Organization,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Overview & Responsibilities

Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) exercises conducted at IDLO follow the international OECD DAC standards. Within this context, IDLO strives to strengthen and coordinate its internal project monitoring system across all its field activities. Project monitoring is an integral part of the project cycle and a pre-requisite for successful results-based management (RBM). By periodically assessing the extent of the overall project progress (at the input, output and outcome level), it generates important information on the project advancement and allows for necessary adjustments. It also generates important data for a higher level of appraisals as, inter alia , mid-term reviews and (impact) evaluations.

Under the direct supervision of the Consortium Programme Lead, the Monitoring and Reporting Officer works in close collaboration with the country office to collect and analyze all data collection which will enable the programme in question to be evaluated as best possible and highlight areas that need to improvement.
Monitoring and Evaluation
Support the Consortium Programme Lead with the analysis of baseline data and the development of narratives, SMART indicators, and targets

Support in designing/revising the Program M&E Framework including: Theory of Change, logical model, logical framework, key performance indicators, M&E matrix, risk-management plan, and data collection tools

Support the implementation of the Programme M&E Framework, analyzing the information captured through the logical framework, the risk management plan, and the other data collection tools. Facilitate the identification of information/data to be included in the donor programme reports
Aggregate, analyze and upload training data in the Training Information Management System (TIMS)
Support evaluation teams, sharing relevant documentation, and facilitating in-country visits.
Regularly review progress, and liaise with the Program Team to identify necessary programmatic changes to enhance program effectiveness
Reporting
Analyze TIMS data and summarize information to be included in donor program reports
Support Field Programme Coordinators to develop Real-Time Monitoring reports, aggregating and analyzing data included in the technical reports submitted by IDLO’s Consultants:
Facilitate final review of donor programme reports, ensuring that data captured through the M&E Framework is included
Support the Programme Manager to develop success stories and other knowledge management products
Job Requirements
Education and Work Experience
Undergraduate degree in Social Sciences, International Relations, Economics, Business Administration, Statistics, or related studies is required.
At least 3 years of experience in international technical assistance programming in performance monitoring and reporting roles required. Prior work experience in rule of law programming an asset.
Languages
Excellent oral and writing skills in English. Ukrainian is an asset.
Skills & Abilities
Demonstrated knowledge of M&E frameworks, data analysis, synthesis, and report writing
Excellent knowledge of M&E standards (in particular the OECD DAC framework).
Excellent understanding of key performance indicators, including formulation and tracking
Demonstrated capacity to use project M&E tools to monitor programme results
Computer skills demonstrating competency in managing complex data-sets is a plus.
Proficiency in impact-oriented storytelling and report writing
Willingness to travel to the field
Ability to respond timely to queries and provide feedback
Ability to work under pressure with tight deadlines, flexibility and focus on results
Self-motivated and dynamic, willing, and able to take initiative to assist the organization to achieve its objectives
Terms & Conditions

For this internationally recruited position, IDLO shall offer the selected candidate an Affiliate contract for 12 months, with the possibility of extension, subject to performance and availability of funding.
IDLO shall offer the suitable candidate an annual salary in the range of EUR 37,762 as well as additional benefits in accordance with IDLO Employee Regulations and Rules.

IDLO benefits include Provident Fund (IDLO contribution 14%) medical insurance and leave entitlements in accordance with IDLO Employee Regulations and Rules. Relocation and installation allowance is available for internationally recruited employees.
Applications will be screened on a regular basis
column2: a qualified applicant might be recruited before the deadline. In the interest of making the most effective use of resources, only short-listed candidates will be contacted during the selection process.

column1: IDLO is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We welcome applications of qualified candidates of all backgrounds. Female candidates are strongly encouraged to apply for IDLO vacancies.

IDLO does not tolerate sexual exploitation or abuse, any kind of harassment, including harassment of a sexual nature, or discrimination. As such, IDLO will conduct careful reference and background checks of all selected candidates as part of its selection process.
Application Deadline: September 9,2025
